Notification Title: Planned Full & Partial Overnight Closures of the Battery Park Underpass thru 2/13 (MN)
Email Body: Notification issued 2/1/16 at 3:00 PM. To facilitate post-Sandy restoration, full and partial overnight closures of the Battery Park Underpass North and South Tubes in Manhattan, one direction at a time, will continue Mondays to Saturdays through February 13, 2016.. A single lane will be closed Mondays through Thursdays starting at 10:00 PM, followed by full tube closures from midnight to 5:00 AM the next morning. Full closures will also be in effect on Saturday mornings from 1:00 AM to 8:00 AM. The South Tube will be closed February 1-3 and February 8-12, and the North Tube will be closed February 3-6 and February 13. Variable message signs are in place to alert motorists. For more information, please visit: http://i.imgur.com/YWINlG2.jpg.

One lane will be open northbound toward the George Washington Bridge.

Notification Title: SBS Recovery Notification for Superstorm Sandy (CW)
Email Body:
Notification issued 1/29/16 at 9:00 AM.  In order to continue recovery efforts for small businesses from Hurricane Sandy, the President signed into law the Recovery Improvements for Small Entities (RISE) After Disaster Act of 2015, which gives the SBA Administrator the authority to make disaster loans for a period of one year. The Small Business Association offers Economic Injury Disaster Loans to help meet working capital needs caused by the disaster.  Survivors may apply online using the Electronic Loan Application (ELA) via SBAs secure website at https://disasterloan.sba.gov/ela.  The filing deadline to return applications for physical property damage is December 1, 2016. The deadline to return economic injury applications is December 1, 2016.

Additional details on the locations of recovery centers and the loan application process can be obtained by calling the SBA Customer Service Center at 800-659-2955 (800-877-8339 for the deaf and hard-of-hearing) or by sending an email to disastercustomerservice@s

Notification issued 1/28/16 at 4:21 PM. New York City Emergency Management has confirmed with the United States Geological Survey that the previously reported ''earthquake activity'' was a sonic boom from an aircraft near the town of Hammonton, New Jersey and was NOT an earthquake.

Notification issued 1/28/16 at 3:19 PM. New York City is aware of unconfirmed reports of an earthquake in the New York City / New Jersey area. The New York City Emergency Management has consulted the US Geological Survey and the Earth Observatory at Columbia University. Neither has identified any seismic activity at this time. New York City Emergency Management will continue to monitor the condition and issue updates as necessary.

Notification issued 1/27/16 at 3:00 PM. New Yorkers are reminded that Mayor de Blasio has issued a travel advisory through Friday night, January 29, 2016. As nighttime temperatures drop to near or below freezing tonight through Friday, melted snow can turn to black ice, causing dangerously slick driving conditions. The National Weather Service forecasts daytime temperatures today through Friday to range between low-30s to low-40s, but nighttime temperatures will fall to near or below freezing, creating the potential for icy road conditions. New Yorkers are encouraged to exercise caution when walking and driving as some ice may not be visible. 
 
For more information and safety tips, please see the following press release: http://on.nyc.gov/1OL273G.

Notification Title: Department Of Buildings: Precautions during Snow and Ice Melting (CW)
Email Body: Notification issued 1/25/16 at 3:00 PM. In preparation for melting snow, the New York City Department of Buildings is reminding all builders, contractors, and property owners to secure their properties from hazardous conditions. Falling icicles and snow masses from buildings can be dangerous in a dense city such as New York, and can injure pedestrians, damage vehicles, and disrupt transportation if streets must be closed for safety reasons. If sites are not safely secured, the Department of Buildings will take enforcement action with the issuance of violations if necessary. Please call 311 to report non-compliant conditions or 911 to report emergencies at construction sites or buildings. Please see the attached document for additional instructions and information or visit: www.nyc.gov/buildings Document: http://i.imgur.com/WmBfSQq.jpg

Notification Title: Winter Storm Update - Alternate Side Parking & Trash Removal (CW)
Email Body:
Notification issued at 1/24/16 at 5:40 PM. Mayor Bill de Blasio today announced that the suspension of Alternate Side Parking rules has been extended until Monday, February 1. In addition, cars currently parked adjacent to schools in ''No Standing - School Hours'' zones are permitted to remain there until Wednesday, January 27. 

Drivers are encouraged to keep their cars parked, avoid unnecesssary driving, and avoid shoveling snow into the street during storm clean-up. 

Curbside collection of trash and recycling will be suspended on Monday, January 25 as Sanitation crew focus on snow removal.

For more information, please the following press release: on.nyc.gov/1Pw3FMi.

Notification Title: Coastal Flood Update (Bronx and Northern Queens)
Email Body:
Notification issued 1/22/16 at 6:35 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Coastal Flood Warning for The Bronx and Northern Queens on 1/23 from 10AM-2PM and from 9PM-1AM for coastal locations adjacent to Western and Central Long Island Sound. 

Tidal departures of 2.5 to 3 feet above astronomical tides are expected Saturday morning and tidal departures of 3 to 3.5 feet above astronomical tides are expected Saturday night. 

A Coastal Flood Warning indicates that flooding is expected or occurring. Beach erosion and localized flooding may occur. Coastal residents should be alert for rising waters and take action to protect property. For more information, please visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

Alert issued on 1/22/16 at 3:30 PM. Mayor De Blasio has declared a Winter Weather Emergency as of 8:00AM Saturday, January 23, 2016. New York City is expecting 12-18 inches of snow, with sustained winds of 25 to 30mph with gusts up to 50 MPH. These weather conditions will create dangerous travel conditions including slippery roads and limited visibilities. New Yorkers are strongly advised to stay off the roads except in the event of an emergency. If you must travel, use mass transit.

Notification issued 1/22/16 at 11:52 AM. The National Weather Service has issued the following Coastal Flood products for NYC areas:

Southern Queens, Brooklyn, & Staten Island: Coastal Flood Warning in effect from  6AM - 12PM on 1/23 and again from 5PM until midnight 1/23 for coastal locations adjacent to the south shore of New York City along New York Harbor. Tidal departures are forecast to be three to four feet above normal. Beach erosion and localized flooding may occur.

Bronx, Northern Queens: Coastal Flood Advisory is in effect from 10AM - 2PM on 1/23. Tidal departures are forecast to be one and a half to two feet Saturday morning and two and a half to three and a half feet Saturday night.Beach erosion and localized flooding may occur.  

Manhattan: Coastal Flood Advisory in effect from 6Am - 10AM on 1/23. Tidal departures are forecast to be two to three feet Saturday morning and three to four feet Saturday evening.Localized flooding may occur.

A Coastal Flood Warning indicates that flooding

Notification Title: Missing Child Alert Cancellation - Tahir Williams (CW)

Notification issued on 1/22/16 at 7:40 AM. New York City Emergency Management has issued a hazardous travel advisory for Saturday, January 23, 2016 through Sunday, January 24, 2016. The National Weather Service has issued a Blizzard Warning for all of New York City from Saturday morning through Sunday afternoon. The system is forecast to bring heavy snow along with strong and potentially damaging winds, and will create slick and hazardous travel conditions. Total snow accumulation is expected to be between 8 - 12''. Use caution when driving and allow for additional travel time, as roads will be dangerous due to the weather conditions. Notification issued 1/21/16 at 6:10 PM. The National Weather Service has issued the following Coastal Flood Watches for various NYC areas. In addition to the timing and locations listed below, minor coastal flooding is also forecast during the Saturday morning high tide cycle.

Manhattan, Southern Queens, Brooklyn, & Staten Island: Coastal Flood Watch in effect from 6PM-11PM on 1/23 for coastal locations adjacent to the south shore of western and central Long Island and New York Harbor. Tidal departures are forecast to be three to four feet above normal. Beach erosion may occur.

Bronx, Northern Queens: Coastal Flood Watch in effect from 10PM on 1/23 to 1AM on 1/24 for coastal locations adjacent to the western and central Long Island Sound. Tidal departures are forecast to be three to four feet above normal. 

During a Coastal Flood Watch, moderate coastal flooding is possible, including the potential for widespread flooding of vulnerable shore roads and/or basements. Coastal residents should be alert f

Notification Title: Missing Child Alert - Tahir Williams M/B/17 (CW)
Email Body: Alert issued 1/21/16 at 4:35 PM. The NYPD Missing Person Squad has issued a Missing Child Alert in regard to the disappearance of Tahir Williams, a 17-year-old black male, from The Bronx. He is described as being 6'0'' tall and 180lbs with black hair and brown eyes. He was last seen at his residence on East 184th Street in The Bronx at approximately 8:00 AM on January 21, 2016, and was wearing a blue jacket, a black baseball cap, gray jeans, green sneakers, and a black hoodie sweatshirt. He may be in the local area and is suicidal. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/BxwgXJq.jpg. If you see Mr. Williams, please call the NYPD Missing Person Squad at (718) 220-5216, or call 9-1-1.

Notification issued 1/21/16 at 3:50 PM. The New York City Department of Transportation, in conjunction with the Department of Sanitation, today announced that Alternate Side Parking Regulations will be suspended Saturday, January 23, 2016 to facilitate snow removal. Alternate Side Parking will remain in effect Friday, January 22, 2016. Payment at parking meters will remain in effect throughout the City. For more information, please visit http://on.nyc.gov/1cAl5rj.

To view this message in American Sign Language (ASL) with audio and subtitles, please visit: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G4YXMLzpUII.

Notification Title: Three Alarm Fire - Paerdegat 14th Street & East 80th Street (BK)
Email Body: Notification issued 1/21/16 at 3:28 PM. Emergency personnel are on the scene of a three alarm fire located at Paerdegat 14th Street and East 80th Street in Brooklyn. Expect smoke, traffic delays, and a presence of emergency personnel and vehicles in the area. The NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene advises avoiding smoke exposure from structural fires by closing windows while indoors and reducing outdoor activity where smoke is present. People with heart or breathing conditions such as asthma may be more sensitive and should seek immediate medical attention if they experience a worsening of their condition, shortness of breath, or chest pains.

Notification issued 1/19/16 at 12:52 PM. New York City is forecast to experience intermittent wind gusts in excess of 40 MPH. During periods of high winds, residents should use caution when walking or driving high profile vehicles. Winds at these speeds can cause flying debris, turn unsecured objects into projectiles, and cause power outages. To prepare, charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. For the latest weather information, please visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

Notification Title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert - Robert Lichtman (CW)
Email Body:
Alert issued 1/17/16 at 9:02 PM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert in regard to the disappearance of Robert Lichtman, a 78-year-old white male with dementia, from Mount Vernon, NY. He may be in need of medical attention.

Mr. Lichtman is described as being 6'0'' tall and 240lbs with gray hair and brown eyes. 

He was last seen in Mount Vernon at approximately 1:00 PM on 1/17 wearing black jeans, a tan sweater, and driving a 2014 tan Subaru Forester with New York (Military Airborne Plate) registration DRRML.

A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/uwe4vA8.jpg. 

If you see Mr. Lichtman or the vehicle, please call the Mount Vernon City Police Department at (914) 665-2500 or call 9-1-1.
Notification issued 1/17/16 at 7:33 PM. Due to a motor vehicle collision, all lanes of the Bayonne Bridge are closed in both directions. Allow for additional travel time.

Notification Title: Water Main Break - East 167th Street & Prospect Avenue (BX)
Email Body: Notification issued 1/17/16 at 6:50 PM. The NYC Department of Environmental Protection is on the scene of a water main break at the intersection of East 167 Street and Prospect Avenue in The Bronx. Water service in the vicinity has been temporarily disrupted. DEP is in the process of making repairs. For more information please call 311.

Notification issued 1/17/16 at 3:00 PM. The New York City Department of Transportation Division of Bridges is replacing the concrete deck of the 149th Street Bridge over the Long Island Railroad beginning January 18, 2016. The bridge will be closed to all traffic, including vehicles, pedestrians, and cyclists, until further notice. The work is expected to be completed on or before June 30, 2016, but is weather dependent and may be extended if necessary. For more information, please visit http://i.imgur.com/RARCJDt.jpg. For detour information, please visit http://i.imgur.com/RvAozTJ.jpg.

Notification Title: Planned Full & Partial Overnight Closures of the Battery Park Underpass thru 1/23 (MN)
Email Body: Notification issued 1/11/16 at 5:00 PM. To facilitate post-Sandy restoration, full and partial overnight closures of the Battery Park Underpass South Tube in Manhattan will occur Mondays to Saturdays through January 22, 2016 with the exception of January 18th (MLK Day). A single lane will be closed Mondays through Thursdays starting at 10:00 PM, followed by full tube closures from midnight to 5:00 AM the next morning. Full closures will also be in effect on Saturday mornings from 1:00 AM to 8:00 AM. The North Tube will be closed on January 23, only. Variable message signs are in place to alert motorists. For more information, please visit: http://i.imgur.com/xVhlpub.jpg.

Expect to see FDNY and NYPD personnel in action. To learn more about CERT, visit http://www.NYC.gov/CERT.

A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/Dk2FY00.png. If you see Mr. Reinat, please call 9-1-1.

Notification issued 12/19/15 at 5:37 PM. New York City is forecast to experience intermittent wind gusts near or in excess of 40 MPH. During periods of high winds, residents should use caution when walking or driving high profile vehicles. Winds at these speeds can cause flying debris, turn unsecured objects into projectiles, and cause power outages. To prepare, charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. For the latest weather information visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

Notification Title: Missing College Student Alert - Nicholas Kollias & Ani Okeke-Ewo
Email Body: Alert issued 12/6/15 at 6:35 PM.  The Rochester City Police Department has issued a Missing College Student Alert for the disappearance of Nicholas Kollias and Ani Okeke-Ewo, students of the University of Rochester (NY) who are missing under suspicious circumstances and may be in danger. They were last seen in the area of Wilson Boulevard in Rochester at 2:00 AM on Saturday December 5. They are believed to be traveling in a silver 2005 BMW X5 with Illinois registration V835470. There is a possibility that there may be another vehicle that may also be traveling with them; a red/orange Mazda 6 with New York registration HBC-1803.  They may still be local.  Nicholas Kollias is described as a white male, 6'0'', 240 lbs with brown hair and eyes. Ani Okeke-Ewo is a Black male, 6'1'', 215 lbs with black hair and brown eyes.  Photo are attached: http://i.imgur.com/Vtyt9Fd.jpg  If seen, call the Rochester City Police Department at (585) 275-3333 or 9-1-1.

Notification Title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult - Willie Jeff M/B/85 (CW)
Email Body:
Alert issued 11/19/15 10:58 AM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for the disappearance of Willie Jeff, an 85-year-old Black male with dementia from Queens, NY. He was last seen driving over the Willis Avenue
Bridge into the Bronx, at approximately 9:25 AM today, November 19. Mr. Jeff was driving a 1998
green Nissan Maxima with New York registration #CH881A. Mr. Jeff is described as 5'6'', 160 lbs., with brown eyes and was last seen wearing a gray shirt, blue jeans with a blue jacket. A photo is attached.  The photo is approximately 20 years old. If seen, call 9-1-1. Photo: http://i.imgur.com/squ6xtk.png

Silver Alert issued 11/19/15 at 3:50 AM.  The NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Houzhi Guo, a 78-year-old Asian male. He is described as being 5'5'', 115lbs.  Mr. Guo was last seen on 11/18/15 at approximately 3:00 PM in the area of Monroe Street and Market Street in Manhattan. He is visiting from China and speaks only Cantonese Chinese. He was last seen wearing black pants, a yellow jacket and grey sneakers. A photo is attached: http://i.imgur.com/UlTx9Y4.jpg.  If seen, call 9-1-1.

Silver Alert issued 11/19/15 at 1:17 AM.  The NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Willie Jeff, an 85-year-old black male. He is described as being 5'6'', 158lbs with brown eyes and salt and pepper hair.  Mr. Jeff was last seen on 11/18/15 at approximately 9:30 AM in the area of Merrick Boulevard and 107th Avenue, Queens driving a 1998 green Nissan Maxima with NY plate CH881A. He was last seen wearing a gray sweatshirt, blue jacket, black jeans and black sneakers.  A photo is attached: http://i.imgur.com/mfPBJ8P.jpg.  If seen, call 9-1-1.

Notification Title: Missing Vulnerable Adult - Robert A. Stevens M/W/66 (CW)
Email Body: Alert issued 11/16/15 8:16 AM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Robert A. Stevens, a 66-year-old white male of Suffern, NY.  He suffers from brain cancer which causes confusion and disorientation.  Mr. Stevens also has trouble speaking and poor coordination. He was last seen at his residence on Hillside Drive at approximately 10:30 PM on November 15 driving a 2010 white Toyota Rav 4 with New York registration # FCJ5219. Mr. Stevens was wearing a light blue t-shirt, blue jeans and possibly brown boat shoes. He may be in need of medical attention. There is no photo is available at this time.  If you see Robert A. Stevens, please call Suffern Village Police Department at (845) 357-2300 or 911.

Notification issued 11/15/15 at 10:45 PM. Due to runway system testing at Newark Liberty International Airport in New Jersey, planned aircraft activity may be visible in parts of lower Manhattan between midnight and 2:00 AM tonight, 11/15. This will include an aircraft flying over the area approximately six times at an estimated altitude of 1,500 feet.

Notification Title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult - Madiha Saleem F/40 (CW)
Email Body: Alert issued 11/15/15 4:24 AM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Madiha Saleem, a 40-year-old female from Westbury, NY. Ms.Saleem is described as being 5'6'' tall and 140lbs, with black hair and black eyes. She has paranoid schizophrenia, is known to give a false name and may be in need of medical attention. She was last seen leaving Astor Place North in Westbury at approximately 7:30 PM on 11/14 wearing a tan bathrobe and flip flops. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/EY7BHSW.png. If you see Ms. Saleem, please call the Nassau County Police Department 3rd Precinct at (516)573-7347 or call 9-1-1.

Notification Title: Two Alarm Fire - West 36th St & 8th Ave (MN)
Email Body: Notification issued 11/14/15 at 5:12 PM. Emergency personnel are on the scene of a two alarm fire located at West 36th Street and 8th Avenue in Manhattan. Expect smoke, traffic delays, and a presence of emergency personnel and vehicles in the area. The NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene advises avoiding smoke exposure from structural fires by closing windows while indoors and reducing outdoor activity where smoke is present. People with heart or breathing conditions such as asthma may be more sensitive and should seek immediate medical attention if they experience a worsening of their condition, shortness of breath, or chest pains.

Notification Title: Missing Vulnerable Adult - Robert Walker M/W/87 (CW)
Email Body: Alert issued 11/14/15 12:13 AM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Robert Walker, an 87-year-old white male from the town of Westbury in Nassau County. Mr. Walker is described as being 5'7'' tall and 150lbs, with white hair and green eyes. He has dementia and may be in need of medical attention. He was last seen on Church Street in Westbury at approximately 5:00 PM on 11/13 wearing a gray jacket, gray pants, black shoes and a blue and white Mount Lemon baseball cap. Mr. Walker was last seen driving a blue 1989 Buick Century with New York registration 5XV-772. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/hplCfOu.jpg. If you see Mr. Walker, please call the Nassau County Police Department 3rd Police Precinct at (516) 573-7347 or call 9-1-1.

Notification issued 11/13/15 at 10:30 PM. New York City is forecast to experience intermittent wind gusts in excess of 40 MPH. During periods of high winds, residents should use caution when walking or driving high profile vehicles. Winds at these speeds can cause flying debris, turn unsecured objects into projectiles, and cause power outages. To prepare, charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. For the latest weather information visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

Notification issued 11/13/15 at 3:10 PM. Due to large brush fire on the eastern side of Staten Island, residents of southern Manhattan and western Brooklyn may see and smell smoke.

Mr. Schiff was last seen 11/11/15 at approximately 7:00 PM in the area of 33rd Street and 48th Street, Queens, wearing a navy blue jacket, gray sweatshirt and sweatpants, and black sneakers.  A photo is attached: http://i.imgur.com/yZEv5KB.jpg?1.  If seen, call 9-1-1.

Notification Title: Grand Street Bridge Closure: November Saturdays & Sundays (BK/QN)
Email Body: Notification issued 11/6/15 at 3:00 PM.  The NYC Department of Transportation Division of Bridges will close the Grand Street Bridge over Newtown Creek during the day on three weekends to repair underdeck stringers. On November 7, 8, 14, 15, 21 and 22. the bridge will be completely closed to pedestrian and vehicular traffic from 7:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m. Metropolitan Avenue may be used as an alternate route. Variable message signs will be installed to alert motorists.

Notification Title: Missing Vulnerable Adult - Catherine Ruger F/W/87 (CW)
Email Body: Alert issued 11/5/15 at 7:45 PM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Catherine Ruger, an 87-year-old white female with dementia from Bellmore, NY. Ms. Ruger is described as being 5'7'' tall and 120lbs with gray hair and hazel eyes. She may be in need of medical attention. She was last seen in the area of Rutler Street in Bellmore at approximately 2:00 PM on 11/5, wearing a burgundy top, khakis and sandals. Ms. Ruger was driving a gray 2009 Honda Accord with New York registration BGR-9232. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/AbfxCey.jpg. If you see Ms. Ruger, please call the Nassau County Police Department at (516) 573-7347 or 9-1-1.

Ms. Han is described as being 5'2'' tall and 105lbs with black hair and black eyes. She may be in need of medical attention. She was last seen in the area of McGuiness Lane in White Plains at approximately 3:00 PM on 11/2, wearing a gray sweater and gray pants. Notification issued 11/2/15 at 3:00 PM.  The NYC Department of Transportation will be closing the Metropolitan Avenue Bridge over English Kills for five consecutive overnights, November 3 - November 7, 2015, to continue the rehabilitation of the bridge from damage due to Superstorm Sandy. The full closure will take place Tuesday - Friday from 12:01 AM to 5:00 AM, and Saturday from 1:00 AM to 6:00 AM. The closure impacts vehicular, pedestrian and bicycle traffic including the Q54 Metropolitan Avenue bus.  Detour signs will be posted to assist motorists around the closure and there will be Traffic Control Agents posted each night from 11:30 PM until 6:30 AM. For more information: www.facebook.com/MetroSandyBridge or http://imgur.com/imtCRel

Notification issued 10/31/15 at 12:00 PM. Numerous bridge and street closures will be in effect citywide from 7:00 AM to 7:00 PM on Sunday, 11/1/15, in support of the 2015 TCS New York City Marathon, including the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge. In addition, the upper level of the bridge will be closed in both directions beginning at 11:00 PM tonight for roadway preparation. For further information visit: http://www.tcsnycmarathon.org/race-day/course. Also see the attached map of the event route and full list of road closures. For help finding an alternate route, call 511 or visit http://www.511NY.org. For other marathon-related roadway closures throughout the city, call the NYC hotline at 311. Please see the following map of the marathon: http://www.tcsnycmarathon.org/sites/default/files/pictures/TCSNYCM15%20CourseMap%20v3.pdf

To prepare, charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. For the latest weather information visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

Notification issued 10/28/15 at 6:10 PM. New York City is currently experiencing intermittent wind gusts in excess of 40 MPH. During periods of high winds, residents should use caution when walking or driving high profile vehicles. Winds at these speeds can cause flying debris, turn unsecured objects into projectiles, and cause power outages. To prepare, charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. For the latest weather information visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

Notification issued 10/21/15 at 5:00 PM.  The NYC Department of Transportation will be closing the Metropolitan Avenue Bridge in Brooklyn for three consecutive overnights, October 22 - October 24, 2015, to continue rehabilitation from damage due to Superstorm Sandy. The full closures will take place Thursday - Friday from 12:01 AM to 5:00 AM, and Saturday from 1:00 AM to 6:00 AM. The closure impacts vehicular, pedestrian and bicycle traffic, including the Q 54 Metropolitan Avenue bus.  Detour signs will be posted to assist motorists around the closure and there will be Traffic Control Agents posted each night from 11:30 PM until 6:30 AM. Email Body: Notification issued 10/16/15 at 4:30 PM. To facilitate post-Sandy restoration, full and partial overnight closures of the Battery Park Underpass in Manhattan will occur Monday through Saturday, through October 31, 2015. A single lane will be closed Monday through Thursday starting at 10:00 PM, followed by full tube closures from midnight to 5:00 AM the next morning. Full closures will also be in effect on Saturday mornings from 1:00 AM to 8:00 AM. Both lanes in the south tube (West Street to the FDR Drive) will remain open during this period. Notification issued 10/3/15 at 2:13 PM. New York City is forecast to experience intermittent wind gusts in excess of 40 MPH. During periods of high winds, residents should use caution when walking or driving high profile vehicles. Winds at these speeds can cause flying debris, turn unsecured objects into projectiles, and cause power outages. To prepare, charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. For the latest weather information visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

Notification issued 10/2/15 at 4:00 PM. Weather permitting, there will be a parachute jump tomorrow, October 3, at 11:30 AM.  Seven jumpers will exit a US Army aircraft over Liberty State Park in Jersey City, NJ. The activity may be visible from parts of NYC.

Notification issue 10/2/2015 at 2:50 PM. NYC Emergency Management continues to closely monitor Hurricane Joaquin and has put extensive plans in place to deal with the possible effects of the storm on New York City. The latest National Hurricane Center forecast track has Hurricane Joaquin passing well off the eastern coast of the United States through early next week. The current forecast shows no direct impact to New York City. As a result, NYC Emergency Management is adjusting its emergency plans regarding opening shelters and conducting possible evacuations to match the forecast. NYC Emergency Management will continue to have enhanced staffing in place to respond or preempt any potential impacts. Please continue to monitor Notify NYC and local media for the latest information on the storms track, and for the latest forecast, please visit the National Hurricane Center at www.nhc.noaa.gov and the National Weather Service at www.weather.gov/nyc.

During periods of high winds, residents should use caution when walking or driving high profile vehicles. Winds at these speeds can cause flying debris, turn unsecured objects into projectiles, and cause power outages. Individuals who have constructed a Succah for the holiday should take appropriate actions to secure the structure and roofing to prevent damage or injury from flying debris. To prepare, charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. For the latest weather information visit

Notification issued 9/30/15 at 2:52 PM. New York City Emergency Management is continuing to monitor Hurricane Joaquin. The City is holding multiple daily calls with the National Weather Service and the National Hurricane Center.  The City is actively engaged with partner agencies at all levels of government and the private sector in preparation should the storm arrive. The City encourages the public and visitors to stay informed by signing up for Notify NYC, the Citys official source for emergency information, and identify their hurricane evacuation zone by visiting http://gis.nyc.gov/oem/he/index.html or calling 311. NYC Emergency Management continues to monitor the hurricane and keep the public updated as it develops. To learn more about preparing for coastal storms, please visit the Ready New York Guide at http://www.ready.gov/hurricanes.

Notification Title: NYC Emergency Management Issues Travel Advisory (CW)
Email Body:
Notification issued 9/29/15 at 6:15 PM. New York City Emergency Management has issued a travel advisory for Wednesday, 9/30. According to the National Weather Service, a weak frontal system is approaching the New York City area and is expected to bring moderate to heavy rain tonight through Wednesday night. The heaviest period of rain is expected overnight Tuesday through the early morning rush. A total of 1 to 2 inches of rain is expected with this event. Urban flooding is expected in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Flash flooding cannot be ruled out during the periods of heaviest rain.

If you must drive a vehicle, monitor weather and traffic reports for the latest road conditions, drive slowly, and do not drive over flooded roadways. Exercise caution when walking and avoid slippery surfaces, flood waters, and downed power lines.

For more information, please visit http://on.nyc.gov/1PMeOL1 or www.weather.gov/nyc.

Notification issued 9/28/15 at 10:45 PM. On Tuesday, September 29, at 1:00 PM, filming of a TV series will take place on Roosevelt Island in Manhattan. The activity will occur on Tram Plaza Road at the intersection of West Roadway (at the water's edge) and will consist of simulated emergency activity, including the presence of emergency personnel and the firing of prop guns.

Notification Title: NYC Health Department Investigating Legionnaires' Disease (BX)
Email Body: Notification issued 9/28/15 at 4:40 PM. The NYC Health Department is currently investigating a cluster of seven Legionnaires' disease cases in the Morris Park section of The Bronx. This cluster is unrelated to the previous outbreak in The Bronx this summer. Legionnaires' disease cannot be spread from person to person and has not affected New York City's drinking water supply. Groups at high risk for Legionnaires' disease include people who are middle-aged or older (especially cigarette smokers), people with chronic lung disease, and people with weakened immune systems. New Yorkers with respiratory symptoms, such as fever, cough, chills, and difficulty breathing, are advised to promptly seek medical attention. For more information regarding Legionnaires' disease and the NYC Health Department's response, please visit http://on.nyc.gov/1P2aHMF.

Email Body: Notification issued 9/26/15 at 12:00 PM. The Stephen Siller Tunnel to Towers Run/Walk will take place this Sunday, September 27, from 9:30 AM to 2:00 PM. This event starts in Brooklyn at the IKEA parking lot in Red Hook (1 Beard St), proceeds through the Hugh L. Carey Tunnel (formerly Brooklyn-Battery Tunnel) to West Street, north on West St to Liberty St, west on Liberty St through Battery Park City, to end at West St and Vesey St (MN). One tube of the Hugh L. Carey Tunnel will close tonight at 10:00 PM.  The other tube will have one lane open in each direction until tomorrow, 9/27 at 7:45 AM, when both tubes will be fully closed until 3:00 PM for the event. Motorists are advised to use an alternate route and allow for additional travel time.  For more information, please visit http://i.imgur.com/9PDbzfE.jpg or www.mta.info.

AMBER Alert issued 9/17/15 at 11:25 AM. The NYPD has issued an AMBER Alert for Celine Hicks, a 10-year-old black female from Manhattan. She is described as being 5'4'' tall and 120lbs with black hair and brown eyes. She was last seen in Manhattan at 12:56 PM on September 15. She  was last seen wearing a yellow school uniform shirt with Caste Middle School embroidered on the front. She is believed to be endangered and is in the custody of Carlos Hicks (M/B/42) AND Jacqueline Hendricks (F/B/40). They may be operating a 1993 white Chevrolet Lumina with New Mexico registration NGG506. The subjects may be in the Bronx or traveling to New Mexico.  For a photo of the missing, please visit: http://imgur.com/PTVFb0j. If you see Celine, call the NYPD Missing Person Squad at (800) 577-8477, or call 9-1-1.  For updates: http://amber.ny.gov

The NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene advises avoiding smoke exposure from structural fires by closing windows while indoors and reducing outdoor activity where smoke is present. People with heart or breathing conditions such as asthma may be more sensitive and should seek immediate medical attention if they experience a worsening of their condition, shortness of breath, or chest pains.

Notification issued 9/14/15 at 5:30 PM. Two Navy F-18s will conduct a flyover along the Hudson River on Tuesday, September 15th. Beginning at approximately 12:30 PM, the aircraft will travel northbound at an altitude of approximately 2,000 feet past the Verrazano Bridge, the Statue of Liberty, the George Washington Bridge, and will continue to the Tappan Zee Bridge. The aircraft will then turn southbound and travel back down the Hudson River at an altitude of approximately 2,500 feet before exiting the area.

Email Body: Alert issued 9/6/15 at 1:01 AM. She may be in the Harlem area of 125th Street (MN), possibly lost or confused and in need of medical attention. A photo of the missing is available at http://imgur.com/scJLibC. Silver Alert issued 8/31/15 at 5:00 AM.  The NYPD has issued a Silver Alert in regards to the disappearance of Hector Feliciano, a 68 year-old Hispanic male from the South Ozone Park area of Queens.  He is described as being approximately 5'8'' tall and weighing 180 lbs. with brown eyes and salt and pepper hair. Mr. Feliciano was last seen Saturday, August 29, at approximately 8:30 PM in the area of Lefferts Boulevard and 109th Avenue in Queens, wearing a blue polo shirt, blue jeans and brown shoes.  A photo is available at http://i.imgur.com/0wYOC0t.png. If you see Mr. Feliciano, please call 9-1-1 or call Crime Stoppers at 1-800-577-TIPS (8477).  The public can also submit their tips by logging onto the Crime Stoppers website at WWW.NYPDCRIMESTOPPERS.COM or by texting their tips to 274637 (CRIMES) then enter TIP577.

Notification Title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult - Anselm George M/B/75
Email Body: Alert issued 8/28/15 at 3:45 PM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert in regards to the disappearance of Anselm George, a 75-year-old black male with dementia, from Brooklyn, NY. He is described as being 5'6'' tall and 156lbs with gray hair, black eyes, and may appear confused and in need of medical attention. He was last seen in Brooklyn wearing a dark blue baseball hat and driving a gold 2002 Nissan Altima with NY registration PAP-002. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/DINf4wj.jpg. If you see Mr. George, please call 9-1-1.

He was last seen yesterday 8/26/15, at approximately 6:30 PM in the area of 102nd Street and 66th Road, near Forest Hills Hospital in Queens, wearing black slacks, black sneakers, and a brown shirt. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/rlyXJI7.jpg?1. If you see Mr. Petit-Frere, please call 9-1-1.

Notification Title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult - Rita Goodwin F/W/77
Email Body: Alert issued 8/26/15 at 6:12 PM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert in regards to the disappearance of Rita Goodwin, a 77-year-old white female with Alzheimer's, from New Hyde Park, NY. She is described as being 5'3'' tall and 100lbs with grey hair, and blue eyes. She was last seen walking from Hull Avenue towards Aberdeen Road in New Hyde Park at approximately 10:00 AM today. Ms. Goodwin speaks with an Irish accent and was last seen wearing a white shirt, grey pants, and carrying a black purse. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/oge55ai.png. If you see Ms. Goodwin, please call 9-1-1.

Notification Title: Four Aircraft Flyover of the Statue of Liberty and Freedom Tower 8/27 (CW)
Email Body: Notification issued 8/26/15 at 12:00 PM. Tomorrow, August 27, 2015 at approximately 10:30AM there will be a flyover involving four military aircrafts near the Statue of Liberty and Freedom Tower in Lower Manhattan. The event will consist of a B-25, P-51, F-16, and F-22. The planes will converge in New York Harbor and maintain an altitude of 1500 - 2000 feet. The aircrafts will then travel northbound along the Hudson River and land in Newburgh, NY.  A photo of the aircrafts are available at http://i.imgur.com/X5EJ1Kt.jpg.

Alert issued 8/21/15 at 5:25 AM. The National Weather Service has issued a Flash Flood Warning for Brooklyn, Queens and The Bronx until 7:15 AM. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage areas and low lying spots. Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground. For the latest information, visit: http://www.weather.gov/nyc. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1.

He is described as being 5'10'' tall and 165lbs with gray hair,brown eyes, and a vertical scar on his throat. People with heart or breathing conditions such as asthma may be more sensitive and should seek immediate medical attention if they experience a worsening of their condition, shortness of breath, or chest pains.

Alert issued 8/6/15 at 8:00 PM. The NYC Health Commissioner has issued an order to all owners of buildings with cooling towers. If you own a building with a cooling tower please see the following link for information and steps you will need to take: http://on.nyc.gov/1Ec9Fp5.
The City issued this order because of an outbreak of Legionnaires' Disease in the South Bronx. Several cooling towers in the affected neighborhoods tested positive for Legionella. The outbreak has not affected the City's drinking or bathing water; it is safe for building residents to drink and bathe with tap water. It is also safe to use home air conditioning units and to be in air conditioned environments.

Silver Alert issued 8/6/15 at 12:45 AM. NYPD has issued a Silver Alert in regards to the disappearance of Rosa Murphy, a 73-year-old Hispanic female with dementia, from 108th Street and 1st Avenue in Manhattan. Ms. Murphy is described as being 5'3'' and 120 lbs, with brown eyes, and red and gray hair. She was last seen on Wednesday, 8/5 at approximately 1:00 PM wearing a patterned dress, black blazer, black stockings, and either brown or black boots. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/fp06xpy.jpg. If you see Ms. Murphy, please call 9-1-1.

Notification issued 7/30/15 at 2:58 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Severe Thunderstorm Warning for The Bronx and Queens until 3:30 PM. Strong winds and heavy rain is expected. For the latest information, please visit http://www.weather.gov/nyc. During a severe thunderstorm, be prepared to potentially lose power. Charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by the outage, turn off all appliances, avoid downed and hanging power lines, and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1.

To view this message in American Sign Language (ASL) with audio and subtitles, please visit: http://bit.ly/1t08zHb.

Alert issued 7/30/15 at 2:40 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Flash Flood Warning for Queens, Manhattan, and The Bronx until 4:30 PM. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage areas and low lying spots. Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground. For the latest information, visit: http://www.weather.gov/nyc. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1.

Notification issued 7/29/15 at 3:25 PM. With the heat indices expected to remain in the mid to high 90s through Thursday, the National Weather Service has extended the previously issued citywide Heat Advisory until 8:00 PM on Thursday, 7/30. These conditions are dangerous to health, especially for people without air conditioning, older adults, and people with chronic health conditions. New Yorkers should use air conditioning to stay cool, go to a place that has air conditioning if it is not available at home, drink water at regular intervals, and limit strenuous activity. New York City has opened cooling centers through Thursday around the five boroughs. Please visit http://www.nyc.gov/oem or call 311 for more information on cooling center locations and hours.

Silver Alert issued 7/23/15 at 7:26 AM. The NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Sophia Rodriguez, an 80-year-old Hispanic female with Alzheimer's and dementia from the area of East 22nd Street and Farragut Road in Brooklyn. She was last seen on 7/22 at approximately 4:00 PM wearing a blue pants suit, red blouse and black shoes. She is described as 5'7'' tall and 115 lbs, with brown eyes and brown hair. A photo is available at http://imgur.com/x0Oah3K. If seen, call 9-1-1.

Notification issued 7/22/15 at 7:42 PM. Due to protest activity, expect an increased presence of emergency personnel and sporadic traffic delays in the vicinity of Penn Station and Times Square in Manhattan.

Silver Alert issued 7/22/15 at 4:15 PM. The NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Cornelio Pascual, a 73-year-old Hispanic male with Alzheimer's from the area of Schenck Avenue and Stanley Avenue in the East New York section of Brooklyn. He was last seen on 7/21 at approximately 3:45 PM wearing blue jeans, a striped polo shirt, black sneakers and a black kangol hat. He is described as 5'6'' tall and 150 lbs, with dark hair and dark eyes. A photo is available at  http://i.imgur.com/AHHV86i.jpg?1. If seen, call 9-1-1.
Notification issued 7/22/15 at 3:52 PM. Following a prior suspension, all B & Q Train service has been restored between Prospect Park and Brighton Beach in Brooklyn. Expect residual delays.

Notification issued 7/22/15 at 3:40 PM. Due to signal problems, B and Q Train service is suspended in both directions between Propect Park and Brighton Beach in Brooklyn. As an alternative, customers can take the B49 bus. Info: www.mta.info.

Notification issued 7/22/15 at 12:00 PM. Weather permitting, the NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene will conduct ground-based spraying of mosquito adulticide to help prevent West Nile Virus between 8:30 PM on Thursday, 7/23, and 6:00 AM the following morning, 7/24. The alternate time frame is between 8:30 PM on Monday, 7/27, and 6:00 AM the following morning, 7/28. Spraying will be conducted in parts of the following Staten Island ZIP codes: 10306, 10308, 10309, 10312, & 10314. For details, go to http://www.nyc.gov/html/doh/html/environmental/wnv-home.shtml, http://i.imgur.com/8iZWPVs.jpg, or call 3-1-1.

Notification issued 7/22/15 at 6:18 AM.  Due to A/C overhead power issues, there are extensive delays to Amtrak and New Jersey Transit trains in and out of Penn Station (MN).  Use alternate routes if possible.

Notification Title: Three Alarm Fire - Midland Avenue & Patterson Avenue (SI)
Email Body: Notification issued 7/22/15 at 1:38 AM. Emergency personnel are on the scene of a three alarm fire located at Midland Avenue and Patterson Avenue in Staten Island. Expect smoke, traffic delays, and a presence of emergency personnel and vehicles in the area. The NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene advises avoiding smoke exposure from structural fires by closing windows while indoors and reducing outdoor activity where smoke is present. People with heart or breathing conditions such as asthma may be more sensitive and should seek immediate medical attention if they experience a worsening of their condition, shortness of breath, or chest pains.

Notification issued 7/21/15 at 6:30 PM. Update: Repairwork on the Metropolitan Avenue Bridge will be extended to include Tuesday, 7/28, through Thursday, 7/30. During this time, a full closure of the bridge is scheduled to occur nightly from 12:01AM - 5AM the following morning. As previously reported, the Metropolitan Avenue Bridge will also be closed nightly this week, with work beginning tonight and lasting through Saturday, 7/25. These closures will occur from 12:01AM - 5AM on Tuesday-Friday, and from 1:00 AM - 6:00 AM on Saturday. 

The bridge will be closed to all vehicular, pedestrian, and bicycle traffic during the reported closure periods and there will be posted variable message signs to assist travelers. For more information and detour route, please visit http://i.imgur.com/G7JRZzw.jpg.

Alert issued 7/21/15 at 10:30 AM. Due to equipment repairs, Con Edison has reduced voltage for the Fox Hills area of Staten Island including zip codes: 10301, 10304, 10305, 10306, 10308 and 10314 between the hours of 2:00 PM and 8:00 PM . Con Edison is asking customers to limit use of washers, dryers, air conditioners, and other energy-intensive equipment, and to turn off lights and televisions when not needed until the issue is resolved. 

If you lose power, turn off all appliances, avoid downed and hanging power lines, and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you are having a life threatening medical emergency and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. Report power outages to Con Edison at 1-800-752-6633 or if you have a speech or hearing impairment, report outages to 1-800-642-2308. Please see http:// http://www.coned.com/ for more information.

Notification Title: Transit Disruption - Amtrak & NJ Transit Delays (CW)
Email Body: Notification issued 7/21/15 at 7:56 AM. Due to power issues, Amtrak and New Jersey Transit customers should expect extensive delays in both directions in Manhattan. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time.

Notification issued 7/20/15 at 11:17 PM. New York City has extended the hours of several cooling centers in Staten Island for residents affected by the power outage and those seeking relief from the heat. The following cooling centers are available for residents in the Staten Island area: 

Open until 12 AM:
      Staten Island Tech - 485 Clawson St, Staten Island, NY 10306

Open until further notice:
      New Dorp High School - 465 New Dorp Ln, Staten Island, NY 10306

Residents can visit the NYC Cooling Center Finder at nyc.gov/oem for up-to-date information about Cooling Center locations and hours.

Notification Title: Con Edison CityWide Energy Conservation Request - Citywide (CW)
Email Body: Alert issued 7/20/15 at 9:00 PM. Due to the extremely hot temperatures, Con Edison wants to remind all customers citywide to conserve energy. Con Edison is asking customers to limit use of washers, dryers, air conditioners, and other energy-intensive equipment, and to turn off lights and televisions when not needed. Customers can report outages and check service restoration status at www.conEd.com or by calling 1-800-75-CONED (1-800-752-6633). For more energy tips, visit www.conEd.com.

Alert issued 7/20/15 at 8:11 PM. New York City has extended the hours of several cooling centers in Staten Island for residents affected by the power outage and those seeking relief from the heat. The following cooling centers are available for residents in the Staten Island area: 

Open Through 11PM:
1)	Todt Hill Community Center - 255 Westwood Avenue, Staten Island NY 10314
2)	Richmond Terrace Community Center -71 Jersey Street, Staten Island, NY 10301
3)	West Brighton Community Center - 230 Broadway, Staten Island, NY 10310

Open until further notice:
1)       Staten Island Tech - 485 Clawson St, Staten Island, NY 10306
2)       New Dorp High School - 465 New Dorp Ln, Staten Island, NY 10306

Residents can visit the NYC Cooling Center Finder at nyc.gov/oem for up-to-date information about Cooling Center locations and hours.

Wadsworth, Concord, South Beach, Ocean Breeze, Grant City, Rosebank, Great Kills, Oakwood, and Eltingville. Notification issued 7/20/15 at 3:00 PM.  From Tuesday, July 21 through at least Saturday, August 8, there will be full closures of the Brooklyn Battery Underpass south tube (Route 9A to FDR Drive) to remove conduit damaged by Hurricane Sandy. Closures will be in effect Tuesdays - Fridays from 12:01 AM until 5:00 AM, and Saturdays from 1:00 AM until 8:00 AM. Variable message signs are in place to alert motorists. For more info: http://i.imgur.com/qoHto0N.jpg.
Notification issued 7/20/15 at 1:44 PM.  Following an earlier incident, A train service has been restored with residual delays.

Notification issued 7/20/15 at 12:55 PM.  Due to switch problems, there is no A train service in both directions between Euclid Avenue and Lefferts Blvd/Broad Channel. Use alternate routes or MTA buses if possible http://www.mta.info/
Notification issued 7/20/15 at 10:58 AM.  Following an earlier incident, A train service has resumed with residual delays.

Alert issued 7/20/15 at 10:05 AM. Due to equipment repairs, Con Edison has reduced voltage Richmond Hill, Woodhaven, Ozone Park,  South Ozone Park, Kew Gardens, Lindenwood, Howard Beach and Broad Channel. Con Edison is asking customers to limit use of washers, dryers, air conditioners, and other energy-intensive equipment, and to turn off lights and televisions when not needed until the issue is resolved. 

If you lose power, turn off all appliances, avoid downed and hanging power lines, and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you are having a life threatening medical emergency and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. Report power outages to Con Edison at 1-800-752-6633 or if you have a speech or hearing impairment, report outages to 1-800-642-2308. Please see http:// http://www.coned.com/ for more information.

Notification issued 7/20/15 at 9:54 AM. The New York State Department of Environmental Conservation has issued an Air Quality Health Advisory for New York City from 10:00 AM today, July 20,  to 10 PM tonight, July 20, 2015. Active children and adults, and people with respiratory problems, such as asthma, should reduce prolonged or heavy exertion outdoors. For more information, visit the National Weather Service at http://www.1.usa.gov/16w10Sq or the Department of Environmental Conservation at http://www.dec.ny.gov/cfmx/extapps/aqi/aqi_forecast.cfm. To view this message in American Sign Language (ASL) with audio and subtitles, please visit: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_o24hmZJ3DY.

Notification issued 7/20/15 at 8:58 AM.  Due to a NYPD investigation, there is no A train service between Rockaway Blvd and Far Rockaway-Mott Av in both directions. As an alternate, customers are advised to use the Q22 bus to connect to the Q52 bus at Beach 73 St for service along Cross Bay Blvd and connection to the train. For more info: http://www.mta.info/

Notification Title: Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert - Josh Niewierowski M/W/18 (CW)
Email Body: Alert issued 7/19/15 at 6:40 PM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Josh Niewierowski, an 18-year old White male who has autism and is non-verbal, from Lynbrook, NY. Mr. Niewierowski is described as being 5'10'' tall and 170 pounds, with brown hair and brown eyes. He was last seen at approximately 3:00 PM on 7/19 wearing a green t-shirt with a camp anchor patch on the left breast, beige cargo shorts, blue Nike sneakers, and a black hat with ''Maryland'' written on it. He is reportedly traveling on foot. A missing poster is available at http://i.imgur.com/irg0p9N.jpg. If you see Mr. Niewierowski, please call the Lynbrook Village Police Department at (516) 573-7347 or 9-1-1.

Notification Title: Planned Work on Pelham Bridge - July 20 & 22 (BX)
Email Body: Notification issued 7/19/15 at 3:00 PM. The NYC Department of Transportation Division of Bridges will replace switches on the Pelham Bridge over the Hutchinson River in The Bronx during the overnight hours on Monday 7/20 - Tuesday 7/21, and Wednesday, July 22 - Thursday, July 23. On both nights, from 1AM-5AM, there will be intermittent full closures lasting up to 45 minutes at a time. The work is weather-dependent and may be rescheduled to other nights if necessary. Motorists may use the Hutchinson River Parkway as an alternative. For more information, please visit http://i.imgur.com/m0vqzeS.jpg.

Silver Alert issued 7/19/15 at 11:20 PM. The NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Carmen Morales, a 67-year-old Hispanic female with dementia and Alzheimer's from the East New York section of Brooklyn. She was last seen on 7/15 at approximately 11:00 PM in the area of Atlantic Avenue and Linwood Street in Brooklyn. Ms. Morales is described at 5'3'', 125 lbs., with black hair and brown eyes. She was last seen wearing blue jeans, a blue shirt, and brown sandals. A photo is attached http://i.imgur.com/SXnOEkW.jpg. If seen, call 9-1-1.

Notification issued 7/18/15 at 3:37 PM. The New York State Department of Environmental Conservation has issued an Air Quality Health Advisory for New York City from 11 AM Sunday, July 19th to 11 PM Sunday, July 19th. Active children and adults, and people with respiratory problems, such as asthma, should reduce prolonged or heavy exertion outdoors. For more information, visit the National Weather Service at http://www.1.usa.gov/16w10Sq or the Department of Environmental Conservation at http://www.dec.ny.gov/cfmx/extapps/aqi/aqi_forecast.cfm. To view this message in American Sign Language (ASL) with audio and subtitles, please visit: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_o24hmZJ3DY.

Notification issued 7/18/15 at 3:00 PM.  On Sunday, July 19 at 8:30 PM, Red Bull will be conducting a parachute jump event over 99 Scott Avenue in Brooklyn. Three individuals will conduct a parachute jump at the location from a helicopter.

Notification issued 7/18/15 at 3:05 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Heat Advisory for New York City from 11:00 AM Sunday, July 19 to 6:00 PM Monday, July 20. Heat index values are expected between 95 and 100 due to anticipated temperatures in the lower 90s. These conditions are dangerous to health. Avoid strenuous activity. People without air conditioning, older adults, and people with chronic health conditions are most at risk. New York City will open cooling centers tomorrow, July 19. Please visit http://www.nyc.gov/oem or call 311 for more information on cooling center locations and hours.

Notification issued 7/18/15 at 12:00 PM.  On Sunday, July 19, the 15th Annual Panasonic New York City Triathlon will cause road closures 4:00 AM-12:00 PM for the Henry Hudson Parkway northbound lanes from West 57th Street (MN) to Mosholu Parkway (BX); all southbound lanes of the highway will remain open. Also, eastbound lanes of Mosholu Parkway between Henry Hudson Parkway & West Gun Hill Road (BX),  West 79th Street between Riverside Drive & Henry Hudson Parkway (MN), West 72nd Street between Riverside Drive and Central Park West (MN).  Use alternate routes and expect delays in the area.  Map: http://imgur.com/Apvd9U1
Notification issued 7/18/15 at 5:15 AM. Following a prior closure, all eastbound lanes of the Belt Parkway have reopened at Springfield Boulevard in Queens. Expect residual delays.

Notification issued 7/18/15 at 2:42 AM. Due to a police investigation, the Belt Parkway has all eastbound lanes closed at Springfield Boulevard in Queens. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time.
Notification issued 7/17/15 at 11:00 PM.  Following an earlier incident, all LIRR service has been restored.  Expect residual delays.

Notification Title: Protest Activity - West 34th Street and 6th Avenue (MN)
Email Body: Notification issued 7/17/15 at 8:59 PM.  Due to protest activity in the area of W 34th Street and 6th Avenue (MN), there are intermittent street closures impacting pedestrian and vehicular traffic.

Notification issued 7/17/15 at 7:16 PM.  Due to a minor train collision, there are cancellations of westbound service between Jamaica Station and Penn Station (MN)/Atlantic Avenue (BK).  MTA is cross-honoring all fares at this time.  There are also delays on eastbound service. Use alternate routes if possible http://www.mta.info/

Notification issued 7/17/15 at 6:59 PM.  Due to a minor train collision, there are delays on westbound LIRR service from Jamaica Station.  MTA is cross-honoring all fares at this time.  Use alternate routes if possible http://www.mta.info/

Silver Alert issued 7/17/15 at 4:20 PM. NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Etsuko Inoue, an 80-year old Asian female from East 33rd Street and 2nd Avenue in Manhattan. Ms. Inoeu has dementia and Alzheimer's disease. She was last seen at 3:00 PM on Thursday, July 16 in the area of East 10th Street and 2nd Avenue in Manhattan. Ms. Inoue is described as 5'2'' and 135 pounds. A photo of the missing is attached.  If you see Ms. Inoeu, please call 9-1-1.

Notification issued 7/17/15 at 4:00 PM. On Saturday, July 18, The Army Golden Knights will be jumping over Yankee Stadium in The Bronx as part of Military Appreciation Day. The Fokker F27 aircrafts will circle the stadium from 11:45 AM to 12:15 PM and make three drops at 12:15 PM, 12:21 PM, and 12:30 PM. A photo of the aircraft is available at: http://i.imgur.com/xqBCSrR.jpg.
Notification issued 7/17/15 at 3:26 PM. Due to NYPD activity, there are extensive traffic delays on Staten Island bound crossings.  Use alternate routes if possible.

Notification Title: Natural Gas Release - Upper West Side (MN)
Email Body: Notification issued 7/17/15 at 1:04 PM.  There will be a controlled release of natural gas in North Bergen, NJ, which could result in an odor of gas along the western portions of Manhattan until 2:00 PM today, July 17. Continue to report natural gas emergencies to 9-1-1.
Notification issued 7/17/15 at 06:02 AM. Following a prior closure, all lanes of Major Deegan Expwy have reopened at the Cross Bronx Expwy in The Bronx. Expect residual delays.

Notification issued 7/17/15 at 4:50 AM. Due to a motor vehicle collision, the Major Deegan Expressway has all lanes closed in both directions at the Cross Bronx Expressway in The Bronx. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time.

Notification Title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult - Joseph Tucker (CW)
Email Body: Alert issued 7/16/15 at 9:25 AM. The Nassau County Police Department and NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services have issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert in regards to the disappearance of Joseph Tucker, male, white, 78 years old, from Oceanside. He was last seen on 7/16/15 at 2:00 AM driving a 2014 white Mercedes Benz GLK 350 with NYS plate ALA-8287. Mr. Tucker has dementia and may be travelling to the 100th Pct. in Rockaway Queens, Silver Point Beach Club in Atlantic Beach or the Sports Set Gym in Rockville Center. He may appear lost or confused and in need of medical attention. A photo is attached. If seen, please call 9-1-1.
Notification issued 7/15/15 at 4:35 PM. Following a prior service disruption, 2 Train service has resumed normal service in both directions. Expect residual delays.

Notification issued 7/15/15 at 3:40 PM. Due to FDNY activity, there is no 2 Train service in either direction between Gun Hill Rd and Wakefield/241 Street in The Bronx. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time.

Alert issued 7/15/15 at 12:54 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Flash Flood Warning for Brooklyn and Queens until 2:45 PM. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage areas and low lying spots. Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground. For the latest information, visit: http://www.weather.gov/nyc. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1.

Alert issued 7/15/15 at 11:05 AM. The National Weather Service has issued a Flash Flood Warning for Brooklyn and Manhattan until 1:00 PM. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage areas and low lying spots. Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground. For the latest information, visit: http://www.weather.gov/nyc. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1.

Ms. Roller has dementia and is described as 5'2'' and 210 lbs with brown eyes and short white hair. She was last seen at approximately 1:30 PM on Monday, July 13, wearing black pants and an orange shirt. She is wheelchair bound. On Tuesday-Fridays the bridge will be closed 12:01 AM - 5:00 AM and Saturdays 1:00 AM - 6:00 AM.  See the notice attached for more information.

Notification issued 7/9/15 at 7:00 PM. On Friday, 7/10/15, the Roosevelt Island Bridge has been permitted for a film shoot which will involve the use of various prop weapons and staged emergency responders. Regular traffic will be reduced to one lane between the hours of 7PM - 1 AM Saturday morning, 7/11. During this time, expect delays and increased foot traffic in the area. Additionally, the film shoot will move to the roof of the Motorgate Garage between the hours of 1AM - 5AM Saturday morning and will involve the use of emergency vehicles.

Email Body: Notification issued 7/8/15 at 4:29 AM. Following a prior closure, all southbound lanes of FDR Drive at Delancey Street in Manhattan have reopened. Expect residual delays.

Notification Title: Road Closure - FDR Drive at Delancey St (MN)
Email Body: Notification issued 7/8/15 at 4:11 AM. Due to a motor vehicle collision, FDR Drive has all southbound lanes closed at Delancey Street in Manhattan. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time.

Notification issued 7/7/15 at 5:01 AM. Following a prior suspension, the PATH train has resumed normal service in both directions from Journal Square to 33rd Street via Hoboken and from Newark to World Trade Center. Expect residual delays.

Notification issued 7/7/15 at 3:23 AM. Due to signal problems, PATH train service is suspended from Journal Square to 33rd Street via Hoboken in both directions. The Newark to World Trade Center line is operating with delays. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time.

Notification issued 7/6/15 at 8:15 PM. Beginning today, July 6th, the NYC Department of Transportation is scheduled to begin a major resurfacing project along the FDR Drive. Priority repair work is scheduled to happen each week from Monday to Friday during the overnight hours (11PM - 6AM) and continue for several months. The repairs will be done on various sections of the highway and will involve one or more intermittent lane closures each night. 

During this project, motorists should anticipate delays in the vicinity of the work zones. All work is weather dependent. For more information and weekly updates, please visit: http://on.nyc.gov/1NJNPOO.

Notification issued 7/6/15 at 3:00 PM. Tomorrow, July 7th, there will be a simulated explosion in the vicinity of Avenue B between East 6th Street and East 7th Street in Manhattan. The stunt will occur once between 6:00 PM and 11:00 PM. NYPD and FDNY will be on site.
Notification issued 7/6/15 at 1:40 PM. Following an earlier incident, L train service has resumed with residual delays.

Notification issued 7/6/15 at 1:00 PM.  Due to switch problems, there is no L train service in both directions between Livonia Avenue and Rockaway Parkway (BK).  Use alternate routes if possible: http://www.mta.info/

Notification Title: West Nile Virus Aerial Larviciding 7/7-7/9 (BX, QN, SI)
Email Body: Notification issued 7/6/15 at 12:00 PM. Weather permitting, the NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene will conduct aerial spraying of mosquito larvicide to help prevent West Nile Virus between 6 AM and 7 PM on Tuesday 7/7, Wednesday 7/8, and Thursday 7/9. The spraying will be conducted in parts of the following ZIP codes in The Bronx, Queens, and Staten Island: 10303, 10306, 10308, 10309, 10311, 10314, 10464, 10475, 11354, 11356, 11357, 11691, and 11692. In case of inclement weather, the alternate application dates will be Wednesday 7/8, Thursday 7/9, and Friday 7/10. For more details, go to http://www.nyc.gov/html/doh/html/environmental/wnv-spray.shtml, http://i.imgur.com/mdnHorC.png or call 3-1-1.

Silver Alert issued 7/6/15 at X:XX XM. NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Marcel Bony, a 89-year old black male from the Cambria Heights section of Queens. He is described as being 5'7'' and 150 lbs, with brown eyes and partially balding white hair. Mr. Bony has dementia. He was last seen on Saturday, July 4th at 7:30pm near 233rd Street and 120th Avenue in Queens. A photo of the missing is available at LINK. If you see Mr. Bony, please call 9-1-1.

Notification Title: Two Alarm Fire - Wyckoff Avenue and Green Avenue (BK)
Email Body: Notification issued 7/4/15 at 9:10 PM. Emergency personnel are on the scene of a two alarm fire located at Wyckoff Avenue and Greene Avenue in Brooklyn. Expect smoke, traffic delays, and a presence of emergency personnel and vehicles in the area. The NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene advises avoiding smoke exposure from structural fires by closing windows while indoors and reducing outdoor activity where smoke is present. People with heart or breathing conditions such as asthma may be more sensitive and should seek immediate medical attention if they experience a worsening of their condition, shortness of breath, or chest pains.
Notification issued 7/4/15 at 12:00 PM. There will be a fireworks display at Preller Fields at Hillside Avenue in Queens, on Sunday, July 5 at 9:15 PM.

The aircrafts will depart LaGuardia at 11:30am and be over the Statue of Liberty at approximately 12:05 pm. See the attached photo of the aircraft: http://i.imgur.com/nJAwy5k.jpg.

Notification issued 7/3/15 at 12:00 PM. There will be a fireworks display on the East River tomorrow, Saturday, July 4th at 9:20 PM. The display will take place in two locations over the East River: One at the Brooklyn Bridge and the other between East 23th Street and East 37th Street in Midtown Manhattan.
Notification issued 7/3/15 at 12:00 PM. There will be a fireworks display over Coney Island Beach, north of the fishing pier in Brooklyn tomorrow, Friday, July 4th, at 9:45 PM.

Notification Title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult - Katherine Laos F/W/24 (CW)
Email Body: Alert issued 7/3/15 at 6:42 AM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Katherine Laos, a 24-year old white female with mental health disabilities from Island Park, NY (Nassau County). Ms. Laos is described as being 4'5'' and 155 pounds, with brown hair and brown eyes. Ms. Laos was last seen at the Long Island Railroad Train station taxi stand in Island Park, NY in Nassau County at 7:30 PM on Friday, July 2. She was seen leaving with an unknown Hispanic male. Ms. Laos was last seen wearing a pink one piece jumpsuit. A missing poster is available at: http://i.imgur.com/z0qi9xc.png. If you see Ms. Laos, please call 911 or the Nassau County Police Department at (516) 573-7347.

Silver Alert issued 7/2/15 at 9:20 PM. NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Maria Edita, a 73-year old Hispanic female from Willoughby Avenue and Knickerbocker Avenue in Brooklyn. She is described as being 5'6'' and 180 pounds, with brown eyes and salt and pepper hair. Ms. Edita has Alzheimer's, dementia, and requires insulin for diabetes. She was last seen on Wednesday, July 1 at 6:30 AM in the area of her residence on Willoughby Avenue in Brooklyn. Ms. Edita was wearing black pants and a light blue shirt at the time of her disappearance. She does not have a cell phone or Metro Card in her possession. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/lKZPJ3A.jpg. If you see Ms. Edita, please call 9-1-1.

Notification Title: Missing Vulnerable Adult - Ann Conte F/W/85 (CW)
Email Body: Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert issued 7/1/15 at 8:50 AM.  The Glen Cove City Police Department has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for the disappearance of Ann Conte.  Ann Conte is an 85-year-old missing vulnerable adult with dementia and may be in need of medical attention. She was last seen at 11:45 p.m. on Tuesday, June 30 in College Point (QN) . Ann was driving a 2005 gray Toyota Camry with New York registration GLJ7789 with the spare tire in the right rear location. Ms.Conte is described as 5'6'', 120 lbs., with hazel eyes and a reddish blonde wig. She was last seen wearing beige pants, beige shoes, yellow socks, a flowered shirt. Ann has her brown Yorkshire terrier with her.  A photo is attached.  If seen call (516) 573-7347 or 9-1-1. http://imgur.com/vcRpAFe

Notification issued 7/1/15 at 5:22 PM. New York City is currently experiencing intermittent wind gusts in excess of 40 MPH. During periods of high winds, residents should use caution when walking or driving high profile vehicles. Winds at these speeds can cause flying debris, turn unsecured objects into projectiles, and cause power outages. To prepare, charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. For the latest weather information visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

Notification issued 7/1/15 at 4:43 AM. The National Weather Service has issued a Severe Thunderstorm Warning for all five boroughs of New York City until 5:00 AM. Strong winds and heavy rain is expected. For the latest information please visit: http://www.weather.gov/nyc. During a severe thunderstorm, be prepared to potentially lose power. Charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by the outage, turn off all appliances, avoid downed and hanging power lines, and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1.

To view this message in American Sign Language (ASL) with audio and subtitles, please visit: http://bit.ly/1t08zHb.

Alert issued 7/1/15 at 4:35 AM. The National Weather Service has issued a Flash Flood Warning Citywide until 6:15 AM. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage areas and low lying spots. Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground. For the latest information, visit: http://www.weather.gov/nyc. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1.

Notification Title: AMBER ALERT - F/W/3 - New York, NY
Email Body: AMBER Alert issued 6/30/2015 at 2:40PM: The NYPD has activated the New York State AMBER Alert and is investigating a child abduction that occurred on 345 East 102nd Street in Manhattan at about 12:00 PM today. The child is described as a White female approximately 3 years old and is possibly related to the suspect. The SUSPECT, Patrick Giblin, is a White male, approximately 50 years old with short, brown hair and green eyes. He is approximately 6 feet tall and weighs about 230 pounds. The suspect was last seen wearing a green shirt and blue jeans and a camouflage cap.  The VEHICLE has been identified as a black SUV Dodge Durango with New York license plate number GDE4791.  The SUSPECT was last seen traveling East on the Brooklyn Bridge.  The suspect is believed to have down syndrome. The suspect is suicidal and suffers from P.T.S.D. Any information on this abduction is asked to call NYPD at (866)N Y S-AMBER or dial 911 to provide information on a report or sighting.

Notification issued 6/27/15 at 6:32 PM.  Con Edison is responding to reports of a power outage in the Marine Park area of Brooklyn.  Zip codes impacted are: 11229, 11234, 11210. To report a loss of electric service, contact Con Edison at 1-800-752-6633. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances, avoid downed and hanging power lines, and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you are having a life threatening medical emergency and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. Report power outages to Con Edison at 1-800-752-6633 or, if you have a speech or hearing impairment, report outages to 1-800-642-2308. To view this message in American Sign Language (ASL) with audio and subtitles, please visit: http://bit.ly/1u2Z88W.
