Notification Title: NYS Vulnerable Adult Alert - Marshall Kaplan (M/W/81)
Email Body:
Alert issued 6/27/15 at 12:42 PM. NYPD has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Marshall Kaplan, an 81-year old white male from Amsterdam Avenue in Manhattan. Mr. Kaplan has dementia and a severely hunched back. He is described as being 5'8'' and 145 pounds, with gray hair and brown eyes. He was last seen at his residence on Amsterdam Avenue on Friday, June 26 at 12:00 PM. Mr. Kaplan is believed to be driving a 2012 green Toyota Prius with NY registration AHX-2237 and may be traveling to Cold Spring, NY (Putnam County). He may appear confused or disoriented and may be in need of medical attention. If you see Mr. Kaplan, please call NYPD at (800) 577-8477 or dial 9-1-1. A missing poster is available below.

The sender included the following attachment: 
https://attachments.sendwordnow.com/Attachments.aspx?token=859b10d3-6eb4-4f10-b3c7-66f0c0cdb698

Silver Alert issued 6/21/15 at 9:08 PM. NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Mangra Molita, a 87-year old Hispanic male from 186th Street and Jamaica Avenue in Queens. Mr. Molita is described as 5'5'' tall and weighing 140 pounds, with salt and pepper hair and brown eyes. He was last seen on Wednesday, June 17 at his residence on 186th Street in Queens, wearing a light colored baseball cap, blue sneakers, a red and white button down shirt, and blue pants with a white stripe. Mr. Molita has high blood pressure and does not have a cell phone, metro card, or cash in his possession. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/w2UAvCv.png. If you see Mr. Molita, please call 9-1-1.

Notification issued 6/21/15 at 7:20 PM. New York City is currently experiencing intermittent wind gusts in excess of 40 MPH. During periods of high winds, residents should use caution when walking or driving high profile vehicles. Winds at these speeds can cause flying debris, turn unsecured objects into projectiles, and cause power outages. To prepare, charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. For the latest weather information visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

Email Body: Alert issued 6/21/15 at 9:35 AM. Mr. Jaffrey is described as being 5'8'' tall and 250 pounds, with black hair and black eyes. He was last seen at approximately 12:30 AM on 6/21 wearing a dark blue shirt with a white collar and gray sweatpants. He walks with a limp and his right foot turns inward. Notification Title: Flyover - Wings and Wheels Expo - Hudson River
Email Body: Notification issued 6/18/15 at 12:10 PM. As a part of a ''Wings and Wheels Expo'' at Teterboro Airport in New Jersey, a number of flyovers will be taking place today, June 18 through Sunday, June 21. Today before 1:00 PM, a B-17 ''Yankee Lady'' aircraft will arrive at Teterboro Airport and will depart at approximately 3:00 PM. On Saturday, June 20 and Sunday, June 21, the B-17 ''Yankee Lady'' will be conducting hourly flights over the Hudson River between 9:00 AM and 5:00 PM. All of the mentioned flights will depart Teterboro to the Statue of Liberty, and then north to West Point (Orange County) before returning to Teterboro. A photo of the aircraft is available at: http://i.imgur.com/9MBnFxZ.jpg.

Notification Title: Planned Closure of the Manhattan-Bound Brooklyn Bridge - 6/20 - 6/22
Email Body: Notification issued 6/15/15 at 6:40 PM.  There will be detours for overnight, Manhattan-bound Brooklyn Bridge traffic Monday to Thursday (6/15-6/18), 11:00 PM - 6:00 AM. Starting Friday night, June 20th to Monday morning, June 22nd there will be a Full Weekend Closure to Manhattan-bound traffic on the Brooklyn Bridge. This closure will begin at 12:01 AM on Saturday (6/20) and continue through 6:00 AM on Monday morning (6/22), for 54 consecutive hours. During this time, Manhattan-bound traffic will be closed entirely. Among other operations, this full weekend closure will enable the contractor to set grid deck on the Manhattan-bound roadway of the Brooklyn Approach. All motorists should consider taking the Manhattan Bridge, Williamsburg Bridge, or the Brooklyn-Battery Tunnel (MTA-tolled facility). More info: http://bit.ly/1FPov5s.

Ms. Davilmar is described as being 5'4'' tall and 200 pounds, with black hair and brown eyes. Ms. Davilmar has severe dementia and may be in need of medical attention. Notification Title: AMBER ALERT CANCELLATION - Mia Olarte F/H/4  (CW)
Email Body: The NYS Troopers have cancelled the AMBER Alert for the disappearance of Mia Olarte.

Amber Alert issued 6/9/15 at 5:00 AM. The NYS Troopers have issued an Amber Alert for Mia Olarte, a 4-year old Hispanic female with Down Syndrome from The Bronx, New York. She is described as 21 and 48 lbs, with brown hair and brown eyes. The child was last seen on 6/8/15 at 4:52 PM near Brown Place and East 136 Street in The Bronx wearing gray pants with polka dots and a pink shirt. The child is reportedly traveling by foot with Dora Estella Olarte, her non-custodial mother, a 49-year old Hispanic female, 5'4'', 140 lbs with brown hair and brown eyes. Dora was last seen wearing jeans and a white short-sleeve shirt, and carrying a blue pocket book. The child may be in imminent danger and requires medication. If seen, please call (866) NYS - AMBER or 9-1-1. For updates, visit http://amber.ny.gov.

Email Body: Alert issued 6/8/15 at 5:30 PM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Claude Mondesir, a 75-year old Black male, from Woodmere, NY. Mr. Mondesir is described as being 5'10'' tall and 180 pounds, with gray hair and brown eyes. Mr. Mondesir suffers from dementia and may be in need of medical attention. He was last seen at approximately 2:50 PM on 6/8 wearing beige pants, a striped beige shirt, blue baseball hat, white sneakers, and a gold chain. He speaks English and Creole, may be using public transportation, and may attempt to travel to a casino. A missing poster is available at http://i.imgur.com/AoJr1to.jpg. If you see Mr. Mondesir, please call the Nassau County Police Department at (516) 573-7347 or 9-1-1.

Notification Title: Planned Closure of the Manhattan-Bound Brooklyn Bridge - 6/6 - 6/7
Email Body:

Among other operations, this full weekend closure will enable asphalt placement on the Brooklyn Approach.

Notification Title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult - Eliu Rivera (CW)
Email Body: Alert issued 6/5/15 at 10:55 AM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for the disappearance of Eliu Rivera, a 55-year old white male from Monroe, NY (Orange County). Mr. Rivera has dementia, kidney disease, and cancer. He is described as 6'0'' tall and weighing 160 lbs. Mr. Rivera has black hair and brown eyes. He was least seen at 3:00 PM on Thursday, June 4 in the area of 1200 Route 208 in Monroe, NY. Mr. Rivera was last seen wearing a blue demin jacket, blue jeans, and red, black, and white addidas sneakers. He may have traveled to The Bronx and may be in need of medical attention. The missing poster is available at: http://www.criminaljustice.ny.gov/missing/#/missing-alert/345. If you see Mr. Rivera, please call the Blooming Grove Town Police Department at (845) 496-9161 or call 9-1-1.

Alert issued 5/31/15 at 5:33 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a citywide Flash Flood Warning until 8:30 PM. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage areas and low lying spots. Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground. For the latest information, visit: http://www.weather.gov/nyc. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1.

Alert issued 5/31/15 at 3:30 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Flash Flood Warning for The Bronx until 6:15 PM. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other drainage areas and low lying spots. Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground. For the latest information visit: http://www.weather.gov/nyc. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1.

Notification issued 5/31/15 at 5:10 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Severe Thunderstorm Warning for Staten Island until 6:00 PM. Strong winds and heavy rain is expected. For the latest information please visit: http://www.weather.gov/nyc. During a severe thunderstorm, be prepared to potentially lose power. Charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by the outage, turn off all appliances, avoid downed and hanging power lines, and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1.

To view this message in American Sign Language (ASL) with audio and subtitles, please visit: http://bit.ly/1t08zHb.

Notification issued 5/28/15 at 1:25 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Severe Thunderstorm Watch for all five boroughs of New York City until 7:00 PM. Intermittent wind gusts in excess of 40 MPH can be experienced throughout this time. During periods of high winds, residents should use caution when walking or driving high profile vehicles. Winds at these speeds can cause flying debris, turn unsecured objects into projectiles, and cause power outages. To prepare, charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. For the latest weather information visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

He may have traveled to the New York City area. For a photo of the missing, please visit: http://i.imgur.com/S9lVYgI.jpg. If you see Angelo, call the Nassau County Police Department at (516) 573-7347, or call 9-1-1.

Notification Title: Fleet Week 2015 - Various Demonstrations - Intrepid Pier, Citifield (MN/QN)
Email Body:
Notification issued 5/24/15 at 4:00 PM. In conjunction with Fleet Week 2015, various military flyover activities will take place tomorrow, May 25th. 

From 11:15 AM - 12:30 PM, The U.S. Navy will conduct a flyover involving four FA - 18 Super Hornets above Pier 86 - The Intrepid Air & Space Museum in Manhattan. Aircraft photo: http://i.imgur.com/p3WBgtf.jpg.

The U.S. Navy will conduct a flyover involving an FA-18 Super Hornet above Citi Field in Queens between 12:30 PM - 1:05 PM. Aircraft photo: http://i.imgur.com/p3WBgtf.jpg.

The U.S Coast Guard will conduct a search & rescue demonstration over the water in the vicinity of Pier 86 - The Intrepid Air & Space Museum in Manhattan, from 1:30 PM - 2:00 PM. Weather permitting, the demonstration will consist of one (1) swimmer exiting a U.S. Coast Guard helicopter to perform a rescue demonstration. Aircraft photo: http://i.imgur.com/KoNm18u.jpg.

For more info, please visit www.fleetweeknewyork.com.

Notification Title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult - Salvatore Iervolino M/W/78
Email Body: Alert issued 5/21/15 at 6:55 PM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Salvatore Iervolino, a 78-year old white male, from Hauppauge, NY. Mr. Iervolino is described as being 5'3'' tall and 235 pounds, with gray hair and green eyes. Mr. Iervolino suffers from dementia, has numerous scars on his chest due to surgery, uses crutches to get around, and may be lost or confused and in need of medical attention. He was last seen at approximately 10:30 AM this morning wearing a light salmon-colored jacket, a blue shirt, black pants, black shoes, and a black cap. He was last seen driving a gray 2002 Nissan Maxima with New York registration 503521. A missing poster is available at http://i.imgur.com/SLzY9NF.jpg. If you see Mr. Iervolino, please call the Suffolk County Police Department at (631) 852-6000 or 9-1-1.

Notification issued 5/21/15 at 3:15 PM. The US Air Force Thunderbirds are scheduled to conduct a flyover photo mission tomorrow, Friday, 5/22, from 10:30 AM - 11:30 AM, over various areas around NYC. The event will consist of six F-16 aircraft in addition to the aircraft taking photographs. The F-16's will maintain an altitude of 1500 - 2000 feet. The aircraft will travel westbound from Long Island over the water near the south shores of Queens and Brooklyn before turning and navigating north over the Verrazano Bridge, and up the east side of the Hudson River to the Tappan Zee Bridge. From there, the aircraft will turn around and travel southbound over the west side of the Hudson River to the Verrazano Bridge, before traveling northbound up the east side of the Hudson River to finish their route. The rain date for the event is scheduled for Monday, 5/25 at 9:00 AM. A photo of the aircraft is available at http://i.imgur.com/malYQeZ.jpg.

There will be no live ammunition used at this event and there is no threat to the public.

Notification Title: Three Alarm Fire - Dekalb Avenue & Throop Avenue (BK)
Email Body: Notification issued 5/16/15 at 4:26 AM. Emergency personnel are on the scene of a three alarm fire located at Dekalb Avenue and Throop Avenue in Brooklyn. Expect smoke, traffic delays, and a presence of emergency personnel and vehicles in the area. The NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene advises avoiding smoke exposure from structural fires by closing windows while indoors and reducing outdoor activity where smoke is present. People with heart or breathing conditions such as asthma may be more sensitive and should seek immediate medical attention if they experience a worsening of their condition, shortness of breath, or chest pains.

Notification Title: Planned Closure of the Manhattan-Bound Brooklyn Bridge from 5/16 - 5/17 (BK/MN)
Email Body:
Notification issued 5/15/15 at 3:00 PM. The overnight detours of Manhattan-bound traffic on the Brooklyn Bridge will be extended to include daytime hours this weekend, May 16th to May 17th. During this time, the Brooklyn Bridge will be closed to Manhattan-bound traffic from 12:01 AM on Saturday (5/16) through 9:00 AM on Sunday morning (33 consecutive hours). Among other operations, this full weekend closure will enable the contractor to prepare the Manhattan-bound roadway for upcoming asphalt placement on the Brooklyn Approach.

During this time, please consider taking the Manhattan Bridge, Williamsburg Bridge, or the Brooklyn-Battery Tunnel (MTA-tolled facility). See http://bit.ly/1ExzOO7 for more information.

Notification Title: Road Closures - NYRR Air BnB Brooklyn Half Marathon - 5/16 (BK)

Multiple intermittent street closures will be in effect throughout Brooklyn tomorrow, Saturday, May 16th, from approximately 12:00 AM to 3:00 PM, in support of the New York Road Runners' Brooklyn Half Marathon. Expect road closures and traffic along the route, which begins near Prospect Park, ends near Coney Island, and includes sections of Washington Avenue, Eastern Parkway, Empire Boulevard, Flatbush Avenue, Grand Army Plaza, Ocean Avenue, Parkside Avenue, Ocean Parkway, Surf Avenue, and Stillwell Avenue. Route details and maps are available at: http://bit.ly/1ugJtVt.

Notification Title: Red Flag Warning - Increased Risk of Brush Fires 5/13/15 (CW)
Email Body: Notification issued 5/13/15 at 11:25 AM. The National Weather Service has issued a Red Flag Warning for New York City and surrounding areas from 12:00 PM to 6:00 PM today, 5/13/15. A Red Flag Warning means a combination of dry brush and gusty wind conditions support fire danger. Exercise extra caution when using outdoor gas and charcoal grills. In addition, smokers should never carelessly discard cigarettes. Immediately report a brush fire to 911. Please see attached press release: http://www.nyc.gov/html/oem/html/pr/15_05_13_brush_fire_risk.shtml.

Notification Title: NYC Bound Amtrak Train Derailment North of Philadelphia (CW)
Email Body: Notification issued on 5/14/15 at 12:20 AM. This evening Amtrak Northeast Regional Train 188 operating from Washington to New York derailed north of Philadelphia. There were approximately 238 passengers and 5 crew members on board. Several passengers have been injured and taken to local medical facilities for treatment. Local emergency responders are on scene and an investigation is ongoing. Northeast Corridor service between New York and Philadelphia is suspended. Persons with questions about their friends and family aboard this train have a special number to call for information: 800-523-9101.

Notification Title: US Small Business Administration Disaster Loan Outreach Center - East Village Building Collapse (MN)
Email Body:
Notification issued 5/1/15 at 1:00 PM. NYC residents and businesses affected by the 2nd Avenue Building Fire and Explosion in the East Village of Manhattan can now apply for low-interest disaster loans from the U.S. Small Business Administration. The Disaster Loan Outreach Center will be located at the Manhattan Community Board 3 District Office at 59 East 4th Street in Manhattan. The center will be open to the public on Tuesday, May 5 at 9:00 AM until Thursday May 14 at 6:00 PM. The Disaster Loan Outreach Center will be open weekdays from 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM and Saturday May 9, from 9:00 AM to 1:00 PM. The center will be closed on Sunday, May 10. For more information, please see the attached fact sheet or visit: http://www.nyc.gov/html/oem/html/relief_recovery/east_village_relief_recovery.shtml.

Notification issued 4/22/15 at 3:42 PM. New York City is currently experiencing intermittent wind gusts in excess of 40 MPH. During periods of high winds, residents should use caution when walking or driving high profile vehicles. Winds at these speeds can cause flying debris, turn unsecured objects into projectiles, and cause power outages. To prepare, charge cell phone batteries, gather supplies, and turn refrigerators and freezers to a colder setting. Always stay clear of downed power lines. If you are affected by an outage, turn off all appliances and keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed to prevent food spoilage. Do not use generators indoors. If you lose power and have a disability or access needs, or use Life Sustaining Equipment (LSE) and need immediate assistance, please dial 9-1-1. For the latest weather information visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

Notification Title: Planned Moored Balloon - Broadway & West 61st Street (MN)
Email Body: Notification issued on 4/22/15 at 3:15 PM. A moored (tethered) balloon will be launched in the area of Broadway and West 61st Street in Manhattan beginning tomorrow, 4/23, in order to conduct aerial survey data. The window for allowable operations lasts through April 22nd, 2016. In that time, two twelve hour days of surveying will take place, during daylight hours. The altitude of the balloon will not exceed the tallest building in the area. The balloon will be white and orange and the size of a typical weather balloon.

Notification issued 3/19/15 at 5:15 PM. The New York City Office of Emergency Management today issued a travel advisory for Friday, March 20. The National Weather Service has issued a Winter Weather Advisory from 6 AM Friday, March 20, through 2 AM Saturday, March 21. Snow will begin Friday morning and will continue throughout the day. The snow will begin to intensify in the afternoon with the heaviest snow expected to fall during the Friday evening rush. The snow will taper off late Friday evening. A total of 4 to 6 inches is expected. New Yorkers are asked to exercise caution and be prepared for limited visibility and slippery conditions when traveling.
For more information see attached press release: http://on.nyc.gov/19Dk4lg

Notification Title: Hugh L Carey Closure of One Lane (MN)
Email Body:
Notification issued 3/8/15 at 12:00 PM. Starting Monday, March 9, 2015 until 2018, one tube of the Hugh L. Carey Tunnel will be closed nightly Monday to Friday between 9:30 p.m. and 5:30 a.m. The weekend-long single tube closures will happen once a month and begin Friday night at 9:30 p.m. and continue through 5:30 a.m. Monday morning. This work is to repair and restore damage to the Hugh L. Carey Tunnel caused by Superstorm Sandy will begin and will require nightly closures of one tunnel tube through 2018.  In addition, one tube will also be closed for routine maintenance work Sunday night beginning at 11 p.m. through 5:30 a.m. Monday.  
For more information, see http://bit.ly/1Emyv9X.

Notification Title: Verrazano Bridge Closure of One Lane (SI)
Email Body: Notification issued 3/6/15 at 3:00 PM. Beginning  Saturday, March 7 until summer 2017, there will be lane closures on the upper level of the Verrazano Bridge for replacement of the existing roadway. During the first phase, drivers who need to access the BK-bound Belt Parkway ramp from the upper level in the morning must use the left lane of the bridge. Signs will be in place directing drivers to the dedicated lane. During the work, all current lanes of traffic will be maintained during peak weekday morning and afternoon drive times using a movable barrier that can be shifted to allow for three Brooklyn-bound, upper level lanes in the morning and three Staten Island-bound, upper level lanes in the afternoon. Drivers can also utilize the lower level of the bridge, which have three available lanes in each direction during peak traffic times. See http://bit.ly/1zPpkqV for details.

Notification issued 2/28/15 at 9:33 PM. The New York City Office of Emergency Management today issued a travel advisory for a wintry mix of snow and freezing rain Sunday, March 1 through Monday morning, March 2, 2015. The National Weather Service has issued a Winter Weather Advisory for 10:00AM Sunday through 7:00AM Monday. Light snow will develop by midday Sunday, with 1-2 inches of accumulation expected by Sunday evening. The snow will mix with or change to freezing rain Sunday evening. The ice and snow is expected to taper off before the Monday morning commute, but untreated roads and walkways are expected to still be slippery. A total of 2-4 inches of snow is expected with this event, with up to a tenth of an inch of ice. New Yorkers are asked to exercise caution and be prepared for slippery conditions.
 For more information see attached press release: http://imgur.com/VipK1VX

Notification issued 4:00PM. The New York City Office of Emergency Management today issued a hazardous travel advisory for Thursday, March 5, 2015. The National Weather Service has issued a Winter Storm Warning for all of New York City from 7:00PM Wednesday evening through 7:00PM Thursday evening, March 5, 2015. Rain Wednesday evening will mix with or change to sleet and snow around midnight. The heaviest snow is expected early Thursday morning, with 2 to 4 inches of snow accumulation expected by the Thursday morning rush. The snow will taper off Thursday afternoon. A total of 4 to 8 inches of snow accumulation is expected with this event. New Yorkers are asked to use mass transit where possible. Use caution when driving and allow for additional travel time, as roads will be dangerous due to the weather conditions. Fore more info:  http://www.nyc.gov/html/oem/html/pr/15_03_04_hazardous_travel_advisory.shtml

Notification issued 3/2/15 10:00 PM. The New York City Office of Emergency Management today issued a travel advisory for a wintry mix of snow, sleet, freezing rain and rain Tuesday evening March 3, through Wednesday morning March 4, 2015. The National Weather Service has issued a Winter Weather Advisory for 3:00 PM Tuesday through 2:00 AM Wednesday. Snow will develop late Tuesday afternoon and will mix with or change to sleet and freezing rain Tuesday evening. The wintry mix will then change over to rain late Tuesday night into early Wednesday morning. The rain will taper off before the Wednesday morning commute, but untreated roads and walkways are expected to still be slippery. A total of 1-3 inches of snow and a trace of ice is expected with this event. New Yorkers are asked to exercise caution and be prepared for limited visibility and slippery conditions when traveling.
http://imgur.com/LL6PvCb

Notification Title: Three Alarm Fire - Avenue N & East 12th Street (BK)
Email Body: Notification issued 2/27/15 at 2:16 PM. Emergency personnel are on the scene of a three alarm fire located at Avenue N and East 12th Street in Brooklyn. Expect smoke, traffic delays, and a presence of emergency personnel and vehicles in the area. The NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene advises avoiding smoke exposure from structural fires by closing windows while indoors and reducing outdoor activity where smoke is present. People with heart or breathing conditions such as asthma may be more sensitive and should seek immediate medical attention if they experience a worsening of their condition, shortness of breath, or chest pains.

Notification Title: Bayonne Bridge - ''Raise the Roadway'' Project Through 2017 (SI)
Email Body: Notification issued 2/25/15 at 4:00 PM.  As the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey continues to progress in the ''Raise the Roadway'' Bayonne Bridge Navigational Clearance Project, many intermittent planned delays and bridge closures will take place through estimated completion in 2017.  To stay up-to-date on closures and delays throughout the process, please visit http://www.panynj.gov/alerts-advisories/advisories.html?tabnum=4 or visit http://www.panynj.gov/bayonnebridge/ and sign up for email updates.  As an alternative, customers can also receive updates by following @BayonneBridge on Twitter.

Notification issued 2/23/15 at 6:20 PM. Due to planned construction, the Bayonne Bridge will be closed in both directions from 9:00 AM - 3:00 PM on Wednesday, 2/25, Thursday, 2/26, and Friday, 2/27. Overnight closures will occur nightly from 9:00PM - 5:00 AM the following morning on the following nights: 2/23, 2/24, 2/25, and 2/26. A 24-hour full closure will take effect Friday, February 27 at 11:59 PM until Saturday, February 28 at 11:59 PM.

During these planned closures, all traffic will be diverted to the Goethals Bridge. 

For more information, please visit http://www.panynj.gov/alerts-advisories/advisories.html.

Notification issued 2/20/15 at 3:00 PM. New York City Emergency Management has issued a weather alert for dangerous cold temperatures for tonight, followed by a wintry mix of snow, sleet, freezing rain, and rain Saturday, 2/21 through Sunday 2/22. Low temperatures tonight are forecast around 10 degrees and wind chills near 5 degrees. Saturday wind chills between 0 and 10 degrees can be expected. Light snow will begin late Saturday morning and continue throughout the day, becoming heavier between 4:00 PM and 7:00 PM. Snow will transition to sleet and freezing rain Saturday evening into Sunday morning. New Yorkers are asked to exercise caution during the period of extreme cold weather, and be prepared for slippery conditions, as freezing rain could cause icy conditions Sunday. See the following press release for details http://on.nyc.gov/1zTBlLE or view NYC Emergency Management's winter weather video: http://bit.ly/1CV6zGS.

Notification issued 2/18/15 at 5:25 PM. New York City Emergency Management has issued a cold weather alert for extremely cold temperatures & subzero wind chills Thursday, February 19, 2015. High winds are expected to begin Thursday afternoon and continue through Thursday night, with sustained winds of 20- 30 mph and gusts up to 35- 40mph. Temperatures remain around zero Thursday night, but wind chills will be as low as 15 to 20 degrees below zero. Temperatures remain extremely cold Friday, with a high near 15 degrees and wind chills as low as 2 degrees. New Yorkers are asked to exercise caution during this period of extreme cold weather and check on their neighbors, friends, and relatives, especially the elderly and those with disabilities and access and functional needs.

For more info: http://i.imgur.com/KnpSuUO.png.

Snow is expected to begin after midnight and will continue into the Tuesday morning commute, ending early Tuesday afternoon.  2 - 4 inches is predicted, with wind gusts of up to 20 mph. Notification Title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult - Thi Chau F/A/69
Email Body: Notification issued 2/16/15 at 1:08 AM. The New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Thi Chau, a 69-year-old Asian female with dementia and may be in need of medical attention. She was last seen in Smithtown, New York at 4:00 PM on Sunday, February 15. It has been determined that Ms. Chau took a train to New York City where she often frequents homeless shelters. She is 5'2'', 137 lbs, with black hair, brown eyes and was last seen wearing a dark colored Northface jacket, black jeans, and white sneakers. Ms.Chau speaks Chinese and limited English. A photo is available at http://imgur.com/c85V4kB. If you see Ms. Chau, please call the Suffolk County Police Department at (631) 852-6410 or 911.

A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/6mX0sSb.jpg. If you see Ms. Markoe, please call 9-1-1.

He was last seen at approximately 8:00 PM on 2/13 wearing a blue button down shirt, black sweatpants and no shoes.  Mr. Arabadjis is described as being 5'11'' tall, 290 lbs, with grey and brown hair.  A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/jV2VHvF.jpg. If you see Mr. Arabadjis, please call 9-1-1.

He was last seen on 2/13 at approximately 1:30 PM wearing a gray hooded sweatshirt, light jeans, brown shoes and no jacket.  Mr. Braxton is described as being 6'4'' tall and 213 lbs.  A photo of the missing is not available at this time. If you see Mr. Braxton, please call 9-1-1.

Notification Title: NYC Emergency Management Travel Advisory & Cold Weather Alert (CW)
Email Body:
Notification issued 2/14/15 at 6:30 PM. New York City Emergency Management has issued a Travel Advisory for 3-7'' of snow (locally higher amounts possible) tonight, and a cold weather alert for extremely frigid temperatures & subzero wind chills through Monday, 2/16. The National Weather Service issued a Winter Weather Advisory from 1PM today - 1PM 2/15, and a High Wind Warning from midnight - 2PM 2/15. Near-blizzard conditions & low visibilities are possible. The system will make travel dangerous late tonight through early Sunday. New Yorkers are asked to exercise caution when driving and to check on neighbors, friends, and relatives who may be at an increased risk of being affected by the extreme cold.

The Department of Sanitation issued a Snow Alert. PlowNYC: www.nyc.gov/severeweather.

Notification issued 1/31/15 at 10:10 PM. At this moment, the Department of Health recommends that residents in the immediate vicinity of the fire at Kent Avenue & North 11th Street (BK) and those who are immediately downwind of the smoke limit exposure by staying indoors, and keeping their windows closed. If anyone in the immediate area experiences shortness of breath, chest pains, or a worsening medical condition such as asthma, they should seek immediate medical attention. As with most fires of this magnitude, it is important that everyone limit their exposure to smoke. Local air quality has been affected but is not likely to cause significant health problems for healthy people. People who are vulnerable, like seniors, children and people with respiratory conditions may experience some difficulty breathing.

Notification issued 1/30/15 at 6:30 PM. Due to planned maintenance work, the Bayonne Bridge will be closed in both directions from tonight, Friday, January 30 at 11:59 PM to Saturday, January 31 at 8:00 AM. In addition, overnight closures of the Bayonne Bridge are scheduled Monday, February 2 through Thursday, February 5, from 9:00 PM to 5:00 AM the following day.  

Intermittent traffic holds will occur on the Bayonne Bridge in both directions between 9:00 AM and 3:00 PM on Wednesday, February 4 through Friday, February 6. The holds will take place for approximately twenty minutes. See http://www.panynj.gov/ for details. 

Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time.

Notification issued 1/29/15 at 3:00 PM. New York City Emergency Management has issued a Weather Advisory for Thursday, January 29, 2015 and Friday, January 30, 2015. Light snow is expected to begin around 9:00 PM and continue until early Friday morning. An accumulation of 1-2 inches of snow is expected, with little to no ice formation, but roads could be slippery for Friday's commute. Decreasing temperatures and increased winds are forecast for Friday afternoon and evening. Nighttime lows of 12 to 13 degrees with wind chills of -5 to -10 degrees are possible. Sustained winds of 20 to 30 MPH can be expected with gusts of of up 40 MPH. New Yorkers are advised to check on their neighbors, friends, and relatives - especially the elderly and those with disabilties and access functional needs. For more information see attached press release: http://www.nyc.gov/html/oem/html/pr/15_01_29_weather_advisory.shtml

Notification Title: Resumed - Long Island Railroad, Metro North Railroad, Staten Island Railroad, NJ Transit (CW)
Email Body:
Notification issued 1/27/15 at 10:52 AM. Following an earlier suspension, MTA Long Island Railroad, Metro-North Railroad, and Staten Island Railroad have resumed with limited service. All service will operate on a Sunday schedule for today, Tuesday, 1/27. See http://mta.info for details. 

In addition, New Jersey Transit train service resumed as of 10:00 AM and New Jersey Transit bus service will resume at 11:00 AM. Both trains and buses will operate on a weekend schedule. See http://njtransit.com for details. 

Amtrak service will now operate between New York and Albany. Amtrak Northeast Regional and Acela Express service will continue to operate on a reduced schedule between New York and Washington, but service remains suspended between New York and Boston.

Expect residual delays and allow for additional travel time.

In addition, Staten Island Ferry service has resumed as of 7:30 AM. Exercise caution when driving and allow for additional travel time.

Alert issued 1/26/15 at 9:25 PM. Due to impending winter weather, Mayor de Blasio has issued a State of Emergency for New York City. All non-emergency vehicles must be off all roads in the city by 11:00 PM, and until further notice.

Notification Title: Additional Mass Transit Suspensions - PATH, SI Ferry, PANYNJ, Amtrak (CW)
Email Body:
Notification issued 1/26/15 at 7:50 PM. Due to impending winter weather, many mass transit suspensions are in effect:

The Staten Island Ferry will suspend operations beginning at 11:30PM tonight, 1/26. 

PATH service and the Port Authority Bus Terminal will suspend service as of 11:00PM tonight, 1/26.

All Port Authority Bridges and Tunnels will close at 11PM tonight, 1/26, until further notice.

Amtrak has suspended Northeast Regional and Acela Express service between NY and Boston for tomorrow, 1/27. In addition, Amtrak has suspended Empire Service, Amtrak Downeaster, Vermonter, and Springfield line service, as well as Lake Shore Limited between NY and Albany and Albany and Boston only for tomorrow, 1/27. Acela Express and Northeast Regional (NY-Washington) and Keystone Service (NY-Harrisburg, PA) will operate at reduced frequencies. 

Limit unnecessary travel.

Notification Title: Suspension - MTA Subway, Metro North, Long Island Railroad, MTA Bus, NJ Transit (CW)
Email Body: Notification issued 1/26/15 at 5:25 PM. Due to impending winter weather, all NYC Subway, Metro North, Long Island Railroad, and MTA Bus service will be suspended effective 11:00 PM tonight, 1/26.  NJ Transit will be suspended effective 8:00PM tonight, 1/26. Limit unnecessary travel.

Notification issued 1/26/15 at 3:30 PM. Due to the impending winter storm, NYC Parks will close tonight at 6:00 PM, effective until further notice. Closures include all parks and recreation centers, and signage will be posted at all parks sites. Heavy ice and snow can cause hazardous conditions in parks, including falling branches and treacherous frozen park paths. On Tuesday morning NYC Parks will provide an update on parks conditions.

Notification issued 1/26/15 at 3:15 PM.  The National Weather Service has issued a Coastal Flood Warning for The Bronx and Northern Queens from 3AM - 7AM tomorrow, 1/27.  The affected area includes the New York coasts of the western Long Island Sound. Tidal departures are expected to be 2-3 feet above normal tide, with potential for up to 4 feet. Waves of 3-5 feet and high storm tides may cause beach erosion along the north facing shorelines open to the Long Island Sound. A few exposed waterfront structures may be damaged, and the potential for flooding of vulnerable shore roads exists. Coastal residents in the warned area should be alert for rising water and take appropriate action to protect life and property. For more information, visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

Notification issued 1/26/15 at 3:15 PM.  The National Weather Service has issued a Coastal Flood Warning for Brooklyn and southern Queens from midnight tonight through 5AM tomorrow, 1/27.  The affected area includes the south shore bays of western Long Island. Tidal departures are expected to be 2-3 feet above normal tide. Waves of 6-9 feet and high storm tides may cause beach erosion and washovers along ocean facing barrier beaches. A few exposed waterfront structures may be damaged, and the potential for flooding of vulnerable shore roads exists. Coastal residents in the warned area should be alert for rising water and take appropriate action to protect life and property. For more information, visit www.weather.gov/nyc.

Black ice may create travel hazards tonight into Sunday, 1/25.  As temperatures drop below freezing areas of black ice are possible on walk ways and untreated surfaces. Motorists are advised to use caution when traveling tonight and drive slowly.  Vehicles take longer to stop on snow and ice than on dry pavement. Pedestrians should exercise caution, avoid slippery surfaces, and have a heightened awareness of cars, particularly when approaching or crossing intersections.  Seniors should take extra care outdoors to avoid slips and falls from icy conditions. http://bit.ly/1wvhn8E

Notification Title: NYS DCJS Missing Child Alert - Stephanie Quito F/W/14 (CW)
Email Body: Alert issued 1/22/15 at 7:47 AM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Child Alert for Stephanie L. Quito, female, white, 14 years old, from Eastchester, NY. She is described as 5'5'' tall, weighing 110 pounds, and has brown hair and brown eyes. Ms. Quito is an endangered runaway who was last seen wearing a white jacket, blue jeans, brown Ugg boots, and a blue backpack. Police believe Ms. Quito may have been at the Crestwood Train Station in Tuckahoe, NY, and are concerned for her safety. She may attempt to travel to NYC. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/gvb0AZh.jpg. If you see Ms. Quito, please call 9-1-1 or the Eastchester Town Police Department at (914) 961-3464.

Email Body: Missing Child Alert issued 1/14/15 at 8:15 PM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Child Alert in regards to the disappearance of Karla Galarza, a 16-year old White female who suffers from low cognitive function and bi-polar disorder as well as other psychological conditions, from the Bronx.  She was last seen at 5:00PM yesterday, 1/13, in the area of East 149th Street & Courtlandt Avenue, BX, wearing faded gray jeans, black boots, a pink polar fleece, and a pink down vest. Miss Galarza is described as being 5'8'' tall and 140lbs, with brown hair and brown eyes.  She may attempt to travel to Philipstown, NY. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/uvTXPpI.png.  If you see Miss Galarza, please contact the NYS Police Cortlandt at 914-737-7171 or 9-1-1.

Notification Title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert - William Slade M/B/54 (CW)
Email Body: Alert issued 1/8/15 at 6:23 PM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for William Slade, a 54-year-old Black male who is bi-polar and suicidal, from Yonkers, NY. Mr. Slade frequents the area of Hudson Street and may be in need of medical attention. He is described as being 5'9'' tall and 169 lbs. with black hair and brown eyes. He was last seen on foot at 1:00 PM today, 1/8, in the area of St. Joseph's Hospital, located at 127 South Broadway in Yonkers. He was wearing a blue hooded sweatshirt and blue jeans, and made threats that he was going to jump into the Hudson River. A photo is available at: http://i.imgur.com/lPyc1pw.jpg. If you see Mr. Slade, please call the Yonkers City Police Department Communications Division at 914-377-7900, or call 9-1-1.

Notification Title: Wind Chill Advisory In Effect Wednesday Evening, Frigid Temperatures Through Thursday (CW)
Email Body:
Notification issued 1/6/14 at 5:40 PM.  With temperatures expected to be dangerously cold today through Thursday, 1/8, Mayor de Blasio has issued a winter weather update, urging New Yorkers to take precautions to protect themselves and help others who may be at increased risk of health problems. 

Today's forecast includes temperatures in the low 20s with wind chill values of 10-15 degrees. Wednesday's forecast includes a high near 28 degrees, with a low of 9 degrees Wednesday night and wind chill values between zero and -15 degrees. The National Weather Service has issued a Wind Chill Advisory from 7PM Wednesday evening until 8AM on Thursday, 1/8.

New Yorkers should take precautions, including staying indoors when possible, checking on neighbors who may be at risk, and reporting loss of heat or hot water to property managers & 3-1-1. Visit http://on.nyc.gov/1DuIkPn for info and tips for staying safe.

Notification Title: Three Alarm Fire - 97th Street and Liberty Avenue (QN)
Email Body: Notification issued 12/18/14 at 4:42 PM. Emergency personnel are on the scene of a four alarm fire located at 97th Street and Liberty Avenue in Queens. Expect smoke and traffic delays in the vicinity.

Silver Alert issued 12/17/14 at 11:45 PM.  NYPD has issued a Silver Alert in regards to the disappearance of Adrian Mejias, a 78-year old Hispanic male who is diabetic and suffers from Alzheimer's and dementia, from the area of Bainbridge Street and Thomas S Boyland Street in Brooklyn.  He was last seen on 12/17 at approximately 3:00 PM near Broadway and Pilling Street in Brooklyn wearing a blue and white plaid shirt, blue jeans, a brown jacket, and white sneakers.  He is described as being 6'0'' tall and 170lbs with gray hair. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/nMSC22m.jpg.  If you see Mr. Mejias, please call 9-1-1.

Notification Title: Filming of a TV Series With Simulated Explosions - 12/18/14 (QN)
Email Body: Notification issued 12/17/14 at 6:00 PM. On Thursday, December 18th, the filming of a TV series will include simulated explosions in the vicinity of 12th Street between Queens Plaza South and 43rd Avenue, Queens. This stunt will occur twice between 6PM-10PM. NYPD and FDNY will be on site.

Notification Title: Update - School Relocation PS 396X, MS 390X, P10X - (BX)
Email Body: Notification issued 12/17/14 at 12:18 PM. This is an updated notification to the previously issued school relocation message. Students of PS 396, which have been relocated to PS 226, located at 1950 Sedgwick Avenue in The Bronx, will be bussed from or can be picked up from the relocation site (1950 Sedgwick Avenue). Students who wish to walk home will be walked to the front of PS 396 (home school building) and then dismissed. Students of MS 390 and P10X, which were relocated to PS 15 located at 2195 Andrews Avenue in The Bronx, will be bussed from or can be picked up from the relocation site (2195 Andrews Avenue). Students who wish to walk home will be walked to the front of MS 390 or P10X (home school building) and then dismissed.

Notification Title: Fireworks - Hudson River near Battery Park City - 12/18/14 (MN)
Email Body: Notification issued 12/17/14 at 12:00 PM. There will be a fireworks display at 7:30 PM tomorrow, 12/18/14 over the Hudson River near Battery Park City, Manhattan.

Notification issued 12/17/14 at 10:04 AM. Due to a building condition in the area, staff and students of PS 396, located at 1930 Andrews Avenue in The Bronx will relocate to PS 226, located at 1950 Sedgwick Avenue in The Bronx. In addition, staff and students of MS 390 and P10X located at 1930 Andrews Avenue in The Bronx will relocate to PS 15 located at 2150 Andrews Avenue in The Bronx. An update will be distributed regarding the dismissal location of the students.

Notification Title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult - Lillian Arana - F/W/72
Email Body: Alert issued 12/16/14 at 8:48 PM.  The New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert in regards to the disappearance of Lillian Arana, a 72-year-old white female with Alzheimer's, from Larchmont Village, NY.  Ms. Arana is described as being 5'2'' tall , 150 lbs with brown hair, brown eyes, and tattooed eyebrows. Ms. Arana was last seen at approximately 8:00 AM on 12/16 on West Street, Larchmont Village, NY. She was last seen wearing a brown jacket and dark leggings. Ms. Arana may seem to be confused and in need of medical attention.  A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/FbIjWA0.jpg. If you see Ms. Arana, please call 9-1-1.

Notification Title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult - Jose Leon M/W/20  (CW)
Email Body: Alert issued 12/10/14 at 7:22 PM.  The New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert in regards to the disappearance of Jose Leon, a 20-year-old white male with autism, from Queens, NY.  Mr. Leon is described as being 5'7'' tall and 200lbs with black hair and brown eyes. Mr. Leon was last seen at approximately 1:30 PM on 12/10 in Yonkers, NY. He was last seen wearing a gray jacket, brown sweatpants with yellow stripes, and blue and red sneakers. Mr. Leon likes to frequent McDonald's restaurants. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/RQGZo2v.jpg.  If you see Mr. Leon, please call 9-1-1.

Notification Title: Areal Flood Warning (BX, MN, QN, BK)
Email Body: Notification issued 12/9/14 at 2:15 PM. The National Weather Service has issued an Areal Flood Warning for The Bronx, Manhattan, Queens, and Brooklyn until 4:00 PM. Locally heavy rainfall totals between a inch and two inches has been reported in the area. Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground. For the latest information visit: http://www.weather.gov/nyc.

Notification issued 12/9/14 at 12:55 PM. The National Weather Service has issued an Areal Flood Warning in effect until 3:15 PM for The Bronx. Locally heavy rainfall totals between a quarter of an inch to a half an inch has been reported in the area. Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground. For the latest information visit: http://www.weather.gov/nyc.

Notification issued 12/8/14 at 6:25 PM. The New York City Office of Emergency Management (OEM) today issued a Travel Advisory for Tuesday, 12/9 - Wednesday, 12/10. The National Weather Service is forecasting a powerful coastal storm that may impact NYC as early as Tuesday morning. Heavy rain, strong winds, and coastal flooding may occur. The NYC Flash Flood Plan has been activated.

The National Weather Service has issued a Coastal Flood Advisory for MN, SI, BK, and southern QN from 7AM - 11AM 12/9, a Coastal Flood Warning for BX and northern QN from 11AM - 2PM 12/9, a Flood Watch citywide from Tuesday morning through early Wednesday, and a High Wind Advisory citywide from 8AM - 5PM with gusts up to 50mph possible. Use caution while driving and allow for additional travel time.

Notification Title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult - Henry Finke M/W/84 (CW)
Email Body: Alert issued 12/3/14 at 2:55 AM.  The New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert in regards to the disappearance of Henry Finke, an 84-year-old White male with dementia, from Huntington, NY.  He is described as being 5'1'' tall and 200lbs with white hair and blue eyes.  Mr. Finke was last seen at approximately 1:00 PM on 12/2 in Huntington, NY, and was driving a 2007 gray Buick Lucerne with New York registration CVL9022.  He may be traveling to the Hunter Mountain area and may be in need of medical attention.  A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/WYa5xCY.jpg.  If you see Mr. Finke, please call the Suffolk County Police Department at 631-854-8200, or call 9-1-1.

Notification Title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult - Paolo Macri M/W/83 (CW)
Email Body: Alert issued 12/3/14 at 12:55 AM.  The New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert in regards to the disappearance of Paolo Macri, an 83-year-old White male with early onset dementia, from Great Neck, NY.  Mr. Macri is described as being 5'8'' tall and 240lbs with gray hair and brown eyes.  He was last seen in Great Neck, NY at approximately 7:30 AM on 12/2 and was driving a 2014 gray Jeep Cherokee with NY registration CER8457.  He may be in need of medical attention. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/mzaMHek.jpg.  If you see Mr. Macri, please call the Nassau County Police Department 3rd Precinct at 516-573-7347, or call 9-1-1.

Notification Title: 3 Alarm Fire - Liberty Avenue and 180th Street (QN)
Email Body: Notification issued 12/2/14 at 7:55 PM.  Emergency personnel are on scene of a three alarm fire at Liberty Avenue and 180th Street (QN).  Please expect street closures and traffic in the area.

Notification Title: Silver Alert - Chong Hi Kim F/A/80 (CW)
Email Body: Silver Alert issued 12/2/14 at 3:32 AM. NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Chong Hi Kim, female, Asian, 80 years of age, from Main Street and Blossom Avenue in Queens. Ms. Kim is described as 5'2'' tall and weighing 110 pounds with brown eyes and gray hair. She was last seen at 12:30 PM on Sunday, November 30th at her residence wearing a blue jacket, tan pants and white sneakers. The missing speaks predominately Korean. A photo is available at http://i.imgur.com/9pI6c8U.jpg. If you see Ms. Kim, please call 9-1-1.

Silver Alert issued 12/1/14 at 9:14 PM.  NYPD has issued a Silver Alert in regards to the disappearance of Valentina Livshen, a 74-year-old white female with dementia, from the area of Ridge Avenue and 67th Street in Brooklyn.  She is described as being 5'3'' tall and 125lbs with gray hair, blue eyes and only speaks Russian.  Ms.Livshen was last seen 11/30 at 4:00 PM in the area of East 18th Street and Avenue R (BK) wearing a black coat, pink sweater, black pants and white sneakers. If you see Ms.Livshen, please call 9-1-1. A photo of the missing is attached: http://imgur.com/O9BmJjf

Notification issued 12/1/14 at 3:00 PM. As part of a Community Emergency Response Team (CERT) training class, a controlled fire and disaster drill will be conducted at West 181st Street and University Avenue in The Bronx at 6:30 PM tomorrow, 12/2/14. Expect to see FDNY and NYPD personnel in action. To learn more about CERT, visit http://www.NYC.gov/CERT.

Notification issued 11/30/14 at 3:00 PM. Expect to see FDNY and NYPD personnel in action. To learn more about CERT, visit http://www.NYC.gov/CERT.

Silver Alert issued 11/29/14 at 11:30 PM.  NYPD has issued a Silver Alert in regards to the disappearance of Michael Jackson, a 72-year-old Black male with dementia, from the area of 2nd Avenue & 9th Street in Brooklyn.  He is described as being 6'3'' tall and 170lbs.  Mr. Jackson was last seen today, 11/29, at 3:00 PM in the area of Grand Army Plaza, Brooklyn, wearing a black coat, red hat, blue jeans, and beige work boots. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/RyReTMI.jpg?1.  If you see Mr. Jackson, please call 9-1-1.
Notification issued 11/29/14 at 9:32 PM. Due to police activity, expect extensive delays in the area of the Henry Hudson Parkway at  West 72th Street in Manhattan. Consider alternate routes.

Notification issued 11/25/14 at 4:22 PM. The New York City Office of Emergency Management (OEM) today issued a Hazardous Travel Advisory for Wednesday, November 26. The National Weather Service has forecast 3 to 5 inches of snow accumulation citywide from Wednesday morning through Thursday morning. A mixture of rain and snow Wednesday morning is expected to change to all snow by the early afternoon. Exercise caution when driving and allow for additional travel time. The Department of Sanitation issued a Snow Alert today at 7:00 AM. PlowNYC will be available tomorrow at nyc.gov/severeweather. http://bit.ly/1uCZPGv

Notification Title: NYS Vulnerable Adult Alert - Michael Ward M/W/85 (CW)
Email Body: Alert issued 11/25/14 at 9:49 AM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Michael R. Ward, male, white, 85 years old, from Cortlandt Manor, NY. Mr. Ward has early on-set dementia and may be in need of medical attention. He is described as 5'9'' tall and weighing 130 lbs. Mr. Ward has gray hair and blue eyes. He was last seen leaving his home in Cortlandt Manor, NY at 12:00 PM on Monday, 11/24. Mr. Ward was reportedly driving a 2012 black Cheverolet Malibu with NY Registration FTK2463. A photo is available at: http://i.imgur.com/B54oIxS.jpg. If you see Mr. Ward, please call the NYS Police at (914) 737-7171 or dial 9-1-1.

Notification Title: AMBER ALERT CANCELLATION - Steven Ristick - M/W/3 Months (CW)
Email Body: Alert Cancellation issued 11/24/14 at 6:53 AM.  The NYS Troopers have cancelled the AMBER Alert for Steven Ristick.

Notification Title: AMBER ALERT - Steven Ristick - M/W/3 Months (CW)
Email Body: AMBER Alert issued 11/24/14 at 1:35 AM. NY State Police have issued an Amber Alert for Steven Ristick, a 3 month old white male from Greenport, NY (Columbia County). Mr. Ristick is described as 18'' long, 11 lbs., w/ brown hair & brown eyes. He was last seen @ 10:47 PM on 11/23 wearing a long sleeved white T-shirt underneath a green shirt which says ''Daddy's Little Sidekick.'' He is reportedly traveling with suspect Jonathan Lawrence, a 21 year old white male, 6'1'' tall, 200 lbs, with brown hair and brown eyes. Mr. Lawrence was last seen wearing a red and blue puffy jacket & blue jogging pants, with a tattoo of ''Canadien'' on his left arm & a tribal tattoo on his right bicep. The suspect and missing were last seen traveling south on Fairview Avenue in a blue Chrysler minivan w/ a Connecticut license plate, and are possibly en route to NJ. The child may be in imminent danger. A photo is not available. If seen, please call(866) NYS - AMBER or 9-1-1. For updates visit http://amber.ny.gov.

Notification issued on 11/23/14 at 5:07 PM. The NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for Gerald Kinnison, a 60 year old Black male with dementia, from the area of Surf Avenue in Brooklyn. Mr. Kinnison is describerd as being 6' tall and 180 pounds, thin built, with brown eyes, black hair, and beard. The individual was last seen in the area of 23-16 Surf Avenue in Brooklyn on 11/21 at 8:00 AM wearing a black jacket, black shirt, blue pants, and large black sneakers. He may be walking in the direction of Manhattan. A photo of the missing is attached. If you see Mr. Kinnison, please call 9-1-1. http://bit.ly/1qWiMJs

Notification Title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult - Marilyn E. Frank F/W/82 (CW)
Email Body: Alert issued 11/21/14 at 12:48 AM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for the disappearance of Marilyn E. Frank, female, white, 82 years old, from Merrick, NY. Ms. Frank has dementia and may appear lost or confused and she may be in need of medical attention. She was last seen driving a 2004 gray Hyundai Accent with New York registration FFB-7764 yesterday, 11/20. She is described as being 4'4'' tall and 140 lbs. with white hair and green eyes. If you see Ms. Frank, please call the Nassau County Police Department at 1-516-573-7347 or 911. A photo is attached.

Notification issued 11/20/14 at 3:00 PM. In commemoration of the 50th Anniversary of the Verrazano Bridge, two Howitzer cannons will alternately fire 25 shots between 10:30 AM and 11:30 AM on Friday, November 21, in the vicinity of the bridge. One cannon will be located in Fort Hamilton, Brooklyn and the other in Fort Wadsworth, Staten Island. A test firing will be conducted between 8:00 AM and 10:00 AM, which will consist of one shot being fired from each side of the bridge. A helicopter flyover will take place at approximately 11:30 AM. Traffic on the Verrazano Bridge will not be impacted.

Notification issued 11/20/14 at 9:22 AM. Due to intermittent bridge lifts, expect extensive delays on the Bayonne Bridge in the Staten Island and New Jersey bound directions until 3:00 PM today. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time.

Notification issued 11/19/14 at 7:08 PM. Due to switch problems at Penn Station, Long Island Railroad westbound service between Jamaica Station, QN and Penn Station, MN is temporarily suspended.  LIRR eastbound trains from Penn Station are experiencing heavy delays and intermittent cancellations. Please consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time.

Notification issued 11/19/14 at 2:10 PM.  A blue Twinstar helicopter, registration number N326SC, will be conducting a flyover survey today, 11/19, in the vicinity of One World Trade Center and Four World Trade Center in Manhattan.  The activity will take place between 2:00 PM and 6:00 PM and will involve a helicopter with an external mounted camera pod.

Notification Title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert - Richard Duroseau (CW)
Email Body: Alert issued 11/14/14 at 9:40 PM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for the disappearance of Richard Duroseau, male, black, 74 years old, from East Meadow, NY. Mr. Duroseau has dementia. He was last seen leaving Nassau University Medical Center on Friday, 11/14/2014. He is believed to be on foot and was last seen wearing a dark grey jacket, pressed pants, a dress shirt, and a tie. Mr. Duroseau is a musician that could be traveling to Brooklyn, NY. A photo is available at http://i.imgur.com/s8V1Csu.jpg. If you see Mr. Duroseau, please call the Nassau Police Department at (516) 573-7347 or 9-1-1.

Notification Title: Cancellation: Missing Child Alert for Gene Warren M/B/17 (CW)
Email Body: Notification issued 11/14/14 at 12:44 PM. The NY State Division of Criminal Justice Services has cancelled the Missing Child Alert for Gene Warren, male, black, 17 years of age. The missing child has been safely located.

Notification Title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert - William Andrews (CW)
Email Body: Alert issued 11/14/14 at 9:37 AM. The NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for the disappearance of William Andrews, male, black, 64 years old, from Hempstead, NY. Mr. Andrews has dementia and may be in need of medical attention. He was last seen leaving Nassau University Medical Center at 7:30 PM on Thursday, 11/13. He is believed to be on foot and was last seen wearing blue jeans, white sneakers, a green jacket, and a brown baseball hat. Mr. Andrews could be traveling to Roosevelt or Brooklyn, NY. A photo is available at http://i.imgur.com/wikdSV7.jpg. If you see Mr. Andrews, please call the Nassau Police Department at (516) 573-7347 or 9-1-1.

Notification issued 11/14/14 at 7:55 AM. Due to an NYPD investigation, expect extensive delays in both directions on the 6 train between Pelham Bay Park and Hunts Point Avenue in The Bronx. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time.

Silver Alert issued 11/13/14 at 4:25 PM. NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Ronald Bastone, a 69-year-old black male with dementia. Mr. Bastone is described as being 6'0'' tall and 170 pounds with a slim build, brown eyes, and salt and pepper hair. He is from Delaware, but he was last seen yesterday, 11/12, at 5:00 PM in the area of Lenox Avenue & West 132nd Street in Manhattan, wearing a dark gray jacket, black sweatpants, and black shoes. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/l3K8isL.jpg. If you see Mr. Bastone, please call 9-1-1.

Notification Title: Missing Child Alert - Gene Warren M/B/17
Email Body: Missing Child Alert issued 11/13/14 at  3:00 PM. The New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Child Alert for the disappearance of Gene Warren, a 17 year old black male child with autism. He has been known to travel to Brooklyn or he may return to his residence in Yonkers (Westchester County). He may be in need of medical attention. He is 5'9'', 230lbs with black hair, a stocky build, and a beard. Gene was last seen wearing royal blue jeans, a navy blue and white plaid shirt, a black bubble jacket, and blue and white sneakers. A photo is available at  http://i.imgur.com/pUpkfK2.jpg. If seen, please call the Westchester County Department of Public Safety at 914-864-7701, or call 9-1-1.

Notification Title: Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert - Ronald Bastone M/B/69 (CW)
Email Body: Notification issued 11/13/14 at 12:53 PM. NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Ronald Bastone, male, black, 69-years old, from out of state. Mr. Bastone has dementia and was last seen on foot at 7:00 PM on Wednesday, 11/12 in the vicinity of West 132nd Street and Lenox Avenue in Manhattan. The missing is currently visiting from out of state and is unfamiliar with the area. Mr. Bastone may appear lost or confused and in need of medical attention. A photo is available at http://i.imgur.com/VIqpOU4.jpg. If you see Mr. Bastone, please call the NYCPD Missing Person Squad at (212) 690-6315 or 9-1-1.

Notification Title: Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert - Albert Ser M/W/77 (CW)
Email Body: Notification issued 11/13/14 at 12:24 PM. NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Albert Ser, male, white, 77-years old, from Wetherole Street and 66th Avenue in Queens. Mr. Ser has dementia and was last seen wearing a blue jacket, red plaid shirt, brown pants, and black shoes. The missing is believed to be operating a black 2010 Mercury Milan, with NY registration BHU-8759 in the Manhattan area. Mr. Ser may be lost or confused and in need of medical attention. A photo is available at http://i.imgur.com/4WywO7V.jpg. If you see Mr. Ser, please call the NYCPD Missing Person Squad at (718) 520-9200 or 9-1-1.

Silver Alert issued 11/13/14 at 8:53 AM. NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Albert Ser, male, white, 77 years of age, from Wetherole Street and 66th Avenue in Queens. Mr. Ser has dementia and is described as 5'7'' tall and weighing 135 pounds, medium build with gray hair, blue eyes and wears glasses. He was last seen at his residence wearing a blue waist length jacket, red plaid shirt, brown pants and black shoes. Mr. Ser was last seen on 11/12 at 4:00 PM. A photo is available at http://i.imgur.com/EcwTsM8.jpg. If you see Mr. Ser, please call 9-1-1.

Notification Title: Planned Closure of the Manhattan-Bound Brooklyn Bridge from 11/7 - 11/10 (BK/MN)
Email Body: Notification issued 11/7/14 at 3:00 PM. The overnight detours of Manhattan-bound traffic on the Brooklyn Bridge will be extended to include daytime hours this weekend, November 7th to November 10th. During this time, the Brooklyn Bridge will be closed to Manhattan-bound traffic from midnight on Friday night until 6:00 a.m. on Monday morning (54 consecutive hours). Among other operations, this full weekend closure will enable the contractor to place asphalt on a portion of the Manhattan-bound Brooklyn Approach. While the Manhattan Bridge remains an alternative for Manhattan-bound traffic, we urge motorists to also consider taking the Williamsburg Bridge or Brooklyn-Battery Tunnel (MTA-tolled facility) due to an expected high volume of traffic. Brooklyn-bound motorists will access the lanes of the Brooklyn Bridge normally. See http://bit.ly/1wO8UkV for more information.

Notification Title: Road Closures for 2014 TCS NYC Marathon - 11/2/14 (CW)
Email Body: Notification issued 11/1/14 at 12:00 PM. Numerous bridge and street closures will be in effect citywide from 7:00 AM to 7:00 PM on Sunday, 11/2/14, in support of the 2014 TCS New York City Marathon, including the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge. In addition, the upper level of the bridge will be closed in both directions beginning at 11:00 PM tonight for roadway preparation. For further information visit: http://www.tcsnycmarathon.org/race-day/course. Also see the attached map of the event route and full list of road closures. For help finding an alternate route, call 511 or visit http://www.511NY.org. For other marathon-related roadway closures throughout the city, call the NYC hotline at 311. Please see the following map of the marathon: http://www.tcsnycmarathon.org/sites/default/files/TCSNYCM14_Course%20Map.pdf.

Notification issued 11/1/14 at 7:03 AM. Due to signal problems, expect extensive delays on the G train in both directions between Bedford-Nostrand Avenue in Brooklyn and Court Square in Queens. In addition, extensive delays can be expected in both directions on the N train between Queensboro Plaza and Astoria-Ditmars Boulevard in Queens due to switch problems. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time.

Notification Title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult - Anthony Fata - M/W/93
Email Body: Notification issued 10/31/14 at 9:35 PM. The New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Anthony Fata, a 93-year-old white male from Mineola, NY. Mr. Fata suffers from dementia, may be in need of medical attention, and may be en route to NYC. He is described as being 5'8'' tall and 150 lbs with gray hair and brown eyes. He was last seen today at 1:30 PM wearing a gray sweatshirt and gray sweatpants. Mr. Fata is believed to be operating a 1994 green Buick Park Avenue with New York registration AEU8451. A photo is available at http://i.imgur.com/MRqStsn.jpg. If you see Mr. Fata, please call the Nassau County Police Department at 1-516-573-7347 or 911.

Notification issued 10/27/14 at 1:00 PM. Weather permitting, the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) will launch the Orbital Sciences Corporation's Antares orbital rocket from the Wallops Flight Facility in Virginia on Monday, October 27th, at 6:45 PM.  The launch of the rocket may be visible through-out the Mid-Atlantic and Northeast Regions, including parts of New York City. In case of inclement weather, the backup launch dates are 10/28, 10/29, or 10/30. For more information, please see the attached map, or visit: http://i.imgur.com/Av0sCzh.jpg, and http://www.nasa.gov/mission_pages/station/structure/launch/orbital.html.

Notification Title: Parachute Jump Demos and Helicopter Flyovers - 10/28, 10/29, 11/8 (BX, MN)
Email Body: Notification issued 10/27/14 at 12:00 PM. On Tuesday, October 28th and Wednesday, October 29th (with a possible rain date of Wednesday, November 5th), West Point will conduct parachute demonstrations out of a helicopter over Yankee Stadium (twice daily). These are practice jumps for the actual event, which will take place on Saturday, November 8th. The helicopter will travel from West Point, land on the Intrepid to pick up the four (4) parachute jumpers, and then travel to Yankee Stadium, where the jumpers will begin their demonstration.

Silver Alert issued on 10/25/14 at 2:35 PM. NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Mary Shannon, a 73-year-old black female who is deaf and mute, from the area of East 102nd Street and 1st Avenue in Manhattan. Ms. Shannon was last seen on 10/24 around 4:00 PM wearing a a purple coat, dark green sweatpants, and a brown wig. She is described as being 4'8'' tall and 110lbs. A photo of the missing is available at http://i.imgur.com/6OFFr7R.jpg. If you see Ms. Shannon, please call 9-1-1.

Notification Title: Planned Closure of the Manhattan-Bound Brooklyn Bridge from 10/24 - 10/27 (BK/MN)
Email Body: Notification issued 10/23/14 at 3:00 PM. Nightly in-bound closures of the Brooklyn Bridge will be extended to include next weekend, October 24th to October 27th. During this time, the Brooklyn Bridge will be closed to Manhattan-bound traffic for 54 consecutive hours, from 11:59 PM on Friday night, 10/24 through 6:00 AM on Monday morning, 10/27. Among other operations, this full weekend closure will enable the completion of rehabilitation work on the Manhattan-bound Sands Street and York Street Structures. During this time frame, please consider taking the Manhattan Bridge, Williamsburg Bridge, or the Hugh L. Carey (formerly Brooklyn-Battery) Tunnel, an MTA-tolled facility. For more info, please see the attached map, visit http://i.imgur.com/RdQbV5u.jpg, or http://www.nyc.gov/dot.

Notification issued on 10/22/14 at 3:41 AM. The National Weather Service has issued a Flash Flood Warning for Kings County and Queens County until 5:30 AM. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses, as well as other drainage areas and low lying spots. Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground. For the latest information visit: http://www.weather.gov/nyc.

Notification Title: Update: Planned Closure of the Southbound FDR Drive - 10/18 & 10/19 (MN)
Email Body: Notification issued 10/17/14 at 10:35 PM. Update: Weather permitting, the NYC Department of Transportation (DOT) will install a steel protection beam to prevent over-height vehicles from striking the overpass at East 90th St on the FDR Drive in Manhattan. This work will be conducted on Sat, 10/18 and Sun, 10/19, and require a full closure of the southbound FDR Drive from East 96th St to East 78th St from 2:00 AM to 7:00 AM on Sat, 10/18 and on Sun, 10/19. The left lane on the northbound FDR Drive will also be closed near the worksite at East 90th St starting at 10:00 PM. All lanes will reopen at 7:00 AM on Sunday, 10/19. During this project, motorists will be guided along a detour route by NYPD Traffic Control agents. Signs indicating the detour route will also be installed for additional guidance. In case of inclement weather, work will be rescheduled for the weekend of October 24-26. For more information, please visit http://www.nyc.gov/dot.

Notification Title: Planned Closure of the Southbound FDR Drive - 10/18 into 10/19 (MN)
Email Body: Notification issued 10/17/14 at 8:25 PM. Weather permitting, the NYC Department of Transportation (DOT) will install a steel protection beam to prevent over-height vehicles from striking the overpass at East 90th St on the FDR Drive in Manhattan. This work will be conducted on Sat, 10/18 and Sun, 10/19, and require a full closure of the southbound FDR Drive from East 96th St to East 78th St from 2:00 AM Sat, 10/18 to 7 AM on Sun, 10/19. The left lane on the northbound FDR Drive will also be closed near the worksite at East 90th St starting at 10 PM tonight. All lanes will reopen at 7 AM on Sunday, 10/19. During this project, motorists will be guided along a detour route by NYPD Traffic Control agents. Signs indicating the detour route will also be installed for additional guidance. In case of inclement weather, work will be rescheduled for the weekend of October 24-26. For more information, please visit http://www.nyc.gov/dot.

Notification Title: Planned Closure of the Manhattan-Bound Brooklyn Bridge from 10/17 - 10/19 (BK/MN)
Email Body: Notification issued 10/17/14 at 10:00 AM. As part of the ongoing Brooklyn Bridge Ramps Rehabilitation Project, there will be a continuous 35 hour closure of the Manhattan-bound Brooklyn Bridge from 11:59 PM Friday, October 17 through 11:00 AM Sunday, October 19th. All Manhattan-bound traffic will be diverted to alternate crossings and motorists should consider taking the Manhattan Bridge, Williamsburg Bridge, or the Brooklyn-Battery Tunnel. For more information, please visit: http://www.nyc.gov/dot.

Notification Title: Hugh L. Carey Tunnel Closure - Tunnel To Towers Run 9/28/14 (BK/MN)
Email Body: Notification issued 9/27/14 at 12:00 PM. The Hugh L. Carey (formerly Brooklyn-Battery) Tunnel will be fully closed in both directions for several hours on Sunday, September 28th, for the annual Stephen Siller Tunnel to Towers Run. One tube will be closed beginning tonight at 10:00 PM.  The other will remain open until 8:00 AM on Sunday, 9/28, when both tubes will be fully closed until 3:00 PM for the event. Consider alternate routes and allow for additional travel time.  For more information, please visit www.mta.info.

Notification Title: AMBER ALERT - Sophia Salazar - F/H/9 - Phillipstown, NY
Email Body: AMBER Alert issued 9/23/14 at 11:18 AM. NY State Police have issued an Amber Alert for Sophia Salazar, 9 year old Hispanic female from Phillipstown, NY (Putnam County). Ms. Salazar is described as 4'4'' tall, 70 lbs., with brown hair and brown eyes. She was last seen at approximately 5:30 AM today wearing sleepwear. She is reportedly traveling with the lead suspect Luisa Salazar, a 37 year old hispanic female. Luisa Salazar is described as 5'1'' tall and weighing 160 pounds. Sophia and Luisa are reportedly traveling in a 2007 blue metallic 4-door Honda Civic with a New York license plate tag DMN9229. The suspect is bipolar, off medication, and has been experiencing delusional episodes. The child may be in imminent danger. A photo is not available at this time. If either are seen, please call(866) NYS - AMBER or 9-1-1. For updates visit http://amber.ny.gov.

Notification Title: Planned Closures of the Eastbound Belt Pkwy - Mon-Fri Starting 9/15/14 (BK)
Email Body: Notification issued 9/14/14 at 5:00 PM. The NYC Department of Transportation (DOT) will be milling and resurfacing portions of the eastbound Belt Parkway between Flatbush Ave and Rockaway Parkway (Brooklyn), from 11 PM until 5 AM, beginning Monday, 9/15. Full closures will occur Monday nights through Saturday mornings, and last for approximately three weeks. During this project, motorists will be guided through a detour route, which exits at Flatbush Ave, proceeds to Utica/Flatlands Aves, then East 76th St/Paerdegat Ave, Seaview Ave and returns to the Belt Parkway via Rockaway Parkway. Flatlands and Pennsylvania Aves become an alternate route. Signs indicating the detour route will provide additional guidance. Work will not occur on the nights of Wednesday, 9/24, and Thursday, 9/25, in observance of Rosh Hashanah. Work will resume on the night of Friday, 9/26. For more info and updates, please see the attached map, http://imgur.com/CSxgo6F, or visit http://www.nyc.gov/dot.

Notification Title: NYC DOH - Point of Dispensing Drill on 8/1/14
Email Body: Notification issued 8/1/14 at 6:30 AM. Today, August 1, the New York City Department of Health will be conducting an emergency preparedness drill at 30 New York City Department of Education facilities across New York City to test the delivery of emergency medications. This drill will occur from approximately 6:30 am until 3:00 pm. Supply trucks will be escorted by NYPD and other law enforcement vehicles, and volunteer staff will receive these supplies and set up medication dispensing operations inside these facilities. No medications will be distributed as part of this drill, and there should be no impact to other planned  activities in these facilities. Please see the DOHMH website at www.nyc.gov/health for more information.

Notification Title: Planned Closure of the Manhattan-Bound Brooklyn Bridge from 7/19 to 7/21 (BK/MN)
Email Body: Notification issued 7/18/14 at 10:00 AM. As part of the ongoing Brooklyn Bridge Ramps Rehabilitation Project, there will be a continuous 54 hour closure of the Manhattan-bound Brooklyn Bridge and westbound/southbound BQE exit ramp onto Cadman Plaza West (Brooklyn) from 12:01 AM Saturday, July 19 to 6 AM Monday, July 21. BQE exit ramp traffic will be diverted to the Atlantic Avenue exit onto Furman Street. Traffic proceeding inbound to Manhattan should use the Hugh L. Carey Tunnel (pay toll) or the Manhattan/Williamsburg Bridges as alternates. For more information, please visit: http://www.nyc.gov/dot.

Notification issued 7/3/14 at 6:25 PM. July 4th fireworks displays will occur tomorrow night after 8 PM off of Liberty State Park in Jersey City, NJ, at 9:30 PM off of the Coney Island Beach Fishing Pier in Brooklyn, and on the East River near the Brooklyn Bridge. The East River display will last for approximately 40 minutes. Associated road closures will begin at 4:00 PM and end at approximately midnight. These will include the FDR Drive from Houston St to the Battery in Manhattan, as well as the Brooklyn Bridge, which will be closed in both directions beginning at 5:00 PM. Governors Island will be closed at 6:00 PM. Expect extensive traffic delays near all fireworks viewing locations. If traveling, consider use of mass transit. Notification Title: Planned Closure of the Upper Level of the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge 6/30-7/1 & 7/1-7/2  (SI)
Email Body: Notification issued 6/30/14 at 6:10 PM. Beginning tonight, June 30, to Wednesday, July 2, the MTA will resume an improvement project on the upper level of the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge that may cause significant overnight delays. All three westbound upper-level lanes and one eastbound lane will be closed Monday to Tuesday from 9PM to 6AM the following morning. There will be a full closure of all upper-level lanes in both directions overnight Monday to Tuesday. Passenger vehicles should use the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge lower level OR consider alternate routes. Vehicles carrying hazardous materials and trucks more than 13-feet-6-inches must consider alternate routes. For the most up-to-date closure schedule, visit http://www.mta.info.
