Notification Title: Planned Closures of the George Washington Bridge - 6/16/14 to 6/21/14 (BX/MN)
Email Body: Notification issued 6/15/14 at 3:00 PM. Beginning Monday, June 16, to Saturday June 21, the Port Authority of NY and NJ will resume a steel deck improvement project on the upper level of the George Washington Bridge that may cause significant overnight delays. Three of four upper level lanes will be closed in either the eastbound or westbound direction Monday to Thursday from 9PM to 5AM the following morning, and on Friday night from 10PM to 10AM Saturday. Closure hours will be adjusted to accommodate Yankee games and Meadowlands events. Passenger vehicles should use the GWB lower level OR consider alternate routes. Trucks are required to use the upper level at all times. Highway message signs, 511 and traffic reports will advise motorists in advance which direction will be under construction on any given night. For the most up-to-date closure schedule, visit http://www.panynj.gov/. For regional traffic conditions, call 511 or visit http://www.511NY.org or http://www.511NJ.org.

Notification Title: 70th Anniversary of D-Day: Helicopter Flyover, Rose Petal Release, and 21-Gun Salute - 6/6/14 (BK, MN, SI)
Email Body:
Notification issued 6/5/14 at 7:50 PM. To commemorate the 70th Anniversary of D-Day, an organization called The French Will Never Forget will conduct a helicopter flyover and ceremonial release of one million rose petals (weather permitting) over the Statue of Liberty tomorrow, Friday, June 6, between 11:30 AM  12 PM. The activity will consist of two (2) AS365 helicopters (photo attached) executing the petal release and one (1) additional helicopter for filming at an altitude of approximately 100 feet above the statue. This event is expected to last approximately 5-7 minutes. In addition, the French Naval Frigate Lafayette (photo attached) will participate by positioning itself adjacent to the Statue of Liberty in the Hudson River from 10 AM  2 PM. A 21-gun salute will be conducted at approximately 12 PM.  The U.S. Coast Guard will provide a safety zone in the Hudson River for the aviation activity and the positioning of the frigate.

Photo: http://bit.ly/1i720xp

Notification Title: Joint Emergency Response Drill - Lenox Hill HealthPlex and NewYork-Presbyterian/Lower Manhattan Hospital (MN) - 5/23
Email Body: Notification issued 5/22/14 at 7:35 PM. On Friday, 5/23, Lenox Hill HealthPlex and NewYork-Presbyterian/Lower Manhattan Hospital will perform an emergency response drill from 11:00 AM to approximately 2:00 PM. Doctors, nurses, EMS personnel and students will train in emergency management and healthcare response using simulated patients and mannequins. During this exercise, Lenox Hill HealthPlex, located at 30 Seventh Avenue in Manhattan, will receive twelve patients with simulated injuries. Twelve other patients will arrive at the HealthPlex and then be transferred to NewYork-Presbyterian/Lower Manhattan Hospital, located at 83 Gold Street. Other agencies involved in the drill include the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA), Fire Department of New York, Greater NY Hospital Association, NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene, NYC Office of Emergency Management, New York City Police Department, NY State Department of Health, and Tribeca Community Emergency Response Team.

Notification Title: Fleet Week 2014 - USMC Aviation Demonstration at Orchard Beach (BX) - 5/23/14
Email Body:
Notification issued 5/22/14 at 4:00 PM. In support of Fleet Week 2014, two (2) U.S. Marine Corps CH-53 helicopters and one (1) AH-1 helicopter (photos attached) will conduct an aviation demonstration at Orchard Beach/Pelham Bay Park, The Bronx, tomorrow, Friday, May 23, between 1:40 PM and 4:50 PM. The demonstration will consist of all helicopters landing in the area of the park's administrative building and parking lot.

For more information, please see the attached photos or visit: http://www.fleetweeknewyork.com/.

Notification Title: Lenox Hill HealthPlex Drill - ZIP Code 10011 (MN) - 5/23/14
Email Body:
Notification issued 5/22/14 at 3:00 PM. On Friday, May 23, the Lenox Hill Healthplex will be conducting a disaster drill at the future site of its Emergency Medical Center. The building is located at 30 Seventh Avenue between West 12th and West 13th Streets in Manhattan. The drill will include actors and mannequins dressed as if they have been injured, ambulances arriving to the scene and departing with ''injured patients,'' a decontamination tent, and staff dressed in decontamination gear. Staff will be treating patients and loading them into and out of ambulances. This will take place at the driveway on West 12th Street between 7th Avenue and Greenwich Avenue.

The drill is scheduled to begin at 11:00 AM and end at approximately 2:00 PM. With the exception of the ambulances arriving and leaving, all of the drill will take place on-site at the HealthPlex.  The loading bay and driveway for the HealthPlex are visible from the street.

Notification Title: Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert - Marino Biordi - W/M/81 (CW)
Email Body: Notification issued 5/21/14 at 2:30 AM. The New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Marino Biordi, male, white, 81 years of age, from West Hempstead, NY. Mr. Biordi suffers from dementia and insulin dependent diabetes. He is described as 5'5'', 180 lbs., with white hair and hazel eyes. He was last seen driving a 2001 Toyota Tacoma with New York registration GLY-5471 in West Hempstead, NY at 1:00 PM on Tuesday May 20. Mr. Biordi was wearing a light gray short sleeve shirt, dark gray pants, a News12 baseball cap and construction boots. He may appear lost or confused and may be in need of medical attention. A photo is attached. If you see Mr. Biordi, please call the NY State Police at 1-914-277-3651 or 9-1-1.

Notification Title: Fleet Week 2014 - Parade of Sails & U.S. Marine Corps (USMC) Familiarization Flights - 5/21/14 (CW)
Email Body:
Notification issued 5/20/14 at 3:00 PM. In support of Fleet Week 2014, the following events will occur on Wednesday, May 21: 

The Parade of Sails along the Hudson River will consist of three (3) U.S. Navy ships and two (2) U.S. Coast Guard ships between 9 AM - 11:30 AM. NOTE: A gun salute will be conducted from Ft. Hamilton, Brooklyn, at approximately 9:30 AM. 

In addition, the U.S. Marine Corps (USMC) will conduct familiarization flights throughout the NYC area using two (2) MV-22 helicopters, two (2) CH-53 helicopters, and two (2) AH-1 helicopters, from 11:30 AM - 2 PM.

For more information, please see the attached photos or visit: http://www.fleetweeknewyork.com/.

Email Body: Missing Child Alert issued 5/18/14 at 1:48 PM.  The New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services has just issued a Missing Child Alert for the disappearance of Eliceo Cortez, a 14 year old male Hispanic child with autism. He was last seen in the area of Shore Parkway and Voorhies Avenue in Brooklyn on Friday 5/16/14 at approximately 2:30pm. Eliceo has burn marks on his hands and was wearing blue jeans, a black t-shirt, black high top Converse sneakers and a gray hooded sweatshirt. He is 6'1'', 135lbs with brown eyes and black hair. Eliceo is known to frequent the Coney Island area. A photo is attached. If seen, please call 9-1-1.

Notification issued on 05/16/2014 at 9:40 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Flash Flood Warning for Brooklyn, The Bronx, Manhattan, and Queens until 12:30 AM, 5/17. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses, as well as other drainage areas and low lying spots. Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground. For the latest information visit: http://www.weather.gov/nyc.

Notification Title: Flyover, Parachute Jump, & Film Shoot over Hudson River on 5/17/14 (MN)
Email Body:
Notification issued 5/16/14 at 4:00 PM. The Red Bull Air Force Dive Team will conduct a film shoot (weather permitting) over the Hudson River near Governors Island and Battery Park City, Manhattan on Saturday, May 17th, between 6 AM and 9 AM.  If postponed due to inclement weather, this activity will be held on Sunday, May 18th, during the same time frame. The event will consist of five (5) members of the dive team exiting one (1) Cessna 208 aircraft (photo attached) at an altitude of approximately 7,500 feet, and landing on a barge situated on the Hudson River (just north of Battery Park Citys North Cove Marina), while being filmed by an AS355 Helicopter (photo attached). The U.S. Coast Guard will provide a safety zone in the river for this activity.

The sender included the following attachment: 
https://phx-attachments.sendwordnow.com/Attachments.aspx?token=59d3f94b-c867-48e9-b226-19ff1b1d3e46.

Mr. Gonzalez is 5'7'' and weighs 160 pounds. Mr. Gonzalez is described as bald with a medium complexion and was last seen wearing a black Yankee baseball hat, yellow t-shirt, black pants, and brown shoes. He wears glasses. Mr. Gonzalez was last seen at his residence at approximately 2:00 PM on 5/13/14 and was reportedly going to a hardware store on Kingsbridge Road in the Bronx. A photo of Mr. Gonzalez is attached. If you see Mr. Gonzalez or have any information regarding his whereabouts, please call 911.

Notification issued on 5/12/14 at 6:30 PM. An aerial survey will be conducted (weather permitting) over Governors Island beginning TOMORROW (Tuesday, May 13th) from 12p  5p and on Wednesday, May 14th from 9a  12p.  The survey will consist of one (1) unmanned rotary-wing quad copter known as a shrike (see attached photo) in support of a Major Accident Response Exercise (MARE) hosted by the Fire Department of New York (FDNY).  The unmanned shrike will operate at or below an altitude of 400 feet and will remain over Governors Island for the duration of the survey.  Please see attached photo of the aircraft.

Notification Title: Department of Sanitation Bulky Debris Removal Guidelines - 5/8/14 (CW)
Email Body:
Notification issued 5/8/14 at 6:30 PM. The NYC Dept. of Sanitation (DSNY) has been removing non-commercial waste from homeowners engaged in small repairs due to last week's flooding. Homeowners undertaking large demolition/reconstruction projects must arrange for their own dumpster by contacting a private rubbish removal service.

Small quantities of construction/demolition debris will continue to be picked up by DSNY on scheduled collection days, provided it is properly bundled. Wood may not be more than four feet long and must be tied up securely. DSNY crews will pick up a maximum of ten bulky items per home.

Bulky construction debris generated by hired contractors or fee-for-service personnel on home repair or renovation projects is considered commercial waste and it is the responsibility of the contractor to arrange for appropriate private disposal.

For additional information on DSNY refuse collection, please call 311 or visit http://www.nyc.gov/sanitation.

Notification Title: NYS Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert - Maurice Lambert - M/B/79
Email Body:
Notification issued on 5/6/14 at 7:50 PM. At the request of the New York City Police Department, a New York State Missing Vulnerable Adult notification has been issued relating to the disappearance of Maurice Lambert, male, Black and 79 years old, last seen 5/5/14 at approximately 4:00 PM in the area of 63rd Drive and 98th Street in Queens.  Mr. Lambert is described as 5'10'', 170lbs, with a tan hat, gray/white jacket and dark pants. Mr. Lambert suffers from dementia, diabetes, a heart stint and several other medical conditions.  He was last seen driving a 2001 blue Mercedes ML3 with New York Registration: MD76736  If you see Mr. Lambert, please call 1-800-577-8477 or 9-1-1.

Notification Title: Report Storm and Flood Damage to 311 (CW) - 5/1/14
Email Body: Notification issued 5/1/14 at 12:30 PM. The New York City Office of Emergency Management encourages New Yorkers affected by yesterdays storm to report damage to their homes and businesses to 311. This data will be collected, mapped, and used to assess the damage in areas affected by the April 30 rainstorm and subsequent flooding. The City must meet certain damage thresholds to qualify for federal disaster assistance programs. Information reported to 311, either by phone or online (nyc.gov/311), about damage to homes and businesses will not be used for any purpose other than assisting OEM in developing a more accurate assessment of the impact from the storm and flooding.

Notification issued 4/23/14 at 6:35 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Red Flag Warning for New York City and surrounding areas from 9:00 AM to 8:00 PM tomorrow, 4/24/14. A Red Flag Warning means a combination of dry brush and gusty wind conditions support fire danger. Exercise extra caution when using outdoor gas and charcoal grills. In addition, smokers should never carelessly discard cigarettes. Immediately report a brush fire to 911. For more information, visit http://1.usa.gov/1hpDJB1 or see the attached FDNY/OEM press release.

Notification Title: NY State Missing Vulnerable Adult - Thomas O'Brien (CW)
Email Body:
Notification issued 4/18/14 at 9:30 PM. The NY State Division of Criminal Justice Services has issued a Missing Vulnerable Adult Alert for Thomas O'Brien, male, white, 80 years old, from Nassau County, NY. Mr. O'Brien suffers from Alzheimer's, and is described as 6' tall, 200 lbs., with a hunched posture, wearing blue jeans, with a brown belt and black sneakers. Mr. O'Brien was operating a gray 2013 Honda CRV New York registration CSC-2672 and is known to frequent the Plainview Shopping Center, but may be in the NYC area. He may be in need of immediate medical attention. A photo is attached; if you see Mr. O'Brien, please call the Nassau County Police Dept. at 516-573-7347 or 9-1-1.

Notification Title: U.S. Small Business Administration Disaster Loan Outreach Center (DLOC) in East Harlem Closing (MN)
Email Body:
Notification issued 4/17/14 at 1:00 PM. US Small Business Administration (SBA) Disaster Loan Outreach Center at 108 E 116 St, MN, will close permanently at 6PM today. Those affected by the 3/12 building explosion still requiring loan assistance may call (800)659-2955, email disastercustomerservice@sba.gov, apply online at https://disasterloan.sba.gov/ela, or www.sba.gov. People who are deaf or hard-of-hearing may call (800)877-8339.

El Centro de Asistencia de Préstamos por Desastre de la Administración de la Pequeña Empres (SBA) ubicado en 108 E 116 St, MN cerrará definitivamente a las 6.00pm de hoy. Las personas afectadas por la explosión en el edificio del 12 de marzo que aún requieran asistencia pueden llamar al (800)659-2955, enviar un mensaje de correo electrónico a disastercustomerservice@sba.gov, presentar una solicitud en línea en https://disasterloan.sba.gov/ela, o visitar el sitio www.sba.gov. Las personas sordas o con problemas de audición pueden llamar al (800)877-8339.

Notification Title: U.S. Small Business Administration Disaster Loan Outreach Center (DLOC) Open in East Harlem (MN)
Email Body:
Notification issued 4/10/14 at 2:50 PM. The US Small Business Administration has opened a Disaster Loan Outreach Center at 108 East 116 St, MN, to assist residents/businesses impacted by the March 12 building explosion with navigating the loan process. Open 4/10 until 4/17. Hours: Mon-Fri (9AM-6PM), Sat (9AM-1PM), Sun (Closed)

Notificación emitida el 10 de abril de 2014 a las 3.00pm. Representantes de la Agencia Federal para el Desarrollo de la Pequeña Empresa de los Estados Unidos abrieron un Centro de Asistencia de Préstamos por Desastre en 108 East 116th Street en Manhattan para ayudar a los residentes y a las empresas afectados por la explosión en el edificio del 12 de marzo a completar solicitudes y cursar el proceso para obtener un préstamo. El centro estará abierto a partir de hoy jueves, 10 de abril hasta el jueves, 17 de abril. El horario de atención será de 9.00am a 6.00pm los días de semana y de 9.00am a 1.00pm el sábado. El centro estará cerrado el domingo, 13 de abril.

Notification issued on 4/3/14 at 7:45 PM. The Dept of Health & Mental Hygiene reports an ongoing measles outbreak in NYC, involving Northern Manhattan, the Lower East Side and the South Bronx. Twenty-five cases of measles have been confirmed since February, consisting of 12 children & 13 adults so far.

Measles is a highly contagious infection caused by a virus. Symptoms include a rash involving your whole body & high fever, as well as cough, red eyes, & runny nose lasting 5-6 days. The illness typically begins with a rash on the face & moves down the body, may include the palms of the hands & soles of the feet. Measles can spread easily through the air to unprotected individuals. If you suspect you have measles, call your medical provider before seeking medical attention to avoid exposing others.

Make sure your children have been vaccinated against measles. The first vaccine should be at 12 months old. Learn more: http://www.nyc.gov/html/doh/html/diseases/immmea.shtml

Notification issued on 2/22/14 at 12:40 PM. The Department of Parks & Recreation (DPR) and an independent contractor will conduct an aerial survey of the deer population over various parks in The Bronx from today, Saturday, February 22, to Saturday, March 1 between the hours of 6PM-1AM, to include Pelham Bay, Van Cortlandt, and Riverdale. The survey will consist of one (1) single-engine aircraft utilizing an infrared camera to measure the temperature difference between the deer and the surrounding environment. The aircraft will originate from and return to Morristown Airport (NJ), and will conduct the survey at an altitude of approximately 1,000 feet, travelling from the eastern portion of the borough westbound. The survey will ideally be conducted in one night, weather permitting.

Notification Title: Department of Buildings Snow and Ice Removal Advisory (CW)
Email Body:
Notification issued 2/19/14 at 2:25 PM. Due to warmer temperatures expected in the NYC area today, Wednesday, February 19, 2014 through the upcoming weekend, the Dept. of Buildings is reminding all property owners to safely remove ice and snow from roofs, overhangs and awnings. Water from melting snow that collects on roofs can present a threat to the structural integrity of a building if the accumulated weight becomes too great. 

Rain and warmer temperatures can increase the threat of ice dislodging and falling from buildings. Icicles could form and pose a threat to public safety if not promptly removed. Property owners have a legal responsibility to consider the safety of their buildings, and this obligation includes removing ice that may come loose during warm weather.

Please call 311 to report non-compliant conditions or 911 to report emergencies at construction sites or buildings. Please see the attached document for additional instructions and information. bit.ly/1e7X3B7

Notification Title: OEM Travel Advisory / Alt Side Parking Suspended (CW)
Email Body:
Notification issued 2/17/14 at 6:15PM. The NYC Office of Emergency Management (OEM) today issued a Travel Advisory for Tues, Feb 18. The National Weather Service has forecast 2-4 inches of snow accumulation starting after midnight tonight through Tues morning. The snow is forecasted to change to rain around noon as temperatures rise above freezing. Temperatures will be in the lower 40s Tues afternoon. The Dept of Sanitation has issued a Snow Alert for Tues at 3A. The plow tracker will be available tomorrow at nyc.gov/severeweather. The NYC Dept of Transportation, in conjunction with the Dept of Sanitation, today announced that Alt Side Parking regs will be suspended citywide this week, through Saturday, February 22, 2014, to facilitate refuse pickup and ongoing snow removal efforts. Parking meters remain in effect throughout the city.

Email Body: Notification issued on 2/12/14 at 6:15 PM. The New York City Department of Transportation, in conjunction with the Department of Sanitation, today announced that Alternate Side Parking Regulations will be suspended citywide on Thursday, Feb. 13, Friday, Feb. 14, and Saturday Feb. 15 to facilitate storm response and snow removal. There are no Alternate Side Parking Regulations in effect on Sundays, and as previously announced, Alternate Side Parking Regulations will also be suspended on Monday, Feb. 17 for Washington's Birthday/Presidents Day. Payment at parking meters will remain in effect throughout the City.

Notification Title: OEM Hazardous Travel Advisory/Winter Storm Warning - 2/13 & 2/14 (CW)
Email Body: Notification issued 2/12/14 at 5:40 PM. The New York City Office of Emergency Management (OEM) has issued a Hazardous Travel Advisory for Thu, 2/13, and Fri, 2/14. The National Weather Service has forecast a total of 8 to 12 inches of heavy, wet snow through Fri morning. A Winter Storm Warning will be in effect from midnight tonight until 6 AM Fri. The Dept. of Buildings is reminding property owners to de-ice public areas and safely remove snow from roofs, overhangs, and awnings. The buildup of wet snow and rain can present a threat to the structural integrity of a building. Property owners have a legal responsibility to maintain their properties in a safe condition. If ice and snow removal is not possible, property owners should rope off the unsafe area. For more information, please visit http://www.nyc.gov/severeweather & see the attached advisory.

Notification Title: Hazardous Travel Advisory/Alternate Side Parking Suspension - 2/5/14 (CW)
Email Body: Notification issued 2/4/14 at 2:15 PM. The New York City Office of Emergency Management (OEM) has issued a Hazardous Travel Advisory for Wednesday, February 5. The National Weather Service has forecast 2 to 4 inches of snow and accumulation through Wednesday afternoon; Northern Manhattan and the Bronx will see accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Moderate to heavy snow is expected late Tuesday evening into Wednesday morning before changing to a wintry mix of sleet and freezing rain during the day. Up to 1/4 inch of ice may accumulate before the sleet and freezing rain converts to all rain late Wednesday afternoon. Temperatures will be in the 30s. The plow tracker will be available tomorrow at 6:00 AM at nyc.gov/severeweather. Alternate Side Parking Regulations will also be suspended citywide on Wednesday, February 5, to facilitate winter weather preparations and snow removal. Parking meters will remain in effect throughout the City. For more information, please see the attached advisory.

Notification Title: UPDATE: Planned Military Aircraft Exercises over Hudson River Postponed - 1/30 (BX)
Email Body:
Notification issued on 1/28/14 at 7:00 PM. Update to earlier aircraft flyover notification: The U.S. Air Force has postponed the exercises originally scheduled to be conducted over the Hudson River in the Bronx and Lower Westchester on Wednesday, January 29th at 4:30am in preparation for Super Bowl XLVIII.  The exercise will now occur on Thursday, January 30th at 4:30am, and will consist of two (2) F-16 aircraft, one (1) Citation 550 aircraft and one (1) UH-60 helicopter (see attached) over the river at an altitude between approximately 5,000 and 7,000 feet.  While aircraft will not be able to be seen from the ground, they may be heard in affected areas.  The exercise is expected to last for approximately one (1) hour, as the aircraft will conclude their exercises at Farmingdale Airport (LI).

The sender included the following attachment:
https://phx-attachments.sendwordnow.com/Attachments.aspx?token=8bf022e0-b0a6-4338-848a-4101efb142d2

Notification issued 1/21/14 at 5:55 PM. The Metropolitan Transportation Authority (MTA) announced today that its regional railroads  Metro-North and the Long Island Rail Road  are reducing service after 8 PM tonight as snow accumulations make operating trains difficult. This is aimed at preventing trains from becoming stranded in accumulated snow, and to allow personnel to concentrate resources on trains that will continue to operate. The LIRR will reduce service on a branch-by-branch basis, consistent with its policy to curtail or suspend service if snow accumulations reach 10-13 inches. During rush hour, Metro-North will run a regular outbound evening rush hour schedule; however, service will be reduced after 8 PM. Customers who must travel should leave as early as possible and monitor http://www.mta.info for service status updates.

Notification issued 1/21/14 at 3:00 PM. On Wednesday & Thursday, January 22nd & 23rd, the filming of a TV series will simulate gunfire on private property in the vicinity of 1465 Manor Road, Staten Island, between 5pm and 10pm. Flares will also be set off on 1/22. NYPD and FDNY will be on site.

Notification Title: NYC DOE Press Release: After School and PSAL Activities Cancelled Today, 1/21/14 (CW)
Email Body: Notification issued 1/21/14 at 1:00 PM. From New York City Department of Education: Due to anticipated inclement weather conditions, after school programs and PSAL activities are cancelled today, Tuesday, January 21, 2014.  No other changes to the school schedule are being made at this time. Since severe cold weather and snow are expected to make roads slippery, we urge New Yorkers to exercise caution when traveling to and from schools. Safety is a top priority for the Department.

Notification issued 1/21/14 at 12:18 PM. Alternate side parking (street cleaning) regulations will remain suspended Wednesday, January 22, 2014, to facilitate snow removal. All other regulations, including parking meters, remain in effect.

Notification issued 1/21/14 at 9:47 AM. The NYC Office of Emergency Management (OEM) has issued a Hazardous Travel Advisory for today (Tuesday) and Wednesday due to anticipated weather conditions that will result in wet, slick sidewalks. Roadways could quickly turn icy. The National Weather Service has forecasted 8 to 12 inches of snow accumulation through Wednesday. Dangerously cold temperatures expected through Friday. Residents should drive slowly, monitor weather and traffic, use major streets or highways, and keep the name and number of at least one local towing service. Pedestrians should avoid slippery surfaces, dress in layers, and maintain a heightened awareness of cars, especially when crossing intersections. Please review the complete Hazardous Travel Advisory attached for additional details about the impending storm and precautions to take.

Notification issued 1/20/14 at 5:30 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Winter Storm Warning citywide from 12:00 PM Tue, Jan. 21 to 6:00 AM Wed, Jan. 22. The current forecast calls for 6-10 inches of snow accompanied by strong winds. For updates please visit: http://www.weather.gov/nyc.

Notification Title: Low-Flying Helicopter over Northern NJ & NYC, 1/21-1/27 (CW)
Email Body:
Notification issued on 1/20/14 at 4:00 PM. A helicopter may be seen flying at low altitudes over northern New Jersey and New York City from January 21-27, 2014, while aerial surveys are conducted in advance of Super Bowl XLVIII. Flyovers will occur only during daylight hours and they are estimated to take about three days to complete.  This a normal part of security and emergency preparedness. Photos of the helicopter and flight areas are attached.  The sender included the following attachment:
https://phx-attachments.sendwordnow.com/Attachments.aspx?token=3fbb461b-6ed8-4e31-a20c-39ff4136a0c7.

Notification Title: FDNY Street Alarm Box Outage - 9-1-1 Tapping Protocol (MN)
Email Body: Alert issued 1/14/14 at 5:30 PM. Due to the infrastructure failure affecting all Manhattan street alarm boxes, people who are deaf or hard-of-hearing should use the ''9-1-1 Tapping Protocol,'' from a land line (dial 9-1-1, wait four seconds, then repeatedly single-tap on mouthpiece of telephone for Police assistance; repeatedly double-tap for Fire/Medical assistance). For more info please visit: http://www.nyc.gov/html/mopd/downloads/pdf/emergency.pdf.

Alert issued 1/14/14 at 4:00 PM. Due to an infrastructure failure, all street fire alarm boxes in Manhattan are currently out of service. Verizon is currently working to repair the problem. Until further notice, please dial 9-1-1 to report all emergencies.

Notification Title: Bayonne Bridge Overnight Closures - ''Raise the Roadways'' Construction Project 2014 (SI)
Email Body: Notification issued 1/9/14 at 9:05 PM. Per the Port Authority of NY & NJ, the ''Raise the Roadways'' construction project will require overnight closures of the Bayonne Bridge in both directions through February 2014, on Mon thru Thurs from 9PM-5AM, and midnight Fri to 8AM Sat. There will be no overnight closures on weekends or holidays. During closure hours, all traffic will be diverted to the Goethals Bridge. For schedule updates, visit http://www.panynj.gov/bayonnebridge and sign up for email alerts. Register for Bridge & Tunnel Alerts at http://paalerts.com/. Call 511 or visit http://www.511NY.org or http://www.511NJ.org for the latest regional traffic conditions.

Notification Title: NYC OEM Extreme Cold Weather Notice (CW)
Email Body: Notification issued 1/6/14 at 8:10 PM. As temperatures are expected to drop well below freezing tonight & tomorrow, the NYC OEM reminds all New Yorkers that prolonged exposure to extreme cold weather can be deadly. The NWS is forecasting bitterly cold wind chills tonight, with overnight low temperatures between 5-8 degrees & wind chills of -15 degrees. Cold temperatures will continue on Tue with a high of 10 degrees & wind chills near -10 degrees. Overnight temperatures on Tue night will near 5 degrees with wind chills of -10 degrees. Temperatures will remain below freezing until Thurs, 1/9. Vulnerable populations, such as seniors & infants, are most at risk during extreme weather events. Check on friends, family and neighbors if you think they need help getting to a warm place. The NYC DOHMH encourages everyone to stay indoors as much as possible during this time period, & if your home lacks heat, get to a warm, safe place immediately. Report loss of heat or hot water to 311.

Notification issued on 1/6/14 at 4:35PM. With extreme cold conditions forecast to impact the Northeast, Amtrak will operate a modified schedule on the Northeast Corridor between Washington and Boston, as well as the Empire Line between New York City and Albany on Tuesday, Jan. 7, 2014.  For more information, visit http://www.amtrak.com/service-alerts-and-notices

Notification issued on 1/6/14 at 4:15 PM:  The New York City Department of Transportation, in conjunction with the Department of Sanitation, today announced that Alternate Side Parking Regulations will be suspended citywide tomorrow, Tuesday, Jan. 7, 2014, due to anticipated icing conditions resulting from the coming freezing temperatures. Payment at parking meters will remain in effect throughout the City.

Silver Alert issued on 1/1/14 at 11:49 PM. NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Marie Antoine (female, Black, 81 years old) from Flatbush Avenue and Farragut Road in Brooklyn. Mrs. Antoine was last seen at her residence on December 31, 2013 at approximately 1:00 PM. She is described as 5'5'' tall, 140 pounds, with black hair, and was last seen wearing a green sweater, a blue hat, black shoes, and carrying a black bag. She speaks French Creole and reportedly went missing while traveling to visit family in White Plains via public transportation. Two photos of the missing are attached. If you see Mrs. Antoine, please call 911.

Notification Title: Freezing Temperature Awareness / Check on Your Neighbors (CW)
Email Body:
Notification issued 1/2/14 at 10:35 PM. The National Weather Service is forecasting dangerously cold temperatures and wind chills tonight through Saturday morning. These conditions are dangerous to health and can worsen pre-existing medical conditions. Limit your time outdoors and dress in layers. Be sure to check on neighbors, particularly the elderly and medically frail. Report loss of heat/hot water, and un-domiciled individuals in need of sheltering and/or assistance by calling 3-1-1.

Avoid carbon monoxide poisoning by clearing snow from exhaust pipes before starting car engines, avoid running cars in enclosed spaces, and clear snow from the vents of combustion appliances. Also, remove flammable items such as clothing from heat sources and space heaters. Never heat your home with a stove or oven, and do not use kerosene or oil-burning heaters indoors. For more information visit http://www.nyc.gov/severeweather.

For more information, please see the attached press release.

Notification Title: Winter Weather Warning / Hazardous Travel Advisory / Alt. Side Parking Rules Suspended (CW)
Email Body: Notification issued 1/1/14 at 8:00 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Winter Storm Warning citywide from 6:00 PM Thu, Jan. 2 to 1:00 PM Fri Jan. 3. The current forecast calls for 6-8 inches of snow accompanied by strong winds. The NYC Office of Emergency Management (OEM) today issued a Hazardous Travel Advisory for Thu and Fri due to anticipated weather conditions that will result in wet, slick sidewalks; roadways could quickly turn icy. Residents should drive slowly, monitor weather and traffic, use major streets or highways, and keep the name and number of at least one local towing service. Pedestrians should avoid slippery surfaces, dress in layers, and maintain a heightened awareness of cars, especially when crossing intersections. Please note that the NYC Dept of Transportation, in conjunction with the Dept of Sanitation, will suspended Alternate Side Parking Regulations citywide tomorrow, Thu, Jan. 2, 2014, to facilitate snow preparations.

Silver Alert issued 1/1/14 at 1:00AM. NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Miguel Martinez, male, Hispanic, 90 years of age, from Woodbine Street and Cypress Avenue in Queens. Mr. Martinez is described as 5' tall, 140 lbs., with grey hair, last seen on 12/31/13 at 11:30 AM at 67th Avenue and Queens Boulevard in Queens. Mr. Martinez is wearing a yellow polo, yellow plaid shorts, and black sandals. He suffers from schizophrenia and Alzheimers. A photo is attached. If you see Mr. Martinez, please call 9-1-1.

Notification Title: Ed Koch Queensboro Bridge Permanent Lane Closure (CW)
Email Body:
Notification issued 12/24/13 at 4:15 PM. The New York City Department of Transportation (DOT) and New York City Police Department (NYPD) today announced that the single lane of Queens-bound outer roadway of the Ed Koch Queensboro Bridge will be closed to vehicular traffic from 9 PM through 6 AM each day, reducing the potential for speeding and other unsafe nighttime driving when the lane is underused, while providing sufficient capacity for traffic volumes on the inner and upper roadways at all times of the day. Taking effect at 9 PM on Monday, December 30, the nightly closure follows a review of existing safety measures, traffic volumes and travel speeds following the recent deadly crash at the Queens end of the outer roadway. For more information, please see the attached notice or visit http://www.nyc.gov/dot.

Notification Title: Update - Delays on the George Washington Bridge 12/20 to 12/23 (CW)
Email Body: Notification issued 12/20/13 at 9:35 PM. Update: The Port Authority of New York & New Jersey will close three of the four upper level lanes of the George Washington Bridge during the following dates & times: eastbound from 10 PM tonight until 10 AM tomorrow 12/21, in BOTH directions from 10 PM Saturday night 12/21 through 10 AM Sunday 12/22, and westbound from 9 PM Sunday night 12/22 through 5 AM Monday 12/23. Motorists traveling across the Hudson River in either direction during these times should consider alternate routes such as the Lincoln or Holland Tunnel, or use the lower level of the George Washington Bridge. Significant delays are expected during all weekend closures.

Notification Title: Travel Advisory/Alternate Side Parking Suspension for 12/14/13 (CW)
Email Body: Notification issued 12/13/13 at 6:00 PM. The New York City Office of Emergency Management (OEM) today issued a Hazardous Travel Advisory for Saturday, 12/14. The National Weather Service has forecast 4 to 6 inches of snow accumulation, expected to begin midday Saturday and change to rain in the late evening as the temperature rises. Rain will taper off overnight Saturday into Sunday, with a lingering shower possible Sunday morning, and freezing temperatures returning Sunday night. The Department of Sanitation has also issued a Snow Alert for Saturday at 8 AM. The plow tracker will be available tomorrow at http://www.nyc.gov/severeweather. The New York City Department of Transportation, in conjunction with the Department of Sanitation, has suspended Alternate Side Parking Regulations citywide tomorrow, to facilitate snow removal. Payment at parking meters will remain in effect. OEM encourages New Yorkers to take the precautions if traveling. For more information see the attached notice.

Notification Title: Blue Angels Aircraft Fly-Over - 12/13/13 (BK, MN, SI)
Email Body:
Notification issued on 12/12/13 at 2:20 PM. Tomorrow, Friday, 12/13/13, seven F/A-18 Hornet aircraft piloted by the U.S. Navy Blue Angels flight demonstration squadron will fly over the Hudson River to take promotional photos in front of One World Trade Center. Six aircraft will fly in formation and one will take photos. The flight will depart from Teterboro Airport in New Jersey at approximately 1:15 PM and will consist of three passes over the Hudson River heading south, then north, and south again at a height of approximately 1,000 feet. A photo of the aircraft flying in formation is attached.

Notification issued 12/10/13 at 5:45 PM. The New York City Office of Emergency Management (OEM) today issued a Travel Advisory for the Tuesday evening and Wednesday morning rushes. The National Weather Service forecasts freezing temperatures this evening; wet, slick sidewalks and roadways could quickly turn icy. Overnight temperatures will drop into the teens. Wednesday highs are not expected to go above the mid to low 20s. Temperatures are expected to remain below freezing until Saturday 12/14. OEM encourages New Yorkers to drive slowly, monitor weather and traffic reports, use major streets or highways, and keep the name and number of at least one local towing service. Pedestrians should avoid slippery surfaces, dress in layers, and maintain a heightened awareness of cars, especially when crossing intersections.

Notification issued 12/10/13 at 12:05 PM. NYPD will be conducting a practice drill tomorrow, December 11th, from 10:30 AM to 2:30 PM on the Roosevelt Island Tramway.  There will be no impact to Tram service during these drills.  Expect to see emergency personnel in the area. This is only a drill.

Notification Title: Missing Child Alert - Nijaey Hilton, F/B/5 (CW)
Email Body: Alert issued on 12/4/13 at 11:52 AM. A New York State Missing Child Alert has been issued for the disappearance of Nijaey Hilton, age 5, from Manhattan. Nijaey was last seen leaving her residence with her uncle, Ramel Robinson, on Tuesday, 12/3/13, at approximately 10:30 PM. Ramel Robinson is a 29-year-old male from Jamaica, Queens. The two may have left the location in a vehicle, but their destination is unknown. Nijaey was last seen wearing a grey school uniform consisting of grey stockings, a peach-colored sweater, a white blouse and a blue jacket with brown fur on the collar. Anyone with information regarding this missing child is asked to call the NYPD's Crime Stoppers Hotline at 800-577-TIPS. The public can also submit their tips by logging onto the Crime Stoppers website at www.NYPDCRIMESTOPPERS.com or texting their tips to 274637(CRIMES) then entering TIP577. Press release/photo: http://bit.ly/INwTvX

Notification issued 11/23/13 at 6:00 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Red Flag Warning for NYC and surrounding areas from 10 AM to 6 PM tomorrow, 11/24/13. A Red Flag Warning means a combination of dry brush and gusty wind conditions support fire danger. Exercise extra caution when using outdoor gas and charcoal grills. In addition, smokers should never carelessly discard cigarettes. Immediately report a brush fire to 911. For more information, visit http://www.erh.noaa.gov/er/okx/.

Notification Title: Planned Closure of the MN-Bound BK Bridge - 11/9/13 to 11/11/13 (CW)
Email Body: Notification issued 11/8/13 at 12:00 PM. Starting at 7:00PM on Friday November 8 until 6 AM Monday November 11, the Brooklyn Bridge will be closed to inbound/westbound traffic. Motorists proceeding inbound/northbound from south Brooklyn via the Belt Parkway and Gowanus Expressway should use 3rd Avenue/Hamilton Avenue into the toll facility Hugh L. Carey (formerly Brooklyn Battery) Tunnel as the best route into lower Manhattan. Motorists proceeding inbound/westbound from Queens/Long Island should consider the Williamsburg Bridge, or the toll facilities at the Robert F Kennedy Bridge or Queens Midtown Tunnel, for best route into Manhattan. Throughout this closure the Manhattan Bridge will accommodate 5 lanes of traffic inbound/westbound and two lanes outbound/eastbound. For more information please visit http://www.nyc.gov/dot.

Notification Title: Amtrak Service Suspended between Penn Station and New Rochelle, NY - (CW)
Email Body: Notification issued on 10/27/13 at 10:40 PM. Amtrak service is temporarily suspended between New York Penn Station and New Rochelle, New York due to an issue with the Pelham Bay Bridge. Crews are working to resolve the issue and restore service. Passengers who have paid but choose not to travel due to this service disruption can receive a refund or a voucher for future travel. Some reservations booked online can be modified or canceled on Amtrak.com or by using the free Amtrak mobile app. To be notified of major service disruptions resulting in delays of 60 minutes or more to multiple trains on the Northeast Corridor, follow @AmtrakNEC on Twitter. Passengers are encouraged to call 800-USA-RAIL or visit Amtrak.com/alerts for service alerts and passenger notices. Schedule information and train status updates are available at the Amtrak.com home page.

Notification Title: Planned Closure of MN-Bound BK Bridge 10/26/13 - 10/28/13 (CW)
Email Body: Notification issued 10/25/13 at 4:00 PM. As part of the ongoing New York City Department of Transportation (DOT) project to rehabilitate the Brooklyn Bridge, a full closure of the Manhattan-bound lanes of the bridge will be required this weekend, from 12:01 AM Saturday, 10/26 until 6:00 AM Monday, 10/28. During this 54-hour closure, all Manhattan-bound traffic will be redirected to alternate crossings, including the Manhattan Bridge, Williamsburg Bridge and the Brooklyn-Battery Tunnel, an MTA-tolled facility. Brooklyn-bound traffic will continue normally. The span's pedestrian path, bike path and pedestrian staircase at Frankfort Street in Manhattan will also remain open. As with recent, related closures of the bridge during this project, motorists are urged to avoid the area if possible and consider alternate routes. For more information, please see the attached document of visit http://www.nyc.gov/dot.

Notification issued on 10/21/13 at 6:00 PM. A moored (tethered) balloon will be launched over 80 South Street (Manhattan) to obtain photos for a building survey operation (weather permitting).  The allowable window for the balloon launch begins tomorrow, Tuesday, October 22nd, until Sunday, December 1st.  Please note that the launch will only take place on approximately three (3) or four (4) days during the allowable window (two hours/day during daylight hours).  The balloon will be flown at an altitude of approximately 950 feet and is approximately the size of a common weather balloon.

Due to police activity, the A and C trains are temporarily suspended in both directions between Chambers St, Manhattan and Broadway Junction, Brooklyn. The southbound F train is also bypassing Jay St. For more information and updates, please visit http://www.mta.info.

Notification issued 10/12/13 at 6:30AM.  The NYPD has issued a Missing Senior Notification for Robert Thomas.  Mr. Thomas is male, Black, 81 years old and was last seen on 10/11/13 at 6:00PM in the area of the Empire Casino (Yonkers).  He is described  as 5'8'', 155 lbs, brown eyes, with balding gray hair, beard and glasses. He was last seen wearing a plaid jacket and blue pants with white sneakers. A photo is attached. If you see him, please call 1-800-577-TIPS(8477) or visit http://WWW.NYPDCRIMESTOPPERS.COM

Notification Title: Planned Closure of W/B BK Bridge & E/B BQE - 10/12 to 10/14 (BK, MN, QU)
Email Body: Notification issued 10/11/13 at 11:14 AM. From 12:01 AM Saturday, 10/12 until 6 AM Monday, 10/14 the Brooklyn Bridge will be closed to inbound/westbound traffic. Motorists proceeding inbound/northbound from south Brooklyn via the Belt Pkwy and Gowanus Expwy should use 3rd Ave/Hamilton Ave into the toll facility Hugh L. Carey (formerly Brooklyn Battery) Tunnel as the best route into lower Manhattan. Motorists proceeding inbound/westbound from Queens/Long Island should consider the Williamsburg Bridge, or the toll facilities at the Robert F Kennedy Bridge or Queens Midtown Tunnel, for the best route into Manhattan. Additionally, the northbound/eastbound  Brooklyn Queens Expwy will be closed between Hamilton Ave and Cadman Plaza West during limited overnight hours on Saturday 10/12, Sunday 10/13, and Monday 10/14. For more details, please visit http://ow.ly/pILbt

Notification issued on 10/10/13 at 5:25 PM. Following an earlier suspension, southbound D train service in The Bronx has resumed between 161st Street - Yankee Stadium and Bedford Park. Expect residual delays.

Notification Title: Subway Service Suspension - D Train S/B ( BX)
Email Body: Notification issued on 10/10/13 at 4:00 PM. Due to NYPD activity, the D train is suspended southbound between 161st St - Yankee Stadium and Bedford Park, The Bronx. Expect delays and visit http://www.mta.info for updates.
Notification issued on 10/10/13 at 2:15 PM. Following a prior suspension, B train service has resumed between Prospect Park, BK and 145th St, MN. Expect residual delays.

Notification issued on 10/10/13 at 12:55 PM. Due to NYPD activity, the B train is suspended in both direction between Prospect Park, BK and 145th St, MN. Expect delays and visit http://www.mta.info for updates.

Silver Alert issued 10/9/13 at 2:25 PM. NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Antonia Castillo, female, Hispanic, 69 years old, from Flushing & Bushwick Avenues in Brooklyn. Ms. Castillo was last seen inside of her residence on Thursday, October 4th. She is described as 5' tall, 110 pounds, with short black hair. He was last seen wearing a red shirt and blue sweat pants and black shoes. Ms. Castillo suffers from Alzheimer's disease. No photo is available. If you see Ms. Castillo, please call 9-1-1.

Silver Alert issued 10/8/13 at 13:15 PM. NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Wilfred Thomas, male, Black, 86 years old, from New Jersey Avenue and Dumont Avenue in Brooklyn. Mr. Thomas is described as 5'5'' tall, 120 lbs, and was last seen wearing khaki pants, a green hat, and glasses at his residence at approximately 9:00 AM yesterday morning, 10/7/13. Mr. Thomas suffers from dementia. A photo is attached. If you see Mr. Thomas, please call 9-1-1.

Notification Title: Missing Child Alert - Avonte Oquendo, M/B/14 (CW)
Email Body: Notification issued on 10/7/13 at 10:23 PM: At the request of the New York City Police Department, a New York State Missing Child Alert has been issued for the disappearance of Avonte Oquendo, male, Black, 14 years old, with autism.  He was last seen leaving his school located at 1-50 51st Avenue in Queens on Friday, 10/4/13. Avonte is described as 5'2'' tall, 90 pounds, and was last seen wearing a grey stripe shirt, black jeans and black sneakers. Additional information, including a photo, is attached. Anyone with information in regards to this missing child is asked to call the NYPD's Crime Stoppers Hotline at 800-577-TIPS or 911.

Notification 10/5/13 at 6:25 PM. Following a prior suspension, L train service has resumed between Bedford Ave and Rockaway Parkway in Brooklyn. Expect residual delays.

Notification issued 10/5/13 at 4:00 PM. There will be a fireworks display off of Pier 16, in the East River near the South Street Seaport in Manhattan tomorrow, 10/6/13, at approximately 7:20 PM.

Notification Title: Update for 10/5/13 - Metro-North Railroad New Haven Line Restoration (CW)
Email Body: Notification issued 10/5/13 at 3:30 PM. MTA Metro-North Railroad announced today that full train service on the New Haven Line will resume Monday morning, October 7, following successful tests of a new electrical substation in Mount Vernon. For the remainder of this weekend, Metro-North will provide about 70% of normal New Haven Line service. For more information, please visit http://www.mta.info.

Notification issued 10/5/13 at 12:00 PM. Multiple street closures will be in effect citywide on Sunday, October 6th, 2013, from 7:30 AM to 6:30 PM, in support of the 2013 MS Bike Tour, including sections of Holland Tunnel (MN), George Washington Bridge (MN), Battery Park Underpass to the northbound FDR Drive/Harlem River Drive (MN), Henry Hudson Parkway (MN/BX) and Mosholu Parkway (BX). For more information, please visit http://bikenyn.nationalmssociety.org/site/TR?fr_id=21176&pg=entry or see attached route map.

Notification Title: PA-NYNJ Drill on the George Washington Br - 10/5 to 10/6 (MN, BX)
Email Body: Notification issued 10/5/13 at 10:00 AM. From 9 PM tonight, Saturday, 10/5/13 until 7 AM tomorrow, Sunday, 10/6/13, Port Authority of NY & NJ will conduct a full scale exercise on the George Washington Bridge simulating a fuel tanker explosion with multiple motor vehicle accidents. A large number of emergency vehicles from NJ and NYC will also be present. A full closure of the lower level of the GWB will be required in both directions during this time. However, the upper level will remain fully open in both directions during the exercise.

Notification Title: Traffic Delays due to Misplaced Tractor Trailer (MN)
Email Body: Notification issued 10/4/13 at 9:35 PM. Due to a misplaced tractor trailer, expect traffic delays on the northbound FDR Drive near East 61st St in Manhattan.

Notification Title: Traffic Delays due to Vehicle Accident (BK, QU)
Email Body: Notification issued 10/4/13 at 7:55 PM. Due to a vehicle accident, expect traffic delays on the Belt Parkway between Rockaway Parkway and Flatbush Ave in Brooklyn.

Notification issued 10/4/13 at 3:40 PM. Due to a continuing Con Ed power issue, a reduced Metro-North New Haven Line schedule will be in effect this weekend (Sat, 10/5 & Sun, 10/6). There will be hourly train service from all New Haven Line stations in both directions all day on Saturday and Sunday, with the exception of Metro-North's Direct New Haven Line service to the Meadowlands. Full service may be restored by Monday morning, 10/7. See full service details at http://bit.ly/S5Cxrf.
Notification issued on 10/3/13 at 8:35 AM. After an earlier incident, N/Q trains have been restored. Please expect residual delays.
Notification issued on 10/3/13 at 8:25 AM. Due to mechanical problems, northbound N & Q trains are terminating at 42nd Street. Please use alternate routes and expect delays.

Notification Title: Road Closure due to NYPD Activity (MN)
Email Body: Notification issued 10/2/13 at 3:15 PM. Due to police activity, expect traffic delays in the vicinity of W 23rd St and 9th Ave in Manhattan.

Notification issued 10/1/13 at 8:35 PM. Metro-North will operate additional trains on the New Haven Line starting Wednesday, October 2, due to an increase in power capacity to Con Edison's temporary substations. With this new schedule in place, Metro-North's capacity on the line rises to 65% of regular train service. See specific schedules at http://bit.ly/eGUVR, and service details at http://bit.ly/S5Cxrf. The interim limited solution provided by the temporary substations still does not provide full power capacity, and as a result, Metro-North still cannot operate full train service.
Notifcation issues on 10/1/13 at 12:36PM. Following an earlier incident, all PATH train service has been restored. Please expect residual delays.

Notification issued on 10/1/13 at 11:53 AM. Due to a signal failure, PATH service on the Hoboken-World Trade Center line, Hoboken-33rd St line and the Journal Square-33rd St line are currently suspended. Please use alternate routes and expect delays.

Silver Alert issued on 9/30/13 at 11:45 PM. NYPD has issued a Silver Alert for the disappearance of Richard Rosenthal, male, White, 87 years old, from Hicks Street and State Street in Brooklyn. Mr. Rosenthal was last seen wearing red sweatpants, a black coat, and white sneakers with no socks at approximately 3:45 PM today, 9/30/13, near Court Street and Pierrepont Street in Brooklyn. He is described as 5'5'' tall, 160 lbs, with gray hair and a thin build. Mr. Rosenthal wears a medical bracelet and suffers from dementia. A photo is attached. If you see Mr. Rosenthal, please call 9-1-1.

Notification Title: AMBER Alert Cancellation - Avanta Perez M/H/5 (CW)
Email Body: Alert issued 9/27/13 at 8:50 PM. The NY State Police have cancelled the AMBER Alert for Avanta Perez, male, Hispanic, 5 years old. For more information, please visit http://amber.ny.gov.

AMBER Alert issued 9/27/13 at 8:05 PM. NY State Police have issued an Amber Alert for the confirmed abduction of Avanta Perez, a 5 year old Hispanic male from Cortlandt, NY. Avanta Perez is described as 3'8'' tall, 50 lbs., with short brown hair and brown eyes, last wearing khaki pants and an aqua shirt. The suspect, Amanda Perez, is a Hispanic female, approximately 23 years old, 5'5'' tall, 135 lbs., with long brown hair and brown eyes, last seen wearing black pants, red flowered shirt and a black sweater. She is driving a gray 4-door sedan Honda Civic with NY license number DRT8361. The vehicle was last seen traveling on Route 9, possibly near the Bear Mountain area. The suspect was distraught and has threatened to harm the child and herself. A photo is attached. If either are seen, please call(866) NYS - AMBER or 9-1-1. For updates visit http://amber.ny.gov.

Notification Title: Fireworks at Roy Wilkins-Southern Queens Park - 9/28/13 (QU)
Email Body: Notification issued 9/27/13 at 3:00 PM. A fireworks display will occur at the Roy Wilkins-Southern Queens Park, at 177-01 Baisley Blvd, Queens at 10:00 PM on Saturday, 9/28/13. In case of inclement weather, the rain date is 9/29/13.

Notification Title: Hugh L. Carey Tunnel Closure - Tunnels to Towers Run 9/29/13 (CW)
Email Body: Notification issued on 9/27/13 at 12:15 PM. The Hugh L. Carey (formerly Brooklyn-Battery) Tunnel will be closed for several hours on Sunday, Sept., 29 for the annual Stephen Siller Tunnel to Towers Run. One tube will be closed 10 p.m. Sat., Sept. 28 through 3 p.m. on Sunday.  The remaining tube will carry one lane of traffic in each direction until 8 a.m., Sunday when both tubes will close for the event. Motorists are advised to use an alternate route.  For details, visit http://bit.ly/1fdjefM

She suffers from dementia. A photo is attached. If you see Mrs. Sepulveda, please call 9-1-1.

The NYC Department of Health & Mental Hygiene will continue to be offering free vaccinations tomorrow, 9/23, from 6PM - 10PM in regards to those possibly exposed to Hepatitis A from September 7th To September 19th from New Hawaii Sea Restaurant in the Bronx (1475 Williamsbridge Road). Patrons of New Hawaii Sea Restaurant between those dates should get a Hepatitis A Vaccine as soon as possible. For more information text HEPA to 877877 and visit http://www.nyc.gov/html/doh/html/home/home.shtml.

Alert issued 9/20/13 at 6:00 PM. The NYC Department of Health & Mental Hygiene warns patrons of New Hawaii Sea Restaurant in the Bronx of possible exposure to Hepatitis A from September 7th To September 19th. Customers who ate food from New Hawaii Sea Restaurant in the Bronx (1475 Williamsbridge Road) between those dates should get a Hepatitis A Vaccine as soon as possible. DOHMH will be offering free vaccinations this weekend. For more information text HEPA to 877877 and visit http://www.nyc.gov/html/doh/html/pr2013/pr033-13.shtml.

Notification issued 9/19/2013 at 2:30PM.  There will be 20-30 aircrafts flying single file out of Sky Manor Airport (Pittstown, NJ) at 1,100 feet down the Hudson River this afternoon at 3:30 PM. The aircraft will depart Sky Manor Airport, Pittstown, NJ at 3:00 PM and will enter the Hudson River near Alpine Tower. The aircraft will fly south over the Hudson River for approximately 15 minutes and depart to the west back to Sky Manor Airport. Please see attached photos for aircrafts.

Mr. Melendez was last seen leaving Bronx Lebanon Hospital located at 1650 Grand Concourse Avenue on Monday, September 16th, 2013 at approximately 9:45 AM.  He is described as being 5'9'', 125 lbs., with brown eyes, gray hair, gray mustache and a gray goatee. Email Body: Notification issued 9/16/13 at 3:30 AM. NYPD has issued a Missing Senior Notification for the disappearance of Norma King, female, Black, 67 years old, from 112 Road and 194 Street in Queens. Mrs. King was last seen wearing a purple shirt with black slacks, a black shoulder length wig, and glasses at approximately 6:30 AM on Friday, 9/13. She is described as 5'5'' tall, 150 pounds, and is known to take the Q3 and Q83 buses. If you see Mrs. King or have information regarding her whereabouts, please call 800-577-TIPS(8477) or visit http://www.NYPDCRIMESTOPPERS.com.

Notification Title: Commemorative Flight over Statue of Liberty - Sunday 9/1/2013
Email Body: Notification issued on 8/31/13 at 12:00 PM. The Air Power Museum in Farmingdale, NY, will conduct a commemorative honor flight (weather permitting) over the Statue of Liberty (Hudson River) tomorrow, on Sunday, September 1st at 1:00pm.  The honor flight will consist of six (6) historic aircraft--three (3) B-25's, one (1) P40, one (1) P47, and one (1) P51 (see attached photos)--circling over the Statue of Liberty twice.  Two (2) T6 aircraft (see attached photo) will accompany the group to photograph the activity.  The aircraft will depart from/return to Republic Airport in Farmingdale, NY. You may see low flying aircraft in the area. Please see attached photos.

Notification Title: Planned Closure of the MN-Bound BK Bridge 8/24/13 to 8/25/13 (CW)
Email Body: Notification issued 8/23/13 at 12:00 PM. As part of the ongoing New York City Department of Transportation (DOT) project to rehabilitate the Brooklyn Bridge, a full closure of the Manhattan-bound lanes of the bridge will be required for 36 consecutive hours this weekend, from 12:01 AM Saturday, 8/24 until 12:00 PM Sunday, 8/25. During this closure, all Manhattan-bound traffic will be redirected to alternate crossings, including the Manhattan Bridge, Williamsburg Bridge and the Brooklyn-Battery Tunnel, an MTA-tolled facility. For more information, please visit http://www.nyc.gov/dot or see the attached notice.

To reduce mosquito activity and the risk of West Nile Virus, the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene (DOHMH) will spray pesticide from trucks in parts of Queens between 8:15 PM tonight, 8/22/13, and 6:00 AM the following morning, weather permitting. In case of inclement weather, application will be delayed until Monday, 8/26/13, during the same hours. Spray areas will include parts of Auburndale, Murray Hill, Pomonok, Queensboro Hill, Cambria Heights, Laurelton, Springfield Gardens, and Saint Albans. For sprayings, DOHMH will use a very low concentration of a synthetic pesticide which, when properly used, poses no significant risks to human health; however, DOHMH recommends minimizing direct exposure, especially for people with asthma or other respiratory conditions. Email Body: Notification issued 8/3/13 at 4:00 PM. As part of the ongoing New York City Department of Transportation (DOT) project to rehabilitate the Brooklyn Bridge, a full closure of the Manhattan-bound lanes of the bridge will be required this weekend, from 12:01 AM Sunday, 8/4 until 5:00 AM Monday, 8/5, and next weekend, from 12:01 AM Sunday, 8/11 until 5:00 AM Monday, 8/12. Notification Title: Metro-North Hudson Line Suspended - Morning AM Service Plans
Metro-North Hudson Line Suspended - Morning AM Service Plans
Email Body:
Notification issued 7/19/13 at 2:30 AM. Per MTA, Metro-North Hudson Line Service will remain suspended until further notice due to a freight train derailment in the vicinity of Spuyten Duyvil station. 

For the remainder of the evening, bus service will operate between Marble Hill and Ludlow Stations, where customers will be able to connect with shuttle train service.

For Friday morning peak service, customers are urged to make alternate service plans.
Please listen for announcements at your station and continue to check news media and http://new.mta.info/mnr for updates.

Notification Title: DOHMH Heat Warning & Request for New Yorkers to Assist (CW)
Email Body:
Alert issued 7/18/13 at 8:35 PM. Due to this week's dangerous and continuing heat wave, the Health Department is asking New Yorkers to assist persons at risk for the effects of heat illness. These risks increase with each passing day and the intensifying heat. City agencies and nonprofit service providers are visiting the homes of vulnerable persons, and the Health Department is asking New Yorkers to assist this effort by checking on vulnerable relatives, friends, and neighbors, and to get them into a cool place or to medical attention if they are showing signs of heat illness. Signs include hot, dry skin OR cold, clammy skin; confusion or disorientation; nausea and vomiting; trouble breathing; rapid heartbeat; weakness and dizziness. For more information, please see the attached press release.

The sender included the following attachment:
https://phx-attachments.sendwordnow.com/Attachments.aspx?token=1c989b7d-d355-4682-90f0-63438bf48b6e

Notification issued on 7/18/13 at 1:00 PM. Due to continued high temperatures and heat indices, New York City cooling centers will remain open through Sunday, 7/21. Notification Title: AMBER Alert Update - Mario Danner (M/H/7 months)
Email Body: Alert issued 7/17/13 at 4:15 AM. Update regarding earlier AMBER Alert issued for confirmed abducted child, Mario Danner (male, Hispanic, 7 months old). Suspect Marina Lopez, a Hispanic female approximately 25 years old with brown hair and brown eyes standing 5'6'' tall and weighing 130 pounds, may be driving a tan, four-door, 1995 Lexus ES300 with New York license plate GEX1377. The suspect was last seen wearing a pink t-shirt and floral print shorts traveling on foot, possibly toward Shore Front Parkway in Rockaway, NY. Anyone with any information on this abduction is asked to call the New York City Police Department at (866) NYS-AMBER or dial 911 to provide information on a report or sighting. For updated information, visit http://amber.ny.gov.

Alert issued 7/16/13 at 11:00 PM. The New York State Police have issued an AMBER Alert for the confirmed child abduction of Mario Danner, a Hispanic male, approximately 7 months old with black hair and brown eyes. He is approximately 20 inches long and weighs about 25 pounds. Mario was last seen wearing a gray t-shirt and black shorts at 2090 7th Avenue in Manhattan.
Mario is believed to have been abducted by Marina Lopez, a Hispanic female. Lopez is approximately 25 years old with brown hair and brown eyes. She is approximately 5 feet 6 inches tall and weighs about 130 pounds. The suspect was last seen wearing pink t-shirt, floral shorts. 
The suspect is the child's non-custodial mother, who is bi-polar and has had recent outbreaks of violence. Anyone with any information on this abduction is asked to call the New York City Police Department at (866)NYS-AMBER or dial 911 to provide information on a report or sighting.

Notification issued 7/8/13 at 7:15 PM. Brookhaven National Laboratory with NYPD will begin installing air sampling equipment Tuesday morning as part of a study called Subway-Surface Air Flow Exchange. Air sampling will be conducted in parts of the Bronx, Brooklyn, Queens, Staten Island and in Manhattan. In addition, researchers will disperse low concentrations of harmless gases known as perfluorocarbons at several subway and street-level locations in Manhattan for 30 minutes only during the morning. Data from the study will help first responders to better understand how airborne contaminants can travel through the system and enable them to develop emergency responses based on the results. Please visit http://www.bnl.gov/s-safe/ for more information.

Notification issued 7/8/13 at 6:30 PM. On July 9 - 11, 2013 the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene (DOHMH) will aerially apply larvicide to key mosquito breeding areas in non-residential areas (mainly marshes and other large wetlands) of Staten Island, Queens and The Bronx to reduce the number of mosquitoes and the risk of West Nile virus. Application will be between 6AM and 7PM. In the event of inclement weather, larviciding may occur during the same hours on 7/10-7/12. A DOHMH helicopter will be used for these events. For more information: http://www.nyc.gov/html/doh/html/environmental/wnv-spray.shtml or: http://ow.ly/mHaUg

Notification Title: Solar-Powered Aircraft Flight near Statue of Liberty Sat 7/6 - Sun 7/7 (BK, MN, QN, SI)
Email Body:
Notification issued 7/5/13 at 5:00 PM. Weather permitting, a solar powered aircraft, operated by Solar Impulse, will conduct an overnight flight from Dulles Airport in Washington, D.C. to JFK Airport, NYC this weekend. Part of this flight involves passing the Statue of Liberty for a photo shoot, accompanied by a helicopter. The aircraft is expected to arrive at the Statue of Liberty at about 11:45 PM on Saturday evening, July 6, 2013, take photos for approximately one hour, and then land at JFK Airport in Queens at 2:00 AM Sunday morning, July 7, 2013. The aircraft operates at a very slow speed of about 25 knots (29 mph). A photo of the aircraft is attached.

Notification issued on 7/1/13 at 1:08 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a Flash Flood Warning citywide until 3:00 PM. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other drainage areas and low lying spots. Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground. For the latest information visit: http://www.weather.gov/nyc.

Con Edison has asked customers in these areas to curtail use of non-essential appliances. If you lose electricity, call ConEd 1-800-75-CONED(26633). Please see attached press release for more information.

Notification issued on 6/25/13 at 8:00 AM. The National Weather Service has issued a Heat Advisory for New York City until 6PM tonight. These conditions are dangerous to health. Avoid strenuous activity. People without air conditioning, older adults, and people with chronic health conditions are most at risk. Cooling centers will be open. For locations, hours, and more information on avoiding heat illness, visit http://www.nyc.gov/oem or call 311. In addition, the New York State Department of Environmental Conservation has issued an Air Quality Health Advisory for New York City until 11:00 PM. Active children, adults, and people with lung disease, such as asthma, should reduce prolonged or heavy exertion outdoors. For more information, visit http://www.dec.ny.gov/cfmx/extapps/aqi/aqi_forecast.cfm?CFID=783270&CFTOKEN=81338190&jsessionid=UFnIyHeNvQe7zuUU0zvXrHm

Email Body: Notification issued 4/26/13 at 2:45 PM. Following an earlier incident, PATH train service has been restored between Hoboken and the World Trade Center, as well as to the Newport, New Jersey station. For more information please visit: http://www.panynj.gov/path/maps.html.

Notification Title: Planned Closure of the MN-Bound BK Bridge (CW)
Email Body: Notification issued 4/26/13 at 12:00 PM. As part of the New York City Department of Transportation (DOT) project to rehabilitate the Brooklyn Bridge ramps and approaches, a full closure of the Manhattan-bound lanes of the bridge will be required this weekend, from 12:01 AM Saturday, April 27 to 6 AM Monday, April 29. During this 54-hour closure, all Manhattan-bound traffic will be redirected to alternate crossings, including the Manhattan Bridge, Williamsburg Bridge and the Brooklyn-Battery Tunnel, an MTA-tolled facility. For more information please visit http://www.nyc.gov/dot.

Notification issued 4/26/13 at 1:57 AM. Following a prior closure, the exit ramp from the eastbound Nassau Expressway onto the northbound Van Wyck Expressway in Queens has been reopened. Expect residual delays.

Notification Title: Increased Risk of Brush Fires - Citywide
Email Body: Notification issued 4/3/13 at 10:00 AM. The NWS has issued a Red Flag Warning for NYC and surrounding areas. A Red Flag Warning means a combination of dry brush and gusty wind conditions support fire danger. Exercise extra caution when using outdoor gas and charcoal grills. In addition, smokers should never carelessly discard cigarettes. Immediately report a brush fire to 911. For more information, visit http://www.erh.noaa.gov/er/okx/.

Mr. Nieves is described as a Hispanic male, 5'3'' tall, 160 pounds, with black and grey hair and brown eyes. He was last seen near his residence at Palmetto Street and Central Avenue in Brooklyn on March 13, 2013 at 4:30PM. Notification issued 03/12/2013 at 12:15 PM. FDNY will be training on a Roosevelt Island Tram cabin every Wednesday for the next 7 weeks, beginning March 13th, 2013 through April 24th, 2013 from 10 AM to 2 PM.

Tram service will not be disrupted.

Notification issued 03/12/2013 at 8:00 AM. The H.M.S. Edinburgh, a British Naval Destroyer, will conduct three ceremonial gun salutes during a welcome ceremony at Pier 7 (Port Authority Pier) in Brooklyn today, March 12th between 7:30 PM  8:00 PM. The gun salutes will consist of three (3) separate groupings of two-round bursts that will be fired during that time period. 

In addition, The H.M.S. Edinburgh will arrive into port at approximately 10:00 AM today, and will depart on Sunday, March 17th at approximately 2:00 PM. During these days and times (weather permitting), the ship will be accompanied by a Lynx helicopter (see attached photo) taking photos of the ships movements.

Notification Title: Planned Closure of MN-Bound BK Bridge (BK & MN)
Email Body: Notification issued 1/11/13 at 8:15 PM. This weekend, the Brooklyn Bridge will be fully closed to Manhattan-bound traffic for 54 consecutive hours. The closure begins at 12:01 AM on Saturday, 1/12/13, through 6:00 AM Monday, 1/14/13. Brooklyn-bound traffic will be maintained, which will access the bridge from Pearl St or Centre St using a contra-flow configuration. There will be additional access via the Park Row ramp from Frankfort St. This ramp will be available only from 6:00 AM Saturday, 1/12/13 until 1:00 AM Sunday, 1/13/13, and from 9:00 AM to 11:00 PM on Sunday, 1/13/13.

Notification Title: MTA LIRR Full AM/PM Rush Hour Service to Resume (CW)
Email Body: Notification issued 12/8/12 at 6:10 PM. The MTA Long Island Rail Road (LIRR) will operate full morning and evening rush hour service beginning Monday, December 10, as a result of Amtrak restoring the signal system capacity in one of its two flood-damaged East River tunnels. This will mark the first full service rush hour for the LIRR since Hurricane Sandy hit six weeks ago. The LIRR's off-peak service continues to operate on a regular schedule throughout the LIRR system.

Notification Title: Odd-Even License Plate System for Gasoline Purchases Rescinded (CW)
Email Body: Notification issued 11/23/12 at 3:40 PM. The odd-even license plate system for gasoline purchases will be rescinded as of 6:00 AM tomorrow, Saturday, 11/24/12. The City had originally established the odd-even license plate system on Friday, 11/9/12, to reduce wait times at gas stations and then allow the regional fuel supply to recover from damage caused by Hurricane Sandy. Currently, more than 85 percent of NYC gas stations are operational, and the available supply of gasoline is expected to increase. For more information, please visit: http://www.nyc.gov/portal/site/nycgov/menuitem.c0935b9a57bb4ef3daf2f1c701c789a0/index.jsp?pageID=mayor_press_release&catID=1194&doc_name=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nyc.gov%2Fhtml%2Fom%2Fhtml%2F2012b%2Fpr439-12.html&cc=unused1978&rc=1194&ndi=1

Notification issued on 11/23/2012 at 12:00 PM: Starting on Monday, November 26th, the Great Kills Ferry is expected to run for eight weeks as storm recovery efforts continue, and will include six trips leaving a newly-constructed landing at Great Kills between 6:00 am and 9:00 am, bound for Pier 11 at Wall Street and continuing on to 35th Street, and six return departures in the afternoon, between noon to 6:15 pm. For more info, please visit http://www.nyc.gov/dot

Nahzir was last seen wearing a black sweater and blue pants. Child was not wearing shoes. Mlyliah Edwards is a Black female, approx 2 years old with black hair and brown eyes. Mlyliah was last seen wearing white shorts and a black sweater. Child was not wearing shoes.The suspect is Fitz Edwards, a Black male, approx 29 years old with braided,black hair and brown eyes. He is approx 6 feet tall. The suspect was last seen wearing a dark jacket. Suspect is slim build. Suspect is believed to be armed with a handgun. The suspect is expected to be traveling in a grey 4-door sedan 2005 Honda Accord with NY license plate number EWV6599. If the child or suspect are seen please contact 911

Notification Title: UPDATE: Alternate Side Parking Regulation Suspensions (BK)
Email Body: Notification issued 11/16/12 at 3:00 AM. Effective immediately, alternate side parking regulations are reinstated in portions of Brooklyn Community Board 6. Regulations are reinstated east of, but not including, Hamilton Avenue. Previously announced suspensions continue until further notice. For more information and updates, please visit http://www.nyc.gov/dot.

Notification Title: UPDATE: Alternate Side Parking Regulation Suspensions (CW)
Email Body: Notification issued 11/14/12 at 5:00 PM. As of tomorrow, Thu 11/15/12, Alternate Side Parking (street cleaning) regulations will be suspended indefinitely in Brooklyn Community Boards 6 and 18, joining previously-announced suspensions in Brooklyn Community Boards 13 and 15, and Queens Community Board 14. The additional suspensions includes sections of Red Hook, Carroll Gardens, Cobble Hill, Park Slope, Gowanus, Boerum Hill, Bergen Beach, Canarsie, Mill Basin, Flatlands, Marine Park, Georgetown and Mill Island. The previously announced suspensions include Brighton Beach, Coney Island, Gravesend, Seagate, Sheepshead Bay, Manhattan Beach, Gerritsen Beach, Broad Channel, Breezy Point and the Rockaways. These localized exemptions will facilitate storm recovery in areas with the most extensive damage; street cleaning regulations in other areas of the city are reinstated as of today, 11/14/12. For more information and updates, please visit http://www.nyc.gov/dot, or see the attached maps.

Notification issued 11/13/12 at 6:20 PM. The New York City Department of Transportation announced that Alternate Side Parking regulations will be in effect in most of the city on Wednesday, November 14. It remains suspended indefinitely in Brooklyn Community Boards 13 and 15 and Queens Community Board 14 to allow for continued storm cleanup. These Community Boards include Brighton Beach, Coney Island, Gerritsen Beach, Gravesend, Manhattan Beach, the Rockaways and Sheepshead Bay. For more information/maps, please visit http://www.nyc.gov/dot.

Notification Title: Hugh L Carey Tunnel Partially Re-opened

Notification Title: NYC Gas Rationing Regulations & Service Map (CW)
Email Body: Notification issued 11/8/12 at 8:30 PM. The Mayor has established a temporary Odd-Even License Plate System for gasoline purchases in NYC. Starting at 6:00 AM tomorrow, Friday 11/9/12, and continuing until further notice, passenger automobiles with license plates ending in an even number or zero shall only purchase fuel in NYC on even numbered days of the month. Passenger automobiles with license plates ending in an odd number shall only purchase fuel in NYC on odd numbered days of the month. License plates not ending in a number shall be deemed an odd number license plate. For more information and updates visit http://www.nyc.gov. A Comprehensive Service Map is also available at http://www.google.org/crisismap/2012-sandy-nyc. The map includes gas station locations, shelters, warming centers, and food distribution sites.

Notification issued 11/6/12 at 9:20 PM. The National Weather Service has issued a High Wind Warning for 2 PM tomorrow, 11/7 through 4 AM Thursday, 11/8. Cold weather, rain and high wind gusts are expected. All NYC parks and beaches will be closed from 12 PM tomorrow, 11/7 until 12 PM Thursday, 11/8. The National Weather Service has issued a Coastal Flood Warning for NYC during the high tide cycles Wednesday afternoon through Thursday morning. For the most up to date NYC area weather forecasts, visit http://weather.gov/nyc. If you live in a low-lying or a flood prone area, an area already impacted by the recent hurricane, or have concerns about flooding, consider staying with friends or family outside affected areas or in a NYC evacuation shelter. Shelters in NYC are currently open. Locate the nearest shelter by visiting http://on.nyc.gov/SlpGEx. If you need assistance with transportation, call 311 for help. All evacuation centers have at least one wheelchair accessible entrance.

Notification issued 11/3/2012 at 9:50 PM. Per the City's Department of Health and the Department of Environmental Protection New York City's tap water remains safe, however Breezy Point's distribution system is privately managed and operated, and will not affect the rest of the City's drinking water. Breezy Point is isolated by back flow prevention devices and has not negatively impacted the City Water Supply. Water is being restored, where it can, in Breezy Point for the express purpose of firefighting and fire suppression. Because of what is assumed to be extensive damage to the water pipes in Breezy Point, the water is not drinkable, even after boiling. The City will be testing the water to determine the extent of the problem, but for now it's important that residents of Breezy Point not drink the water.
