Notification issued 10/31/2012 at 7:15 PM. Due to flooding and power related shutdowns caused by Hurricane Sandy, wastewater treatment plants and pumping stations have discharged untreated wastewater into New York City waterways. The New York City Department of Health & Mental Hygiene advises that direct contact with the Hudson River, East River, New York Harbor, Jamaica Bay and the Kill Van Kull for recreational activities such as swimming, canoeing, kayaking, windsurfing, or any other water activity that would entail possible direct contact with the water should be avoided until further notice. 

The Department of Environmental Protection is responding to the impacts caused by Hurricane Sandy on its wastewater treatment facilities and will monitor water quality conditions through testing to verify when these water bodies are safe for recreational uses.

Notification issued 10/28/12 at 6:00 PM. Due to the impending storm, the following regional transit service disruptions will take effect until further notice: the Staten Island Ferry will operate until 8 PM tonight from St. George Terminal, SI, and until 8:30 PM from Whitehall Terminal, MN, tonight, after which service will be suspended. Some NY Waterway routes will be disrupted; East River Ferry service is suspended through tomorrow, 10/29 (http://www.nywaterway.com). NJ Transit has implemented a gradual system-wide shutdown of all bus, rail, light rail and Access Link service starting at 4 PM today (http://www.njtransit.com). All PATH train service and stations shut down at 12:01 AM Monday, 10/29 (http://www.panynj.gov/path). Amtrak will cancel Northeast Corridor service north of NYC starting at 7 PM tonight, and nearly all service on the eastern seaboard on Monday, 10/29, including Acela Express, Northeast Regional, Keystone and Shuttle trains (http://www.amtrak.com).

Alert issued 10/28/12 at 11:45 AM. New York City has ordered a MANDATORY EVACUATION of Zone A, the Rockaways, Hamilton Beach, and City Island. To determine if you live in New York City evacuation Zone A and/or to find an evacuation center, please go to nyc.gov and click on the Hurricane Evacuation Zone Finder or contact 311

Notification issued 10/28/12 at 10:35 AM. Due to expected severe weather conditions, all MTA subway, and commuter rails suspended citywide as of Sunday, 10/28/12 at 7:00 PM. MTA bus service will be suspended as of Sunday, 10/28/12 at 9PM. Currently, there is no estimated time for service restoration. For updates visit: http://www.mta.info

Notification Title: Storm Update: Shelters Open 10/28/12 at 9 AM (CW)
Email Body: Notification issued 10/27/2012 at 9:15 PM. There is no evacuation order for New York City at this time; however, if you live in a low-lying area and have concerns about flooding or prolonged power loss, consider staying with friends or family outside the affected area. If you cannot stay with family or friends, shelters will be available in public schools around the city and will open at 9 AM tomorrow, 10/28. To find out what zone you live in and the location of your nearest shelter visit the OEM Evacuation Zone Finder at http://gis.nyc.gov/oem/he/index.html. If you cannot reach a shelter by yourself, call 311 for help with transportation. All evacuation centers have at least one wheelchair accessible entrance. Additionally, all NYC parks are closing at 5 PM tomorrow, 10/28. Learn more about preparing for coastal storms with the attached OEM Ready New York: Hurricanes and New York City Guide.

Notification Title: OEM Encourages New Yorkers to Prepare for Severe Weather (CW)
Email Body: Notification issued 10/27/2012 at 8:20 PM. The New York City Office of Emergency Management is closely monitoring the impending storm and wants to remind all New Yorkers to make sure their emergency plans are up to date and ready to go. For the latest information on the weather and emergency preparedness visit http://www.nyc.gov/severeweather. Encourage your friends and family to receive the latest information by signing up for Notify NYC at http://www.nyc.gov/notifynyc.

Notification issued 10/22/12 at 3:55 PM. This is an update for the Paerdegat Basin oil spill. The Boating Advisory has been lifted for the Paerdegat Basin. The New York State Department of Health continues to advise the public to avoid eating any fish or crabs from Paerdegat Basin or 200 yards from the mouth of Paerdegat Basin (in a small portion of Jamaica Bay) until further notice. The public is also reminded that all New York City waters are closed to shell fishing (harvest of clams, mussels, oysters or scallops). For additional information please visit: http://www.dec.ny.gov/press/86369.html

Email Body: Alert issued 10/5/12 at 7:05 PM. The New York State Police Farmingdale have cancelled the AMBER Alert for Robert Rodriguez.

Notification Title: AMBER Alert - 9 y/o Hispanic Male (Farmingdale, NY)
Email Body: Alert issued 10/5/12 at 6:45 PM. The New York State Police have issued an AMBER Alert for the confirmed child abduction of Robert Rodriguez, a 9 year old white male. He is 4' tall, 50 lbs., with brown hair and green eyes. The child has autism. He was last seen in Farmingdale, NY. The suspect is a white male, 31 years old, 5'9'', 180 lbs. For the most up to date information, visit http://amber.ny.gov. If you have any information, please dial 911.

Notification Title: Closures of the Manhattan Bound Brooklyn Bridge (BK)
Email Body: Notification issued 10/5/12 at 12:00 PM. As part of the New York City Department of Transportation (DOT) project to rehabilitate the Brooklyn Bridge ramps and approaches, a full closure of the Manhattan-bound lanes of the bridge will be required for two full weekends. From 11:59 PM Friday, October 5 to 6:00 AM Monday, October 8, and again from 11:59 PM Friday, October 12 to 6:00 AM Monday, October 15. During these two 54-hour closures, all Manhattan-bound traffic will be redirected to alternate crossings, including the Manhattan Bridge, Williamsburg Bridge, and the Brooklyn-Battery Tunnel, an MTA-tolled facility. For more information please visit www.nyc.gov/dot.
